loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 22-year-old, married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as a determined and straightforward person. She operates a retail business, where she sells household goods, i.e., cooking fat, sugar, soap, drinking chocolate, and the like. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is the high rent she pays for her business premises.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock, including sugar, bread, soap, and other items. Her business goal is to excel within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to build her own business premises.

loans.use: to add stock, including sugar, bread, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She describes herself as motivated. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds to buy enough clothes to stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a bigger business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her living standards. 

This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: to add to her stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a 45-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to buy stock of tailoring materials. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fabric, threads and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a financially stable business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy fabric, threads and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 3 children between the ages of 9 and 13. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking gas. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local residents. She says that her biggest business challenge is a lack of enough funds to increase her stock. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to increase her stock. Her business goal is to have a financially stable business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will excel. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking gas.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria, 55, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother. She together with her children manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Victoria maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products of popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s costs are lower than those in the catalog and these are the profits that dealers have as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, Victoria is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Victoria hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Khatun

texts.en:
Khatun is a talented woman from Ejmiatsin town. She rents a small space in the center of the town where she provides different rental services for wedding ceremonies (dresses, cars, accessories, etc.). Due to the hard and tireless work that Khatun does, her store is well known among people in the town. 

Khatun lives with her husband, parents-in-law, and two children. 

Now by applying for this loan, Khatun would like to purchase supplies needed for her store. As this is Khatun's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. 

The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

Khatun will be very grateful to all lenders for supporting her business.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for providing rental service for wedding ceremonies

loans.name: Gyulnara

texts.en:
Gyulnara is from Lernamerdz village, in Armevir region. She lives with her sister. Her three sons are migrant workers in a neighboring country. Gyulnara's sons help her financially from time-to-time, but her main income comes from agriculture. Gyulnara cultivates greens and sells the harvest locally.

Realizing the need for a greenhouse in the winter season, Gyulnara asks this loan. The loan will help her to renovate the greenhouse and enlarge the cultivation of greens. As this is Gyulnara's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. The loan will greatly assist this hard-working woman to increase the income from agriculture. As a result, she will be able to make her dream come true: her sons will come back, and they will live together.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse and enlarge the cultivation of greens

loans.name: Gaza  Al-Hodeida Group

texts.en: Gaza Al-Hodeida is a group of four poor women from Al-Hodeida, Yemen. Lolah is a married woman and has children. She has been operating a clothes business so that she can assist her husband with covering their family`s expenses. Lolah's most important challenges are to work hard to earn extra income and to improve her business structure. She is receiving a loan from AMB to buy clothes for expanding her business. She thanks Kiva lenders for financing the first loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for expanding her business.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 48 years old, and lives in Logan Town. She’s married, and her husband is a businessman; they have seven children between the ages of 10 to 26.  Three of them attend school.

Roseline has been operating a shop for the past five years where she sells soft drinks and used clothes. She says sometimes she experiences loses, but not all of the time.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks and used clothes for her business. 

She hopes to extend her business in other local markets and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and used clothes for her business

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is 49 years old and lives in Long Town with her husband, who is a driver, and six children ages between 14 and 32. Only three are in school. 

She has been running a shop where she sells rubber dishes such as pans, cups, buckets, tubs, etc. She says with her business, she has been able to send her children to school. She started this business by selling for her friends. 

Aba is requesting a loan to buy more rubber dishes such as pans, cups, buckets, tubs, etc. for her business. 

Her plans are to expand her business even more and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more rubber dishes such as pans, cups, buckets, tubs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 31-year-old lady who lives in Buchanan with her husband and 3 children.  All her three children are in school and live at home.  

For 5 years now she has been involved in business, presently selling fish in the local market.  She was helped by a friend to start this business, which is how she makes a living. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business.  She hopes to build a new home for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 36 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has five children ages 2 to 14, all of whom attend school and live at home. She is a 2nd grade dropout. For the past nine years she has been selling coal. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal for her business. She wishes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business

loans.name: Zenije

texts.en:
Zenije is a first time client of VisionFund Albania. She has been in the livestock activity for about twelve years now, selling raw milk to a nearby dairy farm. As soon as the loan officer told her that she needed to be photographed, she ran to the cows inside the stable and said: “I want you to take me a picture here inside with my cows. I love them and I feel they love me too, because every time I pet them, they come closer to me and rest their heads against my body, reassuring me that they are fine with me contacting them."

Zenije is a mother of twins and is requesting a loan to buy furniture for her bedroom. "We have no bed and we sleep on the floor; no matter how much we try to cover the floor by putting rags and then a very old mattress on it, it is extremely cold. All these past years we did sleep the same way, but me and my husband are growing older and it has become difficult dealing with these sleeping conditions," continued Zenije.

loans.use: to buy a  cheap bed and other furniture as they cannot handle sleeping on the cold floors any longer

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Moath is a 20-year-old single young man from a  village called Alyamon near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Moath's family works in agriculture, They have a peice of land where they plant olive trees. It is a good business, but seasonal.
 
Moath is a student at a local university where he studies Information technology, and is in his second year. He would like to finish his studies and find a job to help his family with part of the monthly expenses. 

Moath took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. 

By taking this loan, Moath will be able to complete his studies and gets a BA degree. 

Moath appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is a successful fishmonger in Elmina, located in the Central Region. She has been educated till the end of the junior high school. She is married and has two children. Her husband is currently unemployed. Charity has been working in this business for some years now. As the sole provider in the family, she is responsible for paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Charity's loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her fishing business and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 27 year old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and one young daughter in a simple house in the city. Raed works as a teacher with a low income in a local school. Raed is a master student in a local university. He studies Mathematics. He would like to finish his studies and take the master degree to improve his living conditions.

Raed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Raed will be able to complete his studies. Raed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad is a 43 years old, married and lives in Rafah city with his wife and two young children, a son and a daughter, in a simple house. Ziad works as an employee in a local firm but earns only a low income. He is a master's student in a local university, where his field is commerce. He would like to finish his studies and get his degree because this will allow him to improve his living conditions. He has requested a loan from FATEN to pay the university fees for this semester because this will allow him to complete his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with four children, and all go to school. She has one additional family member (late brother’s child). 

She sells sweet and yellow bananas on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for five years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from cleaning Kampala city council roads. 

She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of sweet and yellow bananas. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring of starting to sell other types of food and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying utility bills, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of sweet and yellow bananas.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 50-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and six children. His wife is a bakery owner, and with her income she is able to support her family in cooperation with him. 

Mohamad earns his living from his business, which consists of selling used metal products. His products are placed on a small territory in which he is investing. 

Presently, Mohamad is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase more metal products. He desperately wants to expand and improve his business by increasing his sales and earning a higher income. At this stage, Mohamad is facing a bad financial situation and truly needs to overcome that period and keep on well-supporting his family.

loans.use: to purchase more metal products.

loans.name: Carolina Lilia

texts.es: La Señora. Carolina tiene 35 años tiene una hijita  de 10 años,  se dedica a la venta de calzados de distintas edades que se encuentran en la zona de Villa Adela,  este préstamo es el primero que ha tomado con la institución la señora Carolina va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería de temporada como variedad de calzados al por mayor por las fiestas de fin de año para surtir su negocio ya que esta es la época de mucha demanda, la señora Carolina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que muchas personas se dedican al mismo rubro, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Carolina is 35 years old and has a 10 year old daughter.  She sells shoes of different types in the Villa Adela zone.  This will be her first loan and she will use the money to buy seasonal merchandise, such as shoes in quantity for the upcoming end of year festivals to stock her store, as this is when her demand is highest.  Carolina faces challenges in her business, such as competition because many people work in the same field.  She will use the benefits to continue buying merchandise to stock her business.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Nancy Narcisa

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 49 años, es soltera, y  no tiene hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Nancy trabaja en la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y a la crianza de pollos patos y pavos para incrementar la economía de la familia. El cultivo que más sobresale es la siembra de maíz,  además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas, los productos vende en San Carlos.

El socio solicita el crédito para la agricultura la compra de hericidas, fertilizantes, abonos y balanceado para los animales.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia. 

Los desafíos que enfrenta la falta de dinero para salir de viaje.
texts.en:
Nancy is 49 years old, single, and does not have children. She lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

She is a member of the rural solidarity group “Asociación 10 de Septiembre” [“September 10 Association”], which is located in Lechugalito, a “recinto” [a small rural settlement] in the canton of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.

Nancy works in agriculture, growing corn and raising chicks, chickens, ducks and turkeys to meet her family’s household expenses. She excels the most at her corn crop. She sells her products in San Carlos.

Nancy is requesting this loan to buy herbicides, fertilizers and manure for her corn crop and to buy balanced feed for her animals. Her goal is to make money for her family. One challenge she faces is a lack of money for travel.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizers and manure for her corn crop and to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Nargis is very kind person. She has a business in the capital of Tajikistan. She sells fabrics in a local market. Nargis is a married parent of 4 children. Her husband is a driver. She always tries for the well being of her family and that’s why she has worked hard for 10 years at the local market. Nargis wants to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy fabrics. From the profit, she is going to buy new technologies for her household. She awaits your support and in advance thanks you for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is from Gandzaqar village of Tavush region. He lives together with his big family which consists of 8 people: Davit himself, his mother, his twin brother and his sisters, his sister-in-law and two nephews. Together with his family, Davit has been involved in agriculture. They keep livestock (pigs, chickens, and turkeys) and cultivate different types of fruits and vegetables (corn, potatoes, greens, plums, apples, and pears). The whole family works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it locally. Davit's sister-in-law works at local village school but her salary as a teacher is too low for sustaining the family's living. So realizing the importance of agricultural income for his family, Davit would like to enlarge it. He asks for this loan to purchase two more pigs and forage for feeding the livestock.

As this is Davit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. The loan will be a great support for Davit and he will be very thankful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for two pigs and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from Gandzaqar village where she lives together with her husband and son. Her family has been involved in agribusiness for many years. The farm that they run includes two pigs, chickens and also arable land where they cultivate different types of fruits and vegetables (corn, potatoes, and greens and plum, apple, nut and pear trees). Anna and her family are working hard to gather a good agricultural harvest and sustain a successful farm. 

Anna has now applied for this loan for financial support. She would greatly like to enlarge her livestock by two mother pigs and purchase forage for feeding them. As this is a first loan for Anna, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. The loan will be a huge support for Anna and her family and they will be very grateful to lenders.

loans.use: to pay for two mother pigs and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Agneta

texts.en:
Agneta is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds to buy enough stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of charcoal. She hopes that, in the future, she will excel.  She will use the anticipated profits to support her family.

loans.use: to add to her stock of charcoal.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old, from Naivasha and he is married. They have a child who is six years old.

John has a fruit-vendor business that he has been running for the past two years and has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy bananas to add to his stock. He is optimistic that his business will do well and he will use the profits made to pay school fees for his child.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to add to his stock.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 44 years old, from Naivasha and is married to Nelly. They have seven children who are in school.

James has a family business that he has been doing for many years. He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings. 

He hopes to be the top farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Domitilah

texts.en:
Domitilah is 32 years old, from Naivasha and is married. She and her husband have two children who are aged between 15 years and two years old. 

Domitilah is a fruit vendor and has been in the business for the past five years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy more tomatoes to add to her stock. She is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan.

Domitilah hopes to open a wholesale for tomatoes in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes.

loans.name: Volcanes De Coronel Group

texts.es:
Nolvia, quien aparece de las primeras a la izquierda de la fotografía con lentes en su cabeza, pelo ondulado y una gran sonrisa, blusa azul y cartera cruzada; pertenece a l Banco Comunal Volcanes de Coronel, en el cual sus socios tienen variados negocios tales como la venta de gafas, joyas, venta de ropa nueva y usada, venta de verduras y cosméticos. Nolvia tiene su negocio hace dos años en donde vende mermelada artesanal pan integral y hace poco integro la banquetería. Aprendió hace mucho tiempo ya que una tía le enseño a hacer mermeladas y pan integral. Aunque en época de colegio ella también vende almuerzos a profesores, lo cual también ayuda a su economía. El gran desafío que Nolvia tiene ahora es poder concretar su sueño de tener todo para banquetería, vajillas, cubiertos, lindos manteles, copas; ya que está recién comenzando y le ha ido bastante bien, es por eso que ahora será su gran desafío.
El dinero que solicita lo ocupará para comprar frascos para mermeladas y además todo lo necesario para concretar su sueño de banquetería. Lo que más le agrada de participar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de poder compartir en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Nolvia is the first one on the left in the photograph; she has wavy hair and a big smile, and is wearing glasses on her head, a blue blouse, and a purse across her chest.  She belongs to Volcanes de Coronel Communal Bank, the members of which have a variety of businesses, including selling glasses, jewelry, selling new and used clothing, selling vegetables, and selling cosmetics.

Nolvia has had her business for two years.  She sells homemade jam and whole wheat  bread, and recently started catering.  Her aunt taught her to make jam and bread a long time ago.  Nolvia also sells lunch to teachers during the school year, which helps her finances.

Nolvia's big challenge now is being able to firm up her dream of having all her catering supplies: dinnerware, silverware, nice tablecloths, and glassware.  It's challenging because she has just begun and it's going fairly well for her.

Nolvia will use the money she's requesting to buy jam jars and everything she needs to firm up her catering plans.

What she likes most about participating in Fondo Esperanza is the meetings.

loans.use: to buy supplies, jars, and tableware

loans.name: Shirin

texts.en:
Shirin is a 45-year-old mother of three adult children. She has an exclusive clothing store in her town where regular and new customers know they can find excellent quality and top professionalism. Shirin sells suits, dresses and on order specialty items. Unfortunately several years ago her husband ran into financial difficulties. Shirin succeeded in moving the family out of these problems and bringing their bank account from being limited by the bank. 

Shirin needed this loan to assist in paying for a new line of specialty dresses and other items. Due to her family’s past banking history, this small loan made the difference in being able to bring the stock on time at an excellent price.

Shirin wants to see her business grow, so that one day she does not have to rely on loans when new stock is needed. She loves bringing beauty into the lives of her customers.

loans.use: to assist in paying for a new line of specialty dresses and other items.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en: Mzia is 41 years old, married and lives in the village of Shorapani with her husband, two little daughters and mother-in-law, who gets monthly assistance from local government. Mzia's husband is an artisan and also gets a veteran's pension, which brings in 350 GEL per month. The family grows crops and raises goats and cattle, but its income isn't enough to meet all basic needs. That is why Mzia decided to start her own business and is requesting a loan for 1,900 GEL to buy silver jewelry at wholesale prices to resell in retail markets. Her loan was submitted under a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo which allows people to start or re-start businesses. It is obvious that the family's financial needs are significant, but Mzia and her husband work hard to meet them and give their children a better life. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 49 years old and lives in Buchanan. She’s married and has four children between the ages of 19 and 30; they are attending school and live at home. Her husband is a driver. 

For the past eight years, she has been in the charcoal business. She enjoys the buying from her customers, and the profit she makes.  It makes her proud of her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. 

She hopes to build a house for her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mukhran

texts.en:
Mukhran is a 21-year-old young man from the village of Tskalporeti. He lives with his sister and mother, who is disabled and gets an invalid pension of 150 GEL monthly. Mukhran is a really hard-working man and is highly involved in agricultural activities. He has one milk cow and a small part of its production is sold locally. He also takes care of cattle. The family belongs to the poor category, as they don't have any significant income to meet their basic needs. 

Mukhran's credit requests were rejected several times, as he was unable to satisfy their requirements. He received this credit in the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo - the Start-Up Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With this loan of 2,000 GEL, Mukhran will open a metal workshop, buy all the needed tools and equipment, and get private orders. Mukhran thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and it's the only business of this kind in the area. After the metal workshop is opened, the family will have a stable income which enables them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future. With the support of the Start-Up Program, Mukhran will get the opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle his financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a metal workshop

loans.name: Wubu

texts.en:
Wubu is 40 years old and she is residing in the surrounding community of Airport. She is married and has 5 children aged between 8 to 20 years old. Her children are in currently attending school and living at home. 

For the past 19 years Wubu has been baking and selling bread. Some problems she faces is loss, but most of the time she realizes profit. She started this business by selling for her mother and lately, she established her own business. She sells six days in a week, spending 8 hours each day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, etc, for her business. Her plan is to build a house. Wubu likes to thanks the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, etc, for her business.

loans.name: Korpo M.

texts.en:
This is Korpo M. from Liberia. She lives in Sinkor area. She is 27 years old and she and her fiancée live together, along with 2 children ages 3 and 11. Both of the children are in school and live at home. Korpo's fiancée works as a driver. Korpo M. completed 12th grade before she decided to do business. 

Over the past 5 years now, she has been selling rice, pepper, oil, etc. in the local market. She sells for eight hours from Monday to Saturday. She describes herself as a hard working woman. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, and oil, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build her house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper and oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Tehmine

texts.en:
Tehmine is from Yeghegis village of Vayots Dzor region. She lives there with her parents and has already been involved in agriculture for 2 years. Tehmine keeps chickens and a cow. Tehmine is a teacher by profession and works at a local school. She does her work with great love and pleasure and is able to earn additional income for her parents.

Realizing the importance of agricultural income for her family, Tehmine would like to enlarge her farm. She has applied for this loan of USD 1,500 in order to be able to purchase forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season. Tehmine took a loan from a local financial institution before, but because of the hard financial conditions of the family, she wasn't able to pay it back on time.

However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Tehmine was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

The loan will greatly assist Tehmine to continue running her farm successfully and she will be very grateful for the loan.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock during the winter season.

loans.name: Ugilkhan

texts.ru: Угилхан 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Угилхан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Угилхан занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Все дети и супруг помогают по хозяйству. Семья у Угилхан дружная и трудолюбивая, дети успевают учиться и помогать родителям. Супруг -водитель, занимается услугами предоставления такси между селами. Благодаря упорному труду Угилхан и посильной помощи ее детей, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Угилхан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Угилхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также намерена сделать капитальный ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Ugilkhan is 54 years old, she is married and she and her husband are raising 6 children. Ugilkhan has high school education and, as her  family's main income, she works rearing animals, having started 13 years ago when she bought cattle for 10,000 Kyrgyz soms. All her children and her husband help on the farm. Ugilkhan's family is friendly and hardworking - the children have time both to study and help their parents. Her husband is a taxi driver, driving people from village to village. 

Thanks to Ugilkhan's unyielding hard work and all the work her children have been able to give, they currently have 1 dairy cow and 15 sheep on the farm. Their monthly income is 7,500 soms. With the aim of further developing her farm, Ugilkhan asked the microfinance bank Bai Tusum and Partners for a loan to buy sheep, in order to fatten them up and sell them at the market for a higher price. Ugilkhan plans to spend the extra income gained from the loan on increasing the quantity of cattle at home and she also is planning to do a big rebuild on their house.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Nelly  Rosario

texts.es:
Nelly es una mujer trabajadora de Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos el mismo que se encuentra ubicado al Noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha, tiene 32 años es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos por los que día a día lucha para darles un buen futuro. Anteriormente estuvo casada pero la mala relación con su cónyuge la llevaron a la separación, por lo que tuvo que buscar la manera de abastecer los gastos del hogar.
Ella se dedica a la fotografía, locución, edición de audio y video también es animadora de programas, esta actividad es la que día con día entrega el sustento a su familia, cuando su esposo la dejó fue un golpe muy duro, que ella lo superó con su esfuerzo diario 
Trabaja un promedio de 10 horas diarias, por lo que le queda poco tiempo libre, pero ella como toda madre responsable aprovecha el poco tiempo libre para pasar tiempo con sus hijas haciendo deporte.
Esta actividad se  le dificulta por la edición de los videos ya que no cuenta con el equipo adecuado para hacerlo, es por esto que solicita un préstamo para adquirir este equipo que seguramente le brindará la oportunidad de atender a más clientes y por lo tanto incrementar sus ganancias.
Su más grande sueño es tener su casa propia y tener todos los equipos necesarios y realizar su trabajo desde la comodidad de su casa. Nelly agradece a Fundación Alternativa por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada para crecer en su actividad.
texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking woman from the San Miguel de los Bancos settlement, located in the north western part of the Pichincha province.  She is 32 years old and the single mother of four children for whom she works hard daily to provide them a good future.  She was married but had a bad relationship with her husband and it led to her separation and she had to find a way to pay her household expenses.

She does photography, voice, audio and video editing and she is also a program promoter and does this every day to support her family.  When her husband left, it was a hard blow and that she overcame through her daily effort.

She works ten hours a day, which leaves her little free time, but as a responsible mother takes advantage of it to spend time playing sports with her daughters.  Editing videos is difficult for her because she doesn’t have the proper equipment so she is asking for a loan to buy this equipment that will certainly provide her with the opportunity to serve more customers and increase her earnings.

Her greatest dream is to have a home of her own and have all the necessary equipment and be able to do the work from the comfort of her home.  Nelly is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for the support and help they have given so she can do this.

loans.use: to buy video editing equipment.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, madre soltera de dos hijos ya independientes. Tiene 56 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada (ropa, gaseosas etc.). Inicio este negocio hace varios años, con una pequeña pulpería, luego fue adquiriendo productos para surtir su negocio. Hoy en día cuenta con un negocio próspero y con una amplia clientela. Su meta próxima es invertir en la infraestructura de su vivienda. Solicita un crédito para comprar: gaseosas de todos los sabores, pantalones camisa, entre otros, con el fin de cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que crecerá su negocio y ofertar aún más productos. Su plan futuro es seguir creciendo con su negocio y mejorarlo cada vez mejor.
texts.en:
María is a native of Granada, a single mother of two independent children. She is 56 years old. She is a businessperson who sells various products like clothing and soft drinks. She started business a few years ago with a small store and then she acquired products to stock her store. 

Today she has a prospering business with a large clientele. Her next goal is to invest in the infrastructure of her home. María is requesting a loan to buy soft drink of all flavors, pants, shirts, etc. in order to meet her client's demands. She believes the loan will be of great assistance as it will expand her business and she will be able to offer more products. Her future plan is to continue expanding her business and improving it all the time.

loans.use: to buy all flavors of soft drinks, pants shirts, etc.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 20 year old married man from Nablus city. He lives with his wife and one daughter in a simple house in the city. Rami works as an employee  with a low income in a local firm. He is also a student in a local university. He studies commerce. He would like to finish his study and take the BA degree to improve his living conditions.

Rami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Rami will be able to complete his study. Rami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25 years old single man from Qalqila city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. Mohammad's brother works as an employee  with a low income in a local firm. Mohammad is a student in a local university. He studies Physiotherapy. He would like to finish his studies and achieve the BA degree to improve his living conditions.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay for university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to complete his studies. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Abdel Hameed

texts.en:
Abdel Hameed is a 27 year old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and three young kids; two sons and one daughter. Abdel works as an employee in a local firm and he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Abdel and his wife would like to improve the family's living conditions by buying all the neccessary items. 

Abdel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to provide his family with hot water during winter without any further costs. Abdel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 38 year old married man from Khanyounis city. He lives with his wife and two young kids; one son and one daughter. Eyad works as an employee in a local firm and he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Eyad and his wife would like to improve the family's living conditions by buying all the necessary items. 

Eyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Eyad will be able to provide his family with hot water during winter without any further costs. Eyad  appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is 29 years old, married and lives in Rafah city with his wife and seven young children, four sons and three daughters. He works as an employee in a local firm but earns a low income. He and his wife would like to improve the family's living conditions by securing a loan to buy a solar hot water heater. This will allow them to have hot water during winter without any costs.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Even though she did not receive any formal education, Adjoa is a successful fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market and smokes it to sell in Elmina, in the Central Region. She has been actively involved in this business for many years now. Adjoa is married and has two children. Her husband is currently unemployed. As the sole provider in the family, she is responsible for paying the family's utility bills and their children’s school fees. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen owns a restaurant in her village. She has had some education since she is a class six lever. Helen is married  and has eight children.

She prepares and sell ‘fufu’ (made of cooked cassava and plantain which is pounded into smooth round balls), ‘banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste), and cooked rice which is served with a vegetable, fish, and meat stew. She sells to individuals around her locality, Twifo Praso. She has been involved in this business for some years.   

The income from her business normally go towards helping her pay her children’s school fees and utility bills. She has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers for her food. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited working capital. 

Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice, cassava, plantain and other ingredients for the preparation of food. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Helen wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity for education to further distance their family from poverty. 

Helen is pictured in front of her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, cassava, plantain, and other ingredients for the preparation of food.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man. He has been working in the construction field since he was 17 years old. 

He specializes in painting work; he works on a freelance basis, and has two part-timers helping him to achieve the work tasks. 

Khodor is seeking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., as he wants to buy business tools and purchase a metal stepladder. 

Khodor states that this acquirement will surely ease his operations, and make them safer, as the tools are produced with metal that can handle this type of work.

loans.use: to buy more tools and purchase a metal stepladder

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is a junior high school graduate. She is a petty trader. She sells tubers of yams at Abura, located in Cape Coast. Her business has grown substantially since she began some years ago. 

Afia is married and has two children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses, food and their children’s school fees. Afia wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory level, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of yams. 

In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory level, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of yams.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 56-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband, who works as an employee at a gas company. As for her, she has been working as a tailor for the past ten years, and she is pretty endowed at performing her tasks. 

Currently, she is looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase tailoring machinery and textiles. 

Amina is terribly requiring increasing her financials, as in addition to paying the heavy life expenses, she has her sister who is very sick, and she is in charge of paying her medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring machinery and textiles.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 29-year-old Lebanese married woman who is living with her husband and two children who are attending school. 

Faten has worked as a tailor since 2010. She’s much endowed and has gained a good number of customers asking for her services. 

Today, she’s looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to enlarge her business and increase her productivity by purchasing additional tailoring tools and supplies. She estimates that the loan will help her increase her profits by a minimum of 10%.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring tools and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Rene

texts.es: La Señorita Maria tiene 20 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de medicina, trabaja para pagar sus estudios se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante, estudia en la universidad privada  de Bolivia, este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución,  la Señorita Maria va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar cómo pagar las mensualidades correspondientes a este semestre para terminar sus estudios. que durara el tiempo 5 años, La Señorita Maria enfrenta retos en su estudios que son el tener que trabajar y estudiar a la vez, vive en la zona  de Blanco Galindo su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es tener un lugar de trabajo estable para poder desempeñarse como profesional y también tener un consultorio y poder atender a mucha gente que no cuenta con recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Maria is 20 years old and single. She is studying Medicine. She works to pay for her studies, selling clothing door to door. She studies at la Universidad Privada de Bolivia (UPB). This is her first loan with the institution. Maria is going to use this loan for the various expenses that her studies entail such as the monthly installments she pays this semester for her studies. She is in a five year program. 

Maria has a number of challenges in her studies such as having to work and study at the same time. She lives in the Blanco Galindo neighborhood. Her desire on graduation is to have stable employment to practice as a professional. She also wants to have a consulting office to take care of many people who do not have the economic resources to see a doctor.

loans.use: to pay her monthly installments for her studies.

loans.name: Gabriela Del Socorro

texts.es: Gabriela joven trabajadora, intenta salir adelante con su familia que la conforma su esposo, su hijo de dos añitos que ingresara a la escuela dentro de poco tiempo, Gabriela aun habita en casa de su madre, se empeña bastante en su labor para ahorrar y poder empezar a realizar su casita  para independizarse con su familia, la que espera a futuro baya creciendo, se dedica al comercio vendiendo productos variados como zapatos, ropa, accesorios para el cabello  entre otros demandados por su clientela. Gabriela solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando los productos mencionados que le ayude a  mejorar las ventas.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a hardworking young woman. She is trying to get ahead with her family, which is made up of her spouse and her two-year-old son who will be enrolling in school soon. Gabriela still lives in her mother's home, and she works hard enough at her job in order to save and to begin to build her home to live independently with her family. She hopes that her family will continue to grow in the future. 

Gabriela works in commerce, selling a variety of products like shoes, clothes, hair accessories and other items in demand by her clientele. Gabriela is requesting this loan in order to invest in her business, buying the products mentioned before. This will help her to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy accessories, shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a twenty-four-year-old married woman with two children (one in school) living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells secondhand clothes and has been in this business for five years. Her other side income is from her cocoa garden, where she sells the products to agents in Bundibugyo. 

She is challenged by the high transport costs to move to different markets and seasonal customers. She wishes to expand her business into new markets and educate her children.

Margret is requesting for a loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Mirian Suyapa

texts.es: Doña Mirian, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos, ella y su familia vive en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Hace muchos años que se dedica a vender frutas como sandias, naranjas, manzanas, uvas, mangos, bananos etc., papas y otras verduras. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa dedicándole todo el tiempo necesario ya que es su fuente de ingresos familiar. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 10,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar más frutas frescas de la temporada como manzanas, uvas, peras, bananos, sandias, y otros para vender. Su plan es seguir manteniendo su negocio y que crezca cada dia mas para un bienestar familiar
texts.en: Mirian is 38 years old, married and has five children.  She and her family live in the town of Puerto Cortes.  She has always been a merchant and has been selling fruits such as watermelon, oranges, apples, grapes, mangos, bananas, etc. potatoes, and other vegetables for many years.  She does this from her home and puts in all the time required, since this is her source of family income.  The loan she is asking for is her second cycle and she is asking for 10,000 Lempiras to buy more seasonal fresh fruit such as apples, grapes, pears, bananas, watermelons and others to sell.  Her plan is to continue maintaining her business and grow it daily for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Philip's Group

texts.en:
Philip, a member of Bidii Group in Kakamega North District, is pictured here in a group of eight One Acre Fund group leader farmers who represent a total of 79 individual One Acre Fund farmers. Philip has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is shown standing on the right in the photo with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.						

Philip, whose work provides for his three children, is 40 years old and has been a farmer for 10 years. The community and other farmers know Philip as friendly, hardworking, reliable and trustworthy. He is also involved in his community groups such as the men's group, savings' group and the prayer group.  Philip described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

Philip first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. He joined in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds so as to earn enough to feed the family. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Philip plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Philip’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and has been able to feed the family.  

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Philip and the Bidii Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund provides ongoing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is shown standing on the left.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses is a member of this group in Kakamega North District.  He is pictured here in a group of 6 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 72 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  

Moses has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative, and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving inputs for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.

Moses is 37 years old, and has been a farmer for 18 years.  Moses works as a farmer to provide for his five children.  The community and other farmers know Moses as hardworking and experienced farmer.  Other than farming, he is also involved in community groups such as the men's group and the savings group.  Moses described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

Moses first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Moses joined One Acre Fund to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, and earn enough to feed the family.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and as an active community member, he wants to help more farmers.  

Moses plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to buy a cow.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Moses’s own life was improved because he has more farm training, was able to save money, and feed the family. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Moses and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ebtisam's Group

texts.en:
Ebtisam is a young Iraqi woman. She is 27 years old, married, and a mother of 2 children.With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Ebtisam is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income, and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Similarly to many women in her area that is still considered to be a conflict zone, she learned her skills at a young age and has gained 10 years of experience in making dresses for women and children, and in making smaller fabric household items. Many women started their small scale business activities like this, responding to the lack of goods in the area. 

Ebtisam would like to make her home based sewing workshop a little more productive with improved equipment and an improved work scheduler. She would like to buy a new sewing machine with functions that will allow her to work with better quality materials newly available in her area; she would also like to buy a small generator that will allow her to better plan and manage her work time without the constant interruptions caused by frequent power cuts in her area due to lack of infrastructure. 

To be able to make these purchases, Ebtisam is taking a group loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a small generator

loans.name: Doris Yesenia

texts.es: Doris, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos con quienes reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Hace 6 años que Doris estableció una pulpería, vende granos básicos, refrescos, churros, galletas, dulces, embutidos lácteos y otros productos en ristras. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 21,000 lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos y otros abarrotes, con el propósito de aumentar las ventas y las ganancias. Sus metas son mejorar el negocio para ayudar a sus hijos a graduarse y poder mejorar su casa..
texts.en:
Doris is 37 years old and a single mother. She has four children, with whom she lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortés. Six years ago Doris started a small grocery store, from which she sells basic grains, soft drinks, chips, cookies, candy, cold cuts, dairy products and other products sold in packets.

Doris is requesting this loan of 21,000 HNL to buy food products such as basic grains, dairy products, cold cuts and other groceries to increase her sales and profits. Her goals are to improve her business to help her children graduate, and to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy food products such as basic grains, dairy products, cold cuts and other groceries to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew, now 27 yeard old, is able to support his elderly parents. His livestock business is doing well, thus he has improved his cash flow. Andrew has successfully paid off his previous loan. He has now advanced a second loan of KES 45,000, which will facilitate the purchase of more livestock for resale.

Andrew plans to use the increased proceeds to diversify into crop farming.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 41-year-old, married man. He has three children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a business, where he decorates cars with stickers for a small fee. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are vehicle owners. He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of enough funds.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy tools for decorating motor vehicles. His business goal is to expand, within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy tools for decorating motor vehicles

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a youth client from Iraq. He is 19 years old and lives with his four brothers and his parents. Ahmad, his father, and two of his brothers together provide the family income.

Ahmad owns a shop where he sells and repairs laptops. He also sells video games and provides software services for his customers. Ahmad established his business in 2012, and has good experience in what he practices. He is well-known in his neighborhood, and has an excellent reputation.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to renovate his shop. 

He is aiming to grow his business more and expand his shop in the future so he may increase his profits and make more income for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 37 years old and married. She lives in Buchanan, with four children between 12 and 15 years old. She runs a shop in her community, where she sells charcoal by the bag at retail price. She enjoys her business, because it keeps her busy and generates money.

She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal by the bag, for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal by the bag, for her business.

loans.name: Promise

texts.en:
Promise is 40 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children between the ages 8 and 14; all of them attend school. 

Since 2008, she has been operating a small shop where she sells clothes, slipper, etc. Sometimes she has less customers, but most of the time she makes lots of profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes, slippers, and other items to expand her business. 

In the future she hopes to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes, slippers, and others items to expand her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 34 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a local businessman; they have three children, ages 9 to 12.  All of them live at home. 

For the past two years, Rebecca has been selling frozen pig feet & chicken in the local market. Sometimes she buys at a very high price and she realizes a very low profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase one carton of pig feet and one carton of frozen chicken for her business. 

In the future she plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one carton of pig feet and one carton of frozen chicken for her business.

loans.name: Shahane

texts.en:
Shahane is married and has two children. She is from Verishen village. Her husband is a furniture maker and Shahane  is a lecturer at Goris State University. For tackling financial hardships she has also been  involved in agriculture for six years. She keeps livestock of 10 pigs, 20 chickens, and seven cows. She makes different agricultural products and sells them to local retailers. 

To enlarge her business and improve her farm Shahane requested a loan from SEF International, which she will use to purchase two cows and renovate the barn. She had already taken a loan from a local financial institution, but was unable to pay it back. Thanks to recent hard work, Shahane and her husband were able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and renovate the barn

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 26 years old and lives in Liberia, near the country's airport. She is married and the mother of two children, who are six months and 7 years old. Her older child attends school. For the past three years, Rachel has earned a living by running shop where sells used clothes. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned how to sell from her friends. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending eight hours each day on her business. She appreciates her business and the ability it gives her to earn money. Her goals for the future are to build a house and educate her children. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes to sell. She would like to thank BRAC Liberia for its continuing supports.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en: Vachagan lives in Goris town with his wife, who lives off a pension. Vachagan works as a taxi driver and also has been involved in beekeeping. He keeps 25 colonies of bees, which give him high-quality honey which he sells at local open markets. He works hard to provide good living conditions to his wife, and is requesting this loan to buy five pigs and forage for feeding his livestock. He once took out a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to his hard work in the recent times, Vachagan was able to increase the number of beehives that he keeps, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments for this loan. He has requested this loan under a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. Our second-chance loan program provides help to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit products. This loan is a new hope for Vachagan to enlarge his agribusiness and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy five pigs and forage to feed his livestock.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Doña Irene es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco, de 43 años de edad. Casada y madre de tres hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida, gaseosas y jugos. Inicio su negocio hace un año con la venta de comida tales como: Enchilada, Tacos, Repochetas entre otros; poco a poco fue incrementando el negocio con más productos. Su meta próxima es cancelar las deudas pendientes y que el negocio siga prosperando. Solicita el crédito para la compra de productos varios tales como: Gaseosas, Carne, Verduras entre otros, con la finalidad de preparar los diferentes platillos que ofrece. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para ofrecer una amplia variedad de comidas a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es seguir trabajando para que el negocio siga creciendo, y poder ofertar otro tipo de comidas.
texts.en:
Irene is a native of the city of Boaco. She is 43 years old, married and the mother to 3 children, now independent. She is a businessperson, who sells meals, soft drinks and juices. She started her business with the sale of food like enchiladas, tacos and reprochetas (tortilla based local food). Little by little she has increased her business by adding more products. Her next goal is to pay off her debts and continue making her business prosperous. 

Irene is requesting the loan to buy products like soft drinks, meat, vegetables, etc. with the goal of preparing the various dishes she makes. She estimates that the loan will be very useful to help her offer a wide range of meals for her customers. Her future plans are to keep working so her business will continue to grow and be able to offer other types of food.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products like soft drinks, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Souknah

texts.en:
Souknah is a 42-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children who are attending school. 

She cooperates with her husband to enrich the family’s way of living and be able to cover the heavy costs of life. She provides financial help by working in producing homemade food such as pastries, jellies etc… 

With the loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase needed equipment, especially a food mixer, with the aim of increasing her productivity and thus her income. 

Souknah feels lucky to receive funds from Kiva, as she is sure that the loan will definitely represents a big help to her.

loans.use: purchase equipment needed, especially a food mixer

loans.name: Nancy's Group

texts.en:
Nancy is a member of Emukaya Group in Kakamega North District. She is pictured here in a group of seven One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 70 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Nancy has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving inputs for a quarter acre of maize and a quarter acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Nancy is 44 years old and has been a farmer for 23 years. She works as a farmer to provide for her five children. The community and other farmers know Nancy as friendly, hard-working, reliable and trustworthy. Other than farming, she is also involved in community groups such as the women's group, savings group and prayer group. Nancy described her harvest last year as good, but she hopes to have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

Nancy first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Nancy joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods and obtain fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. 

Nancy plans to use the money she earns from her next harvest to send children to school and buy a cow. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Nancy’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Nancy and the Emukaya Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues to provide training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 30-year-old married man with seven children, only four of whom are attending school. The family lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

Robert's main business is motorcycle transport, with farming as his side income. He is facing the challenge of unpredictable weather changes, especially the rainy season, which bring about constant motorcycle repairs, thus increasing his expenditures. He has a dream of owning his own motorcycle and being in a state of sustaining his family. Robert intends to use the loan to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 31-year-old man who has four children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in motorcycle transportation. In addition, he does farming in order to boost his income. He faces challenges of unpredictable weather changes, which affect both his farming and motorcycle businesses, reducing his profit margin. He has a vision of graduating to four-wheeled vehicle transportation, plus maintaining his other businesses.

Alfred is requesting a loan. With the funds, he will buy iron sheets for roofing his house and service his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing his house and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Nelson Ivan

texts.es:
Nelson de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta 9 grado, es soltero, con él vive su mamá y 2 hermanos, de él depende solo su mamá. 

El cliente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería  desde hace 18 años, sus cultivos se encuentran a media hora de su casa, él viaja a pie y con él se involucran  sus dos hermanos que le ayudan en sus negocios. 


El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar ganado y otra parte para sacar la cosecha de maíz. Será satisfecha una necesidad; ya que podrá tener ingresos para él y su familia. 
Sus sueños son que su cultivo tenga un buen rendimiento y que la novilla que compre tenga un buen desarrollo productivo.
texts.en:
Nelson is 28 years old and single. He lives with his mother and two siblings. His mother is dependent on him. He studied until Grade 9.

He has worked in agriculture and raising livestock for 18 years. His fields are half an hour from his house and he walks there. His two brothers help him with the business. Nelson will use the loan to buy cattle and to harvest his corn crop. That will fulfill a need and will allow him to have income for him and his family. He dreams of having a good crop and that the young cow he will buy develops well.

loans.use: to buy cattle and another part to harvest his corn crop.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
Candida de 66 años de edad,  estudio hasta 2do grado, es casada; su pareja es contador de un bufete de abogado, actualmente está pensionado, ella procreo dos hijos los cuales están en el extranjero, con ella solo vive su esposo.

Ella es costurera, tiene 50 años de dedicarse a la costurera, este trabajo lo aprendió por medio su madre, quien le inculco este trabajo, lo tiene en su casa en el cual se dedica a tiempo completo.

El préstamo lo utilizara,  para cancelar una deuda que adquirió con su esposo; por la compra de la casa actual que tienen, será una necesidad satisfecha ya que será pagada  y será suya totalmente.
texts.en:
Candida is 66 years old and married. She went to school until the second grade. Her husband was an accountant in a law firm, but he is now retired. Candida has two children who are now abroad. She lives alone with her husband.

Candida is a seamstress with 50 years of experience. She learned this work from her mother. She now works full-time from home.

She is requesting a loan to pay off a debt that she and her husband owe, as well as to buy the house in which they currently live. This would satisfy one of their basic needs, as they would own their home and it would be totally theirs.

loans.use: to pay off a debt that she and her husband owe, as well as to buy the house in which they currently live.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 47-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and seven young kids -- two sons and five daughters. Ismail works as an employee in a local firm, and he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Ismail and his wife would like to improve the family's living conditions, by buying all the necessary stuff.

Ismail took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a machine for water purification. By taking this loan, Ismail will be able to provide his family, especially his kids, with pure water. Ismail appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a machine for water purification.

loans.name: Khabab

texts.en:
Khabab is a 32-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four young kids -- two sons and two daughters. Khabab works as an employee in a local firm, and he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Khabab and his wife would like to improve the family's living conditions, by buying all the necessary stuff.

Khabab took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a machine for water purification. By taking this loan, Khabab will be able to provide his family, especially his kids, with pure water. Khabab appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a machine for water purification.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 23-year-old, single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family, in a simple house in the city. Khalil works as an employee in a local firm, and he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Khalil would like to improve the family's living conditions, by buying all the necessary stuff.

Khalil took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a machine for water purification. By taking this loan, Khalil will be able to provide his family with pure water. Khalil appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a machine for water purification

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 36-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and seven kids -- two sons and five daughters -- in a simple house in the city. Mohammad works as an employee in a local firm, and he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family.
