Mohammad would like to improve the family living conditions, by buying all the necessary stuff.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a machine for water purification. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to provide his family with pure water. Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a machine for water purification for his home

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, a 31-year-old, married mother of two, from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She also runs a general shop to supplement her income. She has been in the farming business for the past four years. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, after successfully clearing her previous loan. She will use the loan to purchase ten bags of dairy feed for her dairy cows. Additional income created will allow Elizabeth to educate her children and to add stock in her shop. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to offer her children quality education and improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to purchase ten bags of dairy feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.es: La señora Remedios, tiene 40 años y es casada y tiene un hijo de la edad de 17 años,  ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de pan, repostería y tortas  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, tiene su pastelería que se encuentra situada en la zona de ciudad Satélite una lugar muy concurrido y comercial, la señora Remedios va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de harina  al por mayor para elaboración de  tortas y así incrementar su capital de trabajo, la señora remedios Va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  poder abastecerse  de este producto ya que esta época tiene mucha venta y es donde tiene que aprovechar para así tener más ingresos económicos, se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Remedios is 40 years old, married and has a 17 year old son. She makes and sells bread, pastries and cakes. Her pastry shop is located in a neighborhood of the city of Satélite, a very busy and commercialized area. This loan is her first with this institution. 

Remedios will use this loan to buy flour wholesale for the preparation of cakes and thus increase her working capital. She will use the benefits to continue to improve her business. Her wish for her business is to stock up on this product which is sold a lot at this time of the year. She can take advantage of this to make more money. 

Remedios is grateful for this opportunity being given to her as this is her only activity which allows her to support herself.

loans.use: to buy flour to make cakes, special breads , etc.

loans.name: Toktosun

texts.ru: Токтосун 60 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 9 детей. Самая многодетная и уважаемая семья в селе. Все дети женаты, живут сами своей самостоятельной жизнью со своими личными семьями, с Токтосун проживает самый младший сын, который тоже женат  и имеет троих детей. Токтосун всю свою жизнь посвятила детям. У Токтосун - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Токтосун занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Токтосун, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 дойных коров, 41 овца, 3 козы и 7 лошадей. До этого за счет доходов от животноводства женила сыновей, выдала дочь замуж с приданным. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Токтосун обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку 2 бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Токтосун планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en:
Toktosun is 60 years old. She is married and she and her husband have 9 children. Theirs is the largest and most respected family in the village. All their children are married and live their own independent lives with their own families. The youngest son, who is also married and has three children, still lives with Toktosun. Toktosun has devoted her whole life to children.

Toktosun has high-school level education and, as the main source of income for her family, she rears cattle, having started 23 years ago when she purchased  livestock for 10,000 Kyrgyz Soms. Thanks to Toktosun's hard work, she currently has 7 dairy cows, 41 sheep, 3 goats and 7 horses on her farm. In the past, she has used her income from her farming to pay for her sons' weddings and give her daughter away to be married with a dowry. Her monthly income is 15,000 soms. With the aim of further developing her farm, Toktosun came to the Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan to help her buy two bull-calves, which will increase the quantity of her livestock. She would use the income gained from the loan to further increase her numbers of livestock and plans to save money to build new accommodation for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is from Dalarik village, in Armavir region. She lives with her mother-in-law and 20-year-old son. Her husband is a migrant worker. Susanna, with the help of her son, has been involved in agribusiness. She runs a farm that includes a cow, 30 chickens, and land that she owns, where she cultivates tomato and watermelon.

Susanna's husband helps her family financially from time-to-time, but for tackling financial hardships agriculture is the main source of the family's income. Now, Susanna asks a loan for being able to purchase pigs, oxen, and forage for feeding the livestock. Susanna has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during more recent times, Susanna has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So she has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to other credit products. The loan will be a huge support for this hard-working woman.

loans.use: to pay for pigs, oxen, and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a married mother of five, school-going children.

Nzara prepares goat meat and soup, using goat heads and legs. She sells the food to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase more goats for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for her business

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel es originario de la ciudad de Managua. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de anteojos y Disco “CD”, el cual le ha generado buenos ingresos económicos. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que incremento su inventario y logro comprar más de sus productos para ofrecer a su clientela. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: lentes para el sol, lentes de lujos, CD musicales variados, con el fin de ofertar una amplia gama de anteojos y de música. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá mejores ganancias y podrá seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is from the city of Managua. He works as a merchant, selling eyeglasses and CDs, which has generated good revenues for him. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito since he has increased his inventory and he has managed to buy more products to offer to his customers. 

Manuel is requesting a new loan in order to buy sunglasses, luxury glasses and a variety of musical CDs. His goal is to offer a wide selection of eyeglasses and music. He thinks that this loan will be a great help because he will earn better revenues and be able to continue to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy sunglasses, luxury glasses and a variety of music CDs.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a 29 year old man who works as a primary school teacher.  He lives in a small apartment which he uses as a bedroom, kitchen, and a sitting room.  Charcoal has been Tom’s main energy for cooking.  He says that this has made his room very untidy and sometimes he goes to class with dirty clothes due to charcoal dust.  Tom became interested in Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) after the WANA team made a presentation at his school, and he decided to buy himself the clean burning LPG.

Tom thinks that this energy will keep his house clean compared to dirt charcoal, which has made his clothes dirty and has brought him ridicule at school.  He also likes that LPG takes very little time to boil water, making it quick and effortless.  He wishes to invest in this energy because it is clean and cooks food quickly.

loans.use: to buy clean burning liquefied petroleum gas to prevent his apartment getting dirty

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia is a petty trader, who sells ladies' bags, shoes and clothes, in Twifo Praso. She displays her goods in a round aluminum bowl and goes round some parts of the community to make sales. She has had some formal education, and she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is currently unemployed.

Portia has been working as a trader for some number of years. As the sole provider in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of ladies' bags, shoes and clothes, which will enable her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of mounting a shoe and materials stand. This would help her to sell from a fixed location, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of ladies' bags, shoes and clothes

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is single and has four children, one of whom goes to school. She has two additional family members (old parents). She operates a restaurant at the market. She sells her food to all kinds of people, on a retail basis. She has been in this business for seven years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from selling piped water.

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 700,000 from MCDT SACCO. She will use it to buy some green bananas, rice, flour, sweet potatoes and beef. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and seasonality. She aspires to buy better serving utensils for her restaurant, and to own a fully-stocked restaurant.

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy some green bananas, rice, flour, sweet potatoes and beef

loans.name: Esquilancito Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento ESQUILANCITO está compuesto por ocho integrantes de los cuales siete  son mujeres y un varón, que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es  la señora Yovana tiene 31 años tiene 3 hijos,   ella se dedica a  vender variedad de cosméticos, perfumes por catalogo ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante visitando distintas oficinas y ferias de la ciudad de Cochabamba este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Yovana va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería para estas épocas de fin de año como perfumes por mayor,  la señora Yovana va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos ya que esta época es donde tiene buena venta y de esta manera genera buenos ingresos,   se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Esquilancito Communal Bank is made up of eight members, seven women and one man who work in a variety of jobs.

The president of the bank is Yovana, 31.  She has three children and makes a living selling perfume via catalogue.  She sells her products on foot, visiting different offices and street fairs in the city of Cochabamba.

This is Yovana's first loan sequence with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy merchandise wholesale, such as perfume, for the end-of-the-year season.

Yovana's going to use her profits to continue buying a variety of products because this is the season for good sales and she generates good income.  She's happy about and grateful for the opportunity offered through this loan.

loans.use: to buy perfume wholesale

loans.name: 33-Villa Olmos Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento 33-VILLA OLMOS está compuesto por diez integrantes de los cuales siete  son mujeres y tres varónes, que se dedican a distintas actividades, el presidenta del banco es  el señor Marcelino, tiene 53 años tiene 2 hijos,  el se dedica a  la fabricación de muebles tiene su carpintería que se encuentra en la zona de las Lomas de la ciudad de Cochabamba este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el señor Marcelino va a usar este préstamo para la compra de madera, el señor Marcelino va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de madera y herramientas,  el señor Marcelino se siente feliz y agradecido por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
The 33-VILLA OLMOS Communal Bank is composed of ten members, of whom seven are women and three are men. They make a living in various ways. The president of the bank is Sr. Marcelino. He is 53 years old and has two children. He makes furniture and has a carpentry shop in the Las Lomas area of the city of Cochabamba.

This is the bank’s first loan cycle from Emprender. Sr. Marcelino will use this loan to buy wood. He will use the profits to continue buying a variety of wood and tools. Sr. Marcelino is happy and grateful for the opportunity being provided to him through this 
loan

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Pilar Isabel

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Pilar, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 8 hijos, seis mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 15 años los mismos que estudian en colegio, tres de sus hijos aun viven con ellos. El marido es jardinero. 
Doña Pilar con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella con la ayuda de sus hijos y su suegra se desplazan a los campos cercanos lugares donde tienen muy buena clientela y donde realizan mayores ventas, ella les deja a crédito y  cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 10 años dedicada al comercio con lo cual ayuda a su marido ya que el no gana mucho en la labor que realiza.
Este crédito es para  comprar ropa y  zapatos. Lleva 10 años  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio que le permite salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia pues donde viven es de su suegra.
texts.en:
The "Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Canton of 24 De Mayo in the province of Manabí. This canton is known for it's beautiful landscapes, it's forests, it's variety of wildlife and for it's friendly and hard-working people who engage in agriculture and raise livestock.

Pilar lives here. She is 52 years old, lives in a common-law relationship from which she has 8 children. Six of them are adults and the other two are 15 and 17 years old. They both study at High school. Three children still live at their house. Her husband is a gardener. 

Pilar with the intention of making some money for herself and to help her husband get ahead with the household expenses works selling clothing and shoes of all types. She sells door-to-door. With the help of her children and her mother-in-law she goes out to other places close to her community which have a good clientele where she makes her best sales. She sells on credit and collects every 8 days. She has done this for more than 10 years to help her husband as he doesn't make much money at his work. 

Pilar will use the loan to buy clothing and shoes. She has been a member of the communal bank for 10 years. She likes it because the loans allow her to get ahead with her business. Her dream is to own her own home as they currently live with her mother-in-law.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Zulema Felicitas

texts.es:
Zulema vive en al ciudad de Camaná, trabaja como técnica de enfermería en un pequeña posta médica de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para salir adelante y apoyar a sus padres.

Zulema esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar una cocina a gas para su vivienda, ya que actualmente es de kerosene, de esta manera podrá evitar accidentes y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Zulema lives in the city of Camaná and works as a nurse technician in a small medical centre in the city.  With this job, she has enough income to get ahead and to support her parents.

Zulema is grateful  to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy a gas cooker for her home. She currently has a kerosene cooker but, with this new one, she can avoid accidents and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker.

loans.name: Graciela Mabel

texts.es: La señora Graciela tiene 23 años y un hijo de la edad de 7 años, ella se dedica a la confección  de vestidos para niñas, ella tiene su taller que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Munaypata, este es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución y solicita el crédito  para la compra de tela y accesorios para la confección de sus prendas de vestir, ya que tiene pedido que entregar a distintas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, La señora Graciela es una persona joven trabajadora  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con  al institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Graciela is 23 years old and has a seven-year-old son.  Graciela earns a living making dresses for girls.  She has a workshop in the Munaypata area of La Paz.  This will be her first loan with the institution and she is applying for it in order to buy material and accessories in order to make her clothing items.  She has orders that she needs to deliver to various markets in La Paz. Graciela is young, hard-working and has a desire to get ahead.  She is happy and grateful to the institution for this support provided through this loan as this is the only work that Graciela has to support herself.

loans.use: to buy material to make girls' dresses.

loans.name: Rodolfo Rafael

texts.es: El señor Rodolfo, continua con su lucha por cumplir uno de sus mayores sueños, terminar de construir su casa, labora para una empresa privada, solicita el credito para la compra de Ceramica, pelines, cemento ya que podra piso a uno de los cuartos y relaizara las vigas de corona para la otra parte de la vivienda,Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado otorgandole este refinanciamiento para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Rodolfo is continue in his quest to achieve one of his biggest dreams - to finish building his house. Rodolfo works for a private business. He is applying for this loan in order to buy ceramic, purlins and cement. He can then put a floor down in one of the rooms and put down crown molding in another part of the house. Rodolfo thanks Kiva and Afodenic for providing him with financing to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Daisy Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Daisy, tiene 44 años de edad, vive en unión libre, tiene 3 hijos, reside en una aldea suburbana del municipio de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Daisy, tiene 11 años de tener este negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz, de donde puede sostener a su familia. Las tortillas las vende en la misma zona donde vive. Para mantener activo su negocio ha invertido varios préstamo. Actualmente solicita otro por 8,000 lempiras, para comprar harina de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas y para comprar material selecto y terminar de arreglar el solar donde se llena de agua. Su plan es que el negocio se mantenga y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos.
texts.en:
Daisy is 44 years old and has a partner and three children.  She lives in a suburban are of San Pedro Sula municipality.

Daisy has eleven years experience with her business making and selling corn tortillas and, with this business, she is able to support her family.  Daisy sells the tortillas in the area where she lives and she keeps the business afloat by investing various loans in it.  Daisy is now applying for another loan, this time for 8000 Lempira, in order to buy cornflour to make tortillas, and to finish fixing the land where she lives, which keeps filling with water.  Daisy's future plans are to keep the business to support her and to help her husband with household costs.

loans.use: to buy cornflour to make tortillas and to buy materials and finish fix up the land where she lives.

loans.name: Eider Norbey

texts.es:
Eider es un campesino de 37 años de edad, que ha tenido experiencia laboral como mensajero en una empresa de la región, pero desde hace 7 años se ha independizó y montó su propio negocio de producción y comercialización de miel de abejas; el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y, hasta el momento ha obtenido muy buenos resultados, pues le pone empeño y amor a su actividad generadora de ingresos.
Con el propósito de seguir posicionando su negocio en el mercado y hacer que sea más rentable, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos (madera, envases plásticos, entre otros), necesarios para fabricar más colmenas y así podrá cambiar las que están deterioras, mejorando la calidad del producto final para envasar, lo que ocasionará un incremento en la producción y en el nivel de utilidades.
Eider sueña con aumentar los niveles de producción para que le permita lograr un crecimiento de las ventas y consolidar su microempresa en el mercado a nivel departamental, esto le dará la posibilidad de mejorar la calidad  de vida y brindarle un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Eider is a 37 year old country person who has had working experience as a messenger for a company in the region. Seven years ago he went out on his own and started his own business of producing and selling bee's honey. He learned this activity by doing it and up to now has had good results. He puts determination and love into his work generating income. 

With the goal of improving his business' position in the market and to make it more profitable Eider is requesting a loan to help him buy supplies (wood, plastic bottles, etc.). This is necessary to build more beehives to replace the ones that have deteriorated, improving the quality of his end product for bottling. This will increase his production and level of profits. 

Eider dreams of boosting his level of production which would allow him to attain an increase in sales and consolidate his business in the regional market. This would give him the opportunity to improve his standard of living and provide more well-being for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies (wood, plastic bottles, etc.)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 45-year-old hardworking lady, who has four children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is working as a tailor, alongside teaching in order to boost her income. She is facing challenges of business seasonality, in that when schools close, she has no customers until another term opens. She has a vision of one day building rental units for commercial purposes.

Elizabeth intends to use the loan to buy cloth for making uniforms and to pay rent for her business premises.

loans.use: to buy cloth for making uniforms and to pay rent for her business premises.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is married and has four children, and two of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people, on a retail basis. She has been in this business for three years. She works seven days a week.

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 600,000 from MCDT SACCO. She will use it to buy more bales of second-hand clothes to sell. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to become a wholesaler, and to educate her children up to university level.

She resides in her own house. The family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Johnbosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is a twenty-eight-year-old, married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is motorcycle transportation, which he started with the vision of supporting himself and his family's survival.  Like other motorcycle transporters, he faces the problem of bad weather with the bad roads that cause motorcycle break downs.  His dream is to transform his business into motor vehicle transportation.
 
John Bosco intends to use the loan to repair his motorcycle.

loans.use: to  repair his motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with one child, who goes to school. She has two additional family members (her mother and sister). She is a food vendor at the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people on a retail basis especially in the evening. She has been in this business for five years. She works seven days a week.   She gets additional income from selling piped water. 

Mariam has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of  green bananas, beef, charcoal, cooking oil, sweet potatoes and beef. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to buy better serving utensils for her restaurant.

She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, charcoal, cooking oil, sweet potatoes and beef for her restaurant.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married and has three children, and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (mother). She operates a boutique, selling second-hand clothes at the market. She sells her goods to all kinds of people, on a retail basis. She has been in this business for two years. She works six days a week.

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT SACCO. She will use it to buy more bales of second-hand clothes to sell. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to stock fully her boutique, to sell different items, including both new and used clothes. In addition, she aspires to buy a plot of land and build her own house.

She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy  more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 21 years old and single. He lives in Gaza City with his family in a small simple house. His mother works in a public firm where she earns a low income, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Khaled is a student in his third year studying electronic press, which he loves. He would like to finish his studies, find a job, and help his family with their expenses. Khaled requested a loan from FATEN, which he will use to buy a new laptop for his studies  By taking this loan, Khaled will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 20-year-old single man from Khanyounis city. He lives with family in a small, simple house in the city. His father works for a public firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Ibrahim is a student studying business administration. He loves this specialization. Ibrahim would like to finish his studies and improve his family's living conditions. Ibrahim took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ibrahim will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily. Ibrahim appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en: Etaf is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in the photo. Etaf is a 53-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and son in a small, simple house in the city. Etaf works for a private firm where she gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Etaf's son is a student studying the press and media. He loves this specialization. Etaf's son would like to finish his studies and improve his family's living conditions. Etaf took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her son's studies. By taking this loan, Etaf's son will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her sons study

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en: This is Jameel’s second loan from Ryada. His previous loan helped him to develop his business and had a positive outcome. He was able to buy a photocopier and stock for the store. Today, Jameel is planning to keep on developing his business to make sure that his child will have the best life possible and an education. At the same time, he wants to ensure that his customers are satisfied. He decided to take out this loan to expand the bookstore and add new decorations.

loans.use: to expand the bookstore and add new decorations.

loans.name: Adeeb

texts.en: Adeeb is a 28-year-old man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He studied up to secondary school and dropped out looking for income sources to make a living. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for two years. He took a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to purchase enough fruits and vegetables to meet the demand of his clientele, which has expanded. This loan will allow him to purchase all types of vegetables and to build a good relationship with his clientele by serving their needs. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and improve his capital, as this will help generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase enough fruits and vegetables to meet the demand of his clientele.

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bekhtiyar is a 42-year-old married man with three children. He has loved animal husbandry since childhood. He was at a young age when his father was raising cattle. That seemed to him very natural. 
Bakhtiyar also works as a barber and taxi driver for additional income. He works hard, but his income is not enough to buy livestock and increase his working capital. Now he is asking for the loan 1200 AZN to purchase sheep for breeding. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy sheep for breeding.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is single with five children. Three of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells fruit at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for two years and works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy cabbages, onions, passion fruits, pineapples and mangoes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, onions, passion fruits, pineapples and mangoes.

loans.name: Tabisah

texts.en:
Tabisah is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for six years. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy season), which hinders her movements, and the ever-increasing price of charcoal. She is aspiring of getting a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie  is married with six children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (three of her late brothers’ children).  She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works in the shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to become a wholesaler and to build more rental houses. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Hrayr

texts.en:
Hrayr is an experienced farmer, from Shirak village in Shirak region. He lives with his wife, son, and elderly, pensioner mother. Hrayr is employed in the government sector; he works at the village local self-governance body. He is the main breadwinner of the family. His salary, however, is so low that he cannot afford a living based on that alone. With the help of his family members, Hrayr is also engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, and in cultivation of wheat, potatoes, and apples. His son helps him sell the agricultural products in the local market. This is a very important source of income for them.

To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Hrayr needs a loan of USD 2600. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, forage for cattle, and potato seeds. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately he wasn't able to repay it back. However, thanks to hard work during more recent times, Hrayr has been able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Hrayr and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, forage for cattle, and potato seeds

loans.name: Bundikahungu Kwehimukya Women Group

texts.en:
Henry, whose hand is raised in the group photo, is a twenty-nine year married farmer. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has three children, and only two of them go to school. He buys cocoa from other farmers and buys cocoa gardens for sale. He has been in the system since 2005. He dreams of educating his children to university level and building a permanent house for his family. He is challenged by weather changes that affect his productivity. He is a member of Bundikahungu Kwehimukya Women Group, where each member guarantees the others to get a loan.

Henry intends to use the loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Cruz Beatriz

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Cruz, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, con ellos vive una hija la cual estudia enfermería. Su esposo es empleado público.
Doña Cruz es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca herbalife, su forma de venta es ir a visitar a sus clientes ya que estos tratamientos son continuos, sus productos se venden muy rápidos ya que son muy buenos y los precios son aceptables, además ella les da facilidad de pagos a sus clientes razón por lo cual tiene mucha clientela,  recién tiene 1 año con este negocio el cual se lo dejó una hija que ya tenía años es estas ventas y también le dejo sus clientes.
Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” communal bank meets every 15 days in the 24 De Mayo canton in the Manabí province.  This place is known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, a variety of wildlife, and its kind and hardworking people who devote themselves to agriculture and livestock.

This is where Cruz, age 47, lives.  She is married, and they have four adult children.  A daughter, who is studying nursing, lives with them.  Her husband is a public employee.

Cruz is a housewife.  In order to get her own resources with which to help her husband with the household expenses, she sells Herbalife brand natural products.  The way she sells is to go visit her customers.  Because these treatments are continual, her products are sold very rapidly.  They are very good, and the prices are reasonable.  Also, she gives her customers payment accommodations, which is why she has a lot of customers.  She has been in this business for one year.  A daughter, who had years in these sales, gave her the business and her customers.

This loan is to buy natural products.  She has been in her communal bank for six years.  She likes it because the loans help her a lot.  Her dream is to get ahead in her business.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Elvira  Ramona

texts.es:
Elvira, es una señora emprendedora, además de ser maestra de educación primaria de un colegio de la localidad, también ejerce la actividad comercial como es la venta de ropa como otra alternativa económica.

Actualmente se presento a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito  y lograr la oportunidad de negocio e incrementar sus ventas , dicho crédito lo utilizara en la compra de pantalones y camisas de hombre y mujer.  Brassieres, faldas, short y blúmeres. para satisfacer la demanda   de su clientes y  de esta manera otros ingresos para poder sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Elvira is an enterprising woman. In addition to working at a local primary school as a teacher, she has a business selling clothes in order to make more money.

Elvira has come to Ceprodel in order to apply for a loan to invest in her business and to increase her sales. This loan will be used to to buy men's and women's shirts and trousers, plus bras, skirts, shorts and underwear. This will satisfy her customers' needs and Elvira will have another income to live on.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's shirts and trousers, plus bras, skirts, shorts and underwear.

loans.name: Domine

texts.en:
Domine is 55 years old. She is married with two children, ages 8 and 15. They both go to school. 

Domine sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, and charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 23 years old. She sells vegetables and has been selling vegetables for the past six years. 

She has requested the loan to buy more vegetables for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is married and has five children. Four of her children are in school. She has additional family members (sisters). She sells charcoal at the market, on a retail basis. She has been in this business for six years. She works seven days a week.

She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT SACCO. She will use it to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality (rainy seasons, which hinder her movements and transportation). She aspires to get together enough funds to expand her business into a wholesale business, and also to buy a plot of land and build a house.

She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Shogher

texts.en:
Shogher is a private entrepreneur, from Kapan city, in Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and two daughters (seven and five years old). Her husband is a contractual serviceman, in the military service. To help her husband earn a living for the family, Shogher runs a small, local retail shop. She has been doing this work for more than three years. She sells clothes, shoes, and various household products, in her shop. The assortment of goods she sells in the store is not that big. The inventory needs to be updated and expanded periodically, in order for her small business to be productive and compatible.

Shogher currently needs a loan of USD 3,000. She will use the capital to buy new items (clothes and shoes) to resell in her store. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately, she wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to hard work during more recent times, Shogher has been able to run her business in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Shogher and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain the business.

loans.use: to buy new items (clothes and shoes) to resell in her store

loans.name: Bethleem 2.1 Group

texts.en:
Edoxie is one of the members of the BETHLEEM 2 group. She is the leader of the nine member micro-entrepreneur group from Brazzaville, Congo. Edoxie is married and will use the loan to purchase freshwater and other kinds of fish such as salt and smoked fish.   She will then sell the fish at her business location. Edoxie tries to diversify the quality and variety of fish to attract more customers and grow her business. 

In the future, Edoxie would like to become a wholesaler and save money for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of local fish to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Aida Margarita

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Aida, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos mayores de edad, con ellos vive una hija con sus tres hijos pequeños, su hija estudia en universidad y depende de ellos. Su esposo es jardinero y trabaja para el Municipio local.
Doña Aida es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante a su familia, ella arrienda un local en el centro de la ciudad en la cual se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos,  allí todos los días prepara deliciosos desayunos y almuerzos, su hija le ayuda en esta labor una vez que envía a sus hijos a la escuela, su restaurante es muy concurrido ya que ella cocina delicioso y trata siempre de variar el menú razón por lo cual sus clientes la prefieren.  Tiene 6 años su negocio el cual le da para ayudarle a  su esposo y a su hija que tiene muchos gastos en sus estudios universitarios.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” [“Mother For a Better Future”] meets every 15 days in the canton of 24 de Mayo in the province of Manabí, known for its beautiful scenery, forests, variety of wildlife, and for its kind and hardworking people who work in agriculture and raising livestock.

Aida is 59 years old and lives in 24 de Mayo. She is married and has seven adult children. One of her daughters lives with her along with her three small children. Her daughter is studying in the university and depends on them. Aida’s husband is a gardener who works for the local municipality.

Aida has a fighting spirit and likes to work to help her husband provide for their family. She rents a space in the center of the city where she works preparing and selling food. Every day she prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches. Her daughter helps her at work after she sends her children to school. Aida’s restaurant is very busy, because she is a good cook and because she always tries to vary the menu, which is why her customers prefer her. She now has six years of experience with her business, and it allows her to help her husband and her daughter, who has many expenses with her university studies.

Aida is requesting this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other supplies for preparing her dishes. She has been a member of the communal bank since it started, and she likes it because of the help it has given her to get ahead. Her dream is to own her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other supplies.

loans.name: Alex Amule

texts.en:
Alex is a 30-year-old married man who has four children, three of whom go to school. He heard about Finance South Sudan through the loan officers during a marketing session. He is a businessman who sells mixed commodities in an open market in Munuki Town, South Sudan. He has been doing this business for close to six years and has one employee who helps him. His main business challenge is government taxation.

Alex is borrowing a loan worth 1500 South Sudanese Pounds to enable him to buy more stock like clothes, sandals and baby toys among many other mixed goods that he sells.

The loan will also enable him to pay school fees for his children and provide medication too.

loans.use: To buy items like clothes, sandals and baby toys

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María, tiene 42 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, reside en el municipio de san Manuel, Cortes. Su  negocio es la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz y de golosinas como refrescos, galletas, churros, dulces, pan etc.  En temporada escolar vende golosinas  en una escuela de la colonia. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 3 años,  ella  anteriormente se dedicaba al trabajo de maquila pero con su negocio le va mejor. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de harina de maíz y golosinas para  aumentar sus ventas. Tiene como meta seguir creciendo en el negocio con la compra de nuevos productos alimenticios para vender y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
María, age 42, is in a common-law marriage.  She lives with her husband in the San Manuel municipality in Cortes.  Her business is marking and selling corn tortillas.  She also sells sweets, soft drinks, cookies, churros, candy, and bread, etc.  During the school season she sells sweets at a neighborhood school.

She has had this business for three years.  She previously did factory work, but her business is going better for her.

The loan that she is requesting is for 15,000 lempiras.  She will use it to buy corn flour and sweets in order to increase her sales.  Her goal is to continue growing in the business with the purchase of new food products to sell and to help her family.

loans.use: to buy corn flour and sweets in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Gladwel

texts.en:
Gladwel is a 44-year-old, married mother of four from Embu. She has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Peter who is employed. Their children are aged 20, 18, 15 and 13 years respectively. She has been in the farming business for the past five years. She earns a monthly income of KES 25,000, which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenyan after clearing her previous loans successfully. With this loan she will buy farm inputs and pay school fees for her children. Additional income created will go to the further improvement of her farm.

In the future, Gladwel would like to offer her children quality education.   She hopes to be financially stable and have a fulfilling family life.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school and the rest are still underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 34 year old primary school teacher who lives together with her husband and six children in the outskirts of Entebbe municipal council.  In this area the predominant energy used for cooking is charcoal.  Since the beginning 2013, charcoal prices have risen dramatically compared to previous years, due to the closure of many charcoal sources.  

Margaret says that her family has been living off only one meal per day due to the cost of charcoal.  As a result, her children have started appearing malnourished.  She is happy that a Kiva loan has enabled her to access a liquefied petroleum gas package, and she can now start preparing full courses of food for her children.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking gas package that will enable her to cook for her children

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is a 40-year-old, widowed woman, who lives in the village of Berbuki, in Gori District. She lives alone with her two children and she takes care of them.  

Maka has been involved in a trading business for the past year. She goes to the biggest market in the capital, where she buys products at wholesale prices and then sells them among her villagers. She is hard-working and determined, with a will to get ahead in life. 

Her plan now is to continue to work on her business and to make it grow. Maka applied for the loan to LLC Micro Finance Organization Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of a Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

A loan of GEL 1,200 will help Maka to enlarge the quantity of products she sells. With this financial support, Maka will expand her business and attract more customers. 

The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be increased. Maka gives her regards to Kiva Lenders and she hopes she can make better life conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothing to expand her trading business.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Here is 22-year-old Princess from Liberia. She lives in the community surrounding Airport. She is single and has two children, ages 1 and 7, who live at home. One of her children is in school. For the past four years she has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She started her business with money from her mother, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She sells for six days each week, spending eight hours each day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for her business. Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to thank BRAC Liberia for their continued support.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Violeta Fredeslinda

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora Violeta, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes, con ellos vive una nieta que tiene 14 años y que es como su hija y que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Violeta junto  a su esposo tienen un restaurante en el centro de la ciudad, allí ellos preparan y venden deliciosos desayunos y almuerzos, trabajan todos los días, son 16 años que llevan en este negocio con el cual sacaron adelante a sus hijos y hoy en día les sirve para salir adelante. 
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importante para ellos. Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The “Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor” communal bank meets in the 24 De Mayo province in Manabí every 15 days.  The place is known for its beautiful scenery, its forests, its variety of wildlife, and its kind and hardworking people who devote themselves to agriculture and livestock.

Violeta, age 56, lives in this place.  She is married, and they have three adult and independent children.  Her 14 year old granddaughter lives with them.  She is like a daughter, and she attends school.  Violeta’s husband is a merchant.

Violeta and her husband have a restaurant in the center of the city.  They prepare and sells delicious breakfasts and lunches there.  They work every day.  They have had this business for 16 years.  They got their children ahead with the business, and it now serves them in getting ahead.

She will use the loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients to make the food.  She has been in the communal bank since it started.  She likes it because the loans are very important to them.  Her dream is to have her own place.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other ingredients to make the food.

loans.name: Ephrance

texts.en:
Ephrance is a single mother of four children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (brother’s child). 

She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 300,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bales of used clothes.  

Ephance generates additional income from rental rooms. She works three days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business  challenges include transportation of bales of used clothes to mobile markets and seasonality. She aspires to get a permanent business premise and also to become a wholesaler. 

She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Bethleem 2.2 Group

texts.en: Tatiana is one of the members of the BETHLEEM 2.2 group. She is the leader of a group consisting of six micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Tatiana is relatively new in her business, having worked for the last year and a half. She will use her loan to purchase used clothing, which she will then sell at the market.  Tatiana would like to buy more packages of clothes to attract customers and increase her activity. In the future, she would like to have her own shop and sell African fabrics. She also wants to save more money to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase packages of clothes for her clothing store.

loans.name: Victoire Et Vie 1 Group

texts.en: Martine is one of the members of the group Victoire et Vie 1.  She is the leader of a group consisting of five other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Martine has three children and is in her second loan cycle with HOPE Congo. She will use the loan to purchase ingredients such as sugar, oil, and cream to make her cakes to sell at a profit. Martine attempts to offer her products at a lower price than her competitors so that she can expand her business. In the future, Martine hopes to continue to increase her sales and to open her own shop. Martine would like to eventually involve her children in her business if they are interested.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make cakes.

loans.name: Victoire Et Vie 2 Group

texts.en: Severine is one of the members of the group Victoire et Vie 2. She is the leader of the group consisting of four other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Severine is married with two children, and she is in her second loan cycle with HOPE Congo. She will use her loan to purchase beef, fish, and chicken. which she will then sell at her butcher’s shop. Severine uses her lower prices to attract customers to her shop and is excited to expand her activities with HOPE Congo in the future.

loans.use: to purchase meat for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Victoire Et Vie 3 Group

texts.en: Lisy is one of the members of the group Victoire et Vie 3. She is the leader of the group consisting of seven other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Lisy is married with seven children, five of whom are currently attending school. Lisy has been with HOPE Congo for two loan cycles and will be using her loan to purchase fish, beef, and chicken for her butcher shop. Lisy has found that in order to be successful, it is critical to maintain her stock properly so that she can offer her customers the merchandise that they want. Her goal is to expand her business to one day open a walk-in freezer and expand her store to allow space for clients to sit down and eat.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Le Tresor (1) Group

texts.en:
Ida is one of the members of the group Le Tresor. She is the leader of a group consisting of nine other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo.

Ida has one child and is in her fourth loan cycle with HOPE Congo. She will use the loan to purchase some used clothing and plastic materials, which she will then sell at the market. Ida attempts to offer her products at a lower price than her competitors and this allows her to grow her business. 

In the future, Ida wants to buy a plot to build a house and to ultimately be able to create her own fully-featured second hand store.

loans.use: This borrower will use this loan to purchase used clothing and plastic to resell.

loans.name: Leocadie

texts.en:
Leocadie is 35 years old. She sells foodstuffs in her retail business, and has been in the business for the past three years. 

She will use the loan to buy more beans and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more beans and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a 45-year-old father of five from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. John also works as a mason to supplement his income. He has been in the farming business for the past two years, and he earns a monthly income of KES. 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya after clearing his previous loans successfully. With this loan, he will purchase farm inputs i.e. seedlings and fertilizer.  The additional income created will allow him to expand on the farm land and pay school fees for his children. 

In the future, John would like to offer his children a quality education and improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs i.e. seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Godelive

texts.en: Godelive is 46 years old. She is married with six children. All of her children go to school. She owns a hardware business and has been running the business for the past 13 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more glasses for sale. The profits from the business will be used for establishing savings. Godelive is very happy with her previous loan and she believes it has greatly helped in boosting the business.

loans.use: to buy more glasses for sale.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
Karisa is a 65-year-old general trader dealing in shop item and green grocer. He is a married father of six whose spouse is a housewife. He has been in the business for the last thirty eight years and is doing great.

This marks Karisa's fourth time borrowing from VisionFund to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase stocks of milk, wheat, maize flour, and green grocer food for his shop. 

Karisa anticipated that he will use his profits to service his loan and pay high school fees for his children. He hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of milk, wheat, maize flour, and green grocer food for his shop.

loans.name: Khamisi

texts.en: Khamisi is a 36-year-old, water vendor and charcoal dealer in Mariakani Kenya. He is a father of one, whose spouse is a housewife.  He has been in the business for the last three years doing well.  This marks his third borrowing from visionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale, and water containers for transporting water to his nearby clients. The anticipated profit will help to expand his charcoal business.  He hopes to own a successful business in future and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale and water containers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 38-year-old married father of three children ranging from 2  to 11 years of age. Describing himself as committed, Samuel has been operating a retail business selling charcoal for four years now. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are local residents. His biggest challenge is insufficient funds to buy stock. 

Samuel has requested this loan for Kes 10,000 to buy a stock of charcoal. His goal is to open another charcoal store within five years, and he is planning to reinvest the anticipated profits back into his enterprise.

loans.use: to buy a stock of charcoal

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea is 35 years old. She sells food stuffs and has been in the business for the past five years. She has requested a loan to buy more beans and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used for providing food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more beans and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman who has been blessed with five children, three of which are in school and two are underage. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Sidi operates a charcoal selling business selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. She is requesting for a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is married with three school going children. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Glory has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business for the past five years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the 25,000 KES loan, Glory wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Medi

texts.en:
Medi is a 26 year old male and works as a seasonal driver, meaning his income is not stable.  He is married with a 4 month old baby and is the lone breadwinner in his household.  Medi and his wife have just moved into their family owned property, and his wife has been looking for some form of employment since giving birth in order to supplement their income.

Medi’s wife had wanted to set up a hair dressing shop but there is no electricity in their area.  Their only option was to move to another area where they could access electricity, but rent is too expensive and they cannot find someone to look after their child.  

When Medi and his wife learned about Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) as a clean and efficient energy, they showed interest.  Medi and his wife have accessed LPG to enable the wife to work from home.  They will use LPG for cooking at home and for their business.  They are happy for the loan extended to them from Kiva.  Medi’s wife is now looking at supplementing the family income and supporting a future for their baby.

loans.use: to pay for a liquefied petroleum gas package for cooking and for his wife's business

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a 28 year old single mother of one.  She is a hairdresser by profession.  Lillian’s main sources of energy for cooking are charcoal and firewood.  Recently, the cost of both charcoal and firewood have gone up and this has affected the type of food she can eat and feed her child.
 
In comparison to charcoal and firewood, the cost of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) is lower.  Lillian would have bought LPG a while ago, but the high cost of accessing it prevented her.  Lillian is aware that although the setup costs are high, LPG itself is relatively cheap.  In addition, LPG is quicker to heat.  Lillian says that often she had returned home late in the night and failed to eat because she didn't have enough time to prepare her charcoal and firewood stove.  However, with a loan from Kiva, she will be able to buy an LGP stove, save on the cost of cooking fuel, and she will be able to cook when she returns home late at night.

loans.use: to pay for a clean cooking gas package in order to save on the cost of cooking

loans.name: Arafat

texts.en: Arafat is a 29-year-old man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a very pleasant person, happy and enthusiastic. He is married, with two children to whom he dedicates all of his efforts to get ahead in life. He has operated a bus for daily income. He faces a challenge to work, to help his family and cover their living expenses.  What he earns is not enough to buy spare parts to repair his transportation.  He applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts to be used for repairing his bus. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to be used for repairing his bus.

loans.name: Henry Alberto

texts.es:
Henry se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre trabajador y pujante; nació y se crió en una familia campesina muy humilde que se ganaban la vida trabajando el campo, por lo que desde muy joven se dedicó a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, vivía feliz realizando sus labores hasta el momento en el que llegó un grupo al margen de la ley y acabó con la paz del municipio, razón por la que trasladó para la ciudad con su familia, siendo una víctima más de la violencia del conflicto armado. En la ciudad se hospedó con un amigo quien le enseñó el oficio de fabricar repuestos para moto en caucho, con los conocimientos adquiridos se empleó en una empresa en la que ha trabajado por 8 meses, tiempo que le ha servido para adquirir más experiencia y perfeccionar sus conocimientos; allí labora de 6 am a 1:30 pm y, de manera alterna decidió montar un taller en el que se dedica a la misma actividad de forma independiente, con el fin de complementar los ingresos para dar educación y sustento diario a su único hijo de 8 años de edad.
El crédito será invertido en el mantenimiento de su maquinaria (mejorar el torno, añadir eje y mandril), comprará insumos (llantas de caucho, bolsas para empaque) y pagará para sacar volantes publicitarios; esto le dará un impulso para seguir con su negocio y se dará a conocer permitiendo la llegada de nuevos clientes, así mejorará sus ventas y el nivel de ingresos que recibe.
Henry tiene como propósito ampliar su negocio pero en un local comercial independiente de su vivienda, en el que pueda estar más asequible al público y así lograr un reconocimiento en el mercado y un mejoramiento en sus condiciones de vida, facilitando el sustento de su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Henry is a hard-working and strong person. He was born and raised into a very humble peasant family, who earned their living working the fields. Henry, as a result, spent much of his youth working in agriculture and raising animals. He was happy in his work until a group of people, living on the wrong side of the law, brought an end to peace in the town. Because of this, Henry and his family - now victims of the country's armed conflict - moved to the city, . In the city, Henry lived with a friend, who taught him how to make spare parts with rubber for motorcycles. With this knowledge, Henry worked for a business for eight months, during which time he strengthened his knowledge and gained more experience. Henry worked at the business from 6am until 1.30pm and, as an alternative job, started his own business doing the same work. He did this in order to earn more to bring up and support his only son, who is eight years old.

This loan will be used to maintain equipment (improve the lathe by adding an axle and mandrel), to buy supplies (rubber tyres, packing bags) and to pay for leafleting. This will give Henry more drive to continue with his business and the leaflet will bring more customers. Sales and income will therefore increase.

Henry's aim to expand his business, but in premises separate from his house. His business would then be easier to access for the public and he will be better known in the market. His living conditions will improve then and Henry will be more able to support his young son.

loans.use: to maintain equipment (improve the lathe by adding an axle and mandrel), to buy supplies (rubber tyres, packing bags) and to pay for leafleting.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario's Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Buscando Una Oportunidad De Trabajar Consta De Tres Integrantes Dos Mujeres Y Un Hombre Todos Tienen Su Negocio Propio Desde Hace 3 Años Son Personas Luchadoras, Se Esfuerzan Por Sacar Adelante Su Negocio. Una De Ellas Es La Señora Pastora Quien Es La Coordinadora Del Grupo Y Una Mujer Trabajadora, Se Dedica A Su Negocio De Una Pulpería Desde Las Cinco Y Media De La Mañana A Siete De La Noche De Lunes A Domingo.
Solicita el Financiamiento Para Comprar Mercadería Para Su Negocio, Ella Vende Productos Varios, Leña, Frijoles Cocidos Etc. Acudió Con Sus Integrantes  A Ceprodel Para Que Les Brindaran Un Financiamientos Para Sus Negocios Y Se Sintieron En Confianza Por El Trato Y La Agilidad Que Le Brindaron.
texts.en:
This group, searching for opportnities to work, is made up of three members; two ladies and once gentleman, each with his or her own business for three years.  They are hardworking people who strive to get their business ahead.  Pastora is the group’s coordinator and has a general store, where she works from 5:30 am to 7:00 pm, seven days a week.

She is asking for a loan to buy items for her business.  She sells a variety of products’ firewood, cooked beans, etc.  She and her fellow members came to CEPRODEL to request a loan for their businesses and they felt trusted by the treatment and quick service they received.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: María Félix

texts.es: María es una señora dedicada a la enseñanza de los demás, de profesión maestra de educación primaria, con 23 años de ejercer tan noble labor , es casada  con un  hijo a su cargo el que le está brindando el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo académico, esta señora tiene una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda atravez de la construcción de piso, por eso se `presento a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento para la compra de cerámica, cemento y mano de obra, el que le permitirá realizar el sueño deseado y mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en: Maria is single, works as an elementary school teacher for and has pursued this noble profession for 23 years.  She is married, has a son and she is providing him the necessary academic support for his development. She needs to make improvements to her home, by installing a floor, so she approached CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy tiles, cement, and pay for labor so she can fulfil her dream of improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: 04-09-01-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Trân has a service business repairing electronics. She is requesting a loan to purchase electronic equipment to repair electronics.  Trân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Trân is a 62-year-old married woman with 3 grown children.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Trân is the group leader of the 04-09-01-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

In 2012, Trân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Trân has successfully repaid 2 loans.

The main challenge that Trân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Trân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase electronic equipment to repair electronics.

loans.name: 04-09-02-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Tuyết is 46 years old and is married with 2 children, one of which is grown.

Tuyết has operated a food stall business to sell fruit, for 5 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.  

Tuyết is the group leader of the 04-09-02-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Tuyết joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tuyết has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main business challenge that Tuyết faces is the lack of capital.

Tuyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and  her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: 02160403_Thôn 9, Xã Hoằng Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yến works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase a cow to raise.  Yến is 40 years old and she is married with 4 children.  She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 02160403_Thôn 9, xã Hoằng Ngọc solidarity group.  Yến supports no dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, because her children are grown up.

This is Yến's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Yến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Yến faces in her business is the lack of capital.  In the future, Yến hopes to remodel her house.  She also hopes that her children to find a good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise.

loans.name: 02010325_Bắc Sơn, Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Thái is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell.  She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.  Thái is 52 years old and she is married with 3 children.  She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 02010325_Bắc Sơn, Hoằng Phụ solidarity group.  Thái supports no dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thái joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.  Thái has successfully repaid 1 loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thái has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Thái hopes for her business to do well and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: 02010329_Bắc Sơn, Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Nga operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.  She is requesting a loan to to purchase fish to resell.  Nga is 31 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 02010329_Bắc Sơn, Hoằng Phụ solidarity group.  Nga supports 2 dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nga's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nga has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.  In the future, Nga hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: 02050802_Nam Hạc, Hoằng Phong Group

texts.en:
Yến works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.  She is requesting a loan to purchase chickens and ducks to raise.  Yến is 43 years old and she is married with 3 children.  She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 02050802_Nam Hạc, Hoằng Phong solidarity group.  Yến supports 2 dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Yến's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Yến has been involved in this business for 5 years.  The main hardship that Yến faces in her business is the lack of capital.
