In the future, Yến hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and ducks to raise

loans.name: 02050801_Nam Hạc, Hoằng Phong Group

texts.en:
Thảo is applying for a loan to purchase material to make snacks and fish sauce to resell.  She has a retail business selling snacks and fish sauce.  Thảo is 56 years old and she is married with 2 children.  Thảo is the group leader of the 02050801_Nam Hạc, Hoằng Phong solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  Thảo supports no dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, because her children are grown up.

This is Thảo's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thảo has been involved in this business for 5 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase material to make snacks and fish sauce to resell

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en:
Ankhbayar is a bachelor's degree student who studies at a private university as a land organizer. He has mentioned that if he did not get this loan, he would not be able to study this year. 

He is really passionate about this profession and a very hard working and organized student. This loan is to pay his tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita operates  a service-based business providing manicures and pedicures to her customers, as an aid to her husband's income from employment as a driver. 

She has been doing this for twenty years, earning enough money to support the basic needs of her six children. Recently, she requested a loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover the costs of the school obligations of her children. 

With her determination, she could possibly repay this loan through her service based source of income. In the future, she wants to have better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of the school obligations of her children

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is married with two children.  Only one of her children goes to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for two years.  She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  She works at the market five days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to start importing used clothes. She resides in the family house. The family has access to electricity, but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Duhaguruketwese Cb Group

texts.en:
Duhaguruketwese Community Banking Group is a group loan led by Fabienne. Duhaguruketwese means “Let’s all stand up.” The group leaders sell different items and they have been in the business for the past ten years. 

Fabienne age 34, is married to a farmer and they have both five children, only three of whom go to school. She has sold foodstuffs for the past 16 years. 

With the loan, Fabienne would like to buy beans, rice, and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used for reinvesting in the existing businesses for all the group members. Fabienne has raised up her hand as a symbol of identification from other group members.

loans.use: to buy more beans, rice, and maize to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 68-year-old widowed woman with six children.

Corazon works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business to sell dried coconut meat in the Philippines and requests a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Corazon has previously borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF. She has run this business for 9 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Corazon aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo de la  provincia de Manabí, conocido por sus paisajes hermosos, por sus bosques, variedad de fauna y por su gente amable y  trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería, se reúne cada quince días el Grupo de Crédito Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor. 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 53 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos  mayores de edad y el menor tiene 12 años y estudia en colegio, con ellos también vive una hija que está separada con sus dos hijos pequeños. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar ya que el no gana mucho en su trabajo, ella vende ropa y zapatos de todo tipo, también prepara almuerzos para entregar y las deliciosas hayacas que es un plato típico de nuestra zona. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa,  zapatos y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Madre Para Un Futuro Mejor [Mothers for a Better Future] Communal Bank meets twice a month in the May 24th Canton in Manabí Province. This area is famous for beautiful landscapes and forests; great variety of wildlife; and kindhearted, hardworking farmers and ranchers. Doña María, age 53, and her husband, a construction worker, live here. The couple has three children: two adults and a 12-year-old son who attends middle school. One of the older children is a daughter and mother of two young children, who all live with Doña María and her husband. 

Doña María is a very industrious woman who enjoys working so she can help her husband, who doesn't earn much, meet the couple's household expenses. Doña María sells all types of shoes and clothing, and also prepares lunches for delivery as well as hayacas, a typical, delicious regional dish made of meat in a cornmeal dough and wrapped plantain leaves. Doña María is applying for a loan to purchase clothing, shoes, and supplies for preparing food. She has been a member of the Communal Bank for six years and is satisfied because loans have allowed her to improve her life. Doña María's ambition is for her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, and supplies.

loans.name: Larry Alberto

texts.es:
Larry vive en la ciudad de Camaná, trabaja obrero en una pequeña empresa minera de su ciudad y de esta manera puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Larry está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar una cocina a gas ya que actualmente solo tiene una cocina a kerosene, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y evitar accidentes en su hogar; así el seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” comprar un auto de carga y poder tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Larry lives in the town of Camaná. He is a labourer for a small mining company nearby and in this way earns enough money to support himself.

Larry is very grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to buy a gas stove. At the moment he only has a kerosene one. The purchase will enable him to improve his quality of life and avoid accidents in his home.

He plans to continue working hard so that he can realise his dream of buying a truck and starting his own transportation business.

loans.use: buy a gas stove

loans.name: Mulongo

texts.en:
Mulongo is asking for a loan because she believes that, with it, she will improve her business. The previous loan enabled her to save money from her cafe business. She is requesting a loan of KES 80,000 to purchase food ingredients, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and meat for her business.

Mulongo feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan which, to date, has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and meat for her business.

loans.name: Alfonsina

texts.en:
Alfonsina is married, and she has two children. Her husband is a driver.

She is running a business in her house selling noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, fish, water, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, slippers, books, eggs, and body lotion.

Alfonsina is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is making a good income from selling, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. 

She is living a town near the main road, so many people come to buy, and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her working capital of $ 600. 

And, she is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people to improve living conditions.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, fish, water, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, slippers, books, eggs, and body lotion

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:
Augusta requests a loan of $ 1,500.00 to improve her business.  She is married and runs a second-hand clothing store to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock of items to include shirts, long pants, shorts, maternity clothes, and  blouses.  She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own capital of $ 500.00. 

She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, long pants, shorts,  maternity clothes, and blouses.

loans.name: Andrea  Estefania

texts.es:
Andrea es una señorita de 18 años vive en Santo Domingo, perteneciente a la República del Ecuador, es una joven empresaria desde muy temprana edad ya que luego de la muerte de su padre tuvo que ayudar a su madre a cubrir los gastos del hogar.  Desde que estaba en el colegio ayudaba a vender a una tía todo lo relacionado con cosméticos, con estas pequeñas ganancias comenzó a ahorrar y compró  sandalias para vender a adultos y niños,  las mismas que ofrece recorriendo sectores cerca de la ciudad. Ya al cumplir su mayoría de edad ella recién pudo inscribirse para vender cosméticos bajo su nombre, además de este ingreso Andrea trabaja en las mañanas dando servicio al cliente en una telefonía. 
 Acudió a Fundación Alternativa a solicitar un crédito para surtir su negocio ya que esta temporada es muy buena, se siente muy feliz gracias a la ayuda recibida por Kiva.
texts.en:
Andrea is a young woman of 18 who lives in Santo Domingo in Ecuador. She has run a business from an early age since she had to help her mother with household expenses when her father passed away. In high school she used to help her aunt sell cosmetics, and with her small earnings she saved up enough money to buy sandals to sell to adults and children by moving from one part of the town to another. Then when she was old enough, she was able to register to sell cosmetics under her own name. 

Andrea also works mornings helping customers in a phone shop.

She has approached Fundación Alternativa for a loan to buy stock for her business since this is a busy time of year. She is very pleased with the support she gets from Kiva.

loans.use: buy more merchandise and increase her income

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca lives in Airport area of Margibi County. She is married with has six children between the ages of 9 and 28; only one is in school and lives at home. Rebecca is 40 years old, and did not go to school before starting her business. For the past 11 years now, she has been selling fish in the local market spending eight hours each day on her business from Monday to Saturday. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a businesswoman who is very hard-working. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. She is a married woman, with two children who are adults.

Nadzua has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past two years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: María Virginia

texts.es:
María Virginia es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

María tiene 55 años, vive en unión libre y no tiene hijos. El negocio de fabricación de artículos de piel que tiene lo inició hace 3 años su hijo, quien desafortunadamente falleció; por lo que ella lo tomó y ahora se encarga de él.

En su taller se fabrican cosmetiqueras y lapiceras de hule y piel que se entregan en el centro de la Ciudad de México para ser vendidas. Pide este préstamo para comprar mercancía necesaria para su negocio como piel, hule, hilos y cierres. 

Gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo María ha logrado tener estabilidad económica, decorar su casa y tener siempre surtida la mercancía necesaria para fabricar sus artículos.
texts.en:
María Virginia has a small company, is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is her story:

María is 55 years old, in a common law marriage and doesn’t have any children.  She makes leather articles and started her business three years ago with her son, who unfortunately passed away.  Now she is in charge of it.

She makes makeup bags and pencils out of rubber and leather in her workshop and delivers the items for sale in downtown Mexico City.  She is asking for this loan to buy supplies for her business, such as leather, rubber, thread and zippers.

Thanks to her work, Maria has managed to have financial stability, decorate her house, and keep her supplies stocked to make items.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Edwin Jose

texts.es: Edwin es un joven trabajador, en la actualidad labora como panadero en una panadería, para salir adelante en la vida  ha experimentando diferentes trabajos como vender leche agria, guarda de seguridad entre otros para mantener siempre los gastos principales de sus tres hijos y esposa quien no trabaja por la falta de empleo  en nuestro país. Edwin se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia, pues  requiere  comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones del baño de su vivienda, el cual requiere de un mejor techo, puertas, poner el piso e instalar el inodoro, para garantizar la higiene y seguridad en su hogar para la familia. Solicita el apoyo  de crédito para poder comprar los materiales para dicha obra tan importante.
texts.en:
Edwin is a hardworking young man. Currently he works in a bakery. In order to make progress he has tried a variety of jobs such as selling sour milk and security guard. His goal is always to earn enough money to support his three children and wife who can’t find work.

Edwin worries about the wellbeing of his family. He needs to buy construction supplies to renovate the bathroom in his house. It needs a better roof, doors, a new floor, and a toilet to improve the level of hygiene and safety of his family. Edwin is seeking a loan to buy the materials he needs for this important renovation.

loans.use: buy cement, toilet, door, zinc sheeting, and tiles

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is married with three children, two of whom go to school.  She also takes care of her father.  She has a tailoring business and has been in this business for 3 years.  She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing material and thread.  She generates additional income from selling charcoal.  

She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis.  She works six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She aspires to own three sewing machines and also to become a wholesaler.  

She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing material and thread.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 54 years old, married, and has three children. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, bananas, soap, bread, flour, etc., which she has been doing for seven years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to buy more stock. 

Sarah requested a loan for 10,000 KES, which she will use to purchase sugar, bread, flour, and other items.  Her business goal is to open a hotel within five years. She will reinvest the anticipated profits in the business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, bread, flour, and other items

loans.name: Osana

texts.en:
Osana is a farmer with 15 years of experience running a farm. She keeps a pig and chickens as well as cultivating greens. Osana lives with her husband and two grown-up sons. They all help Osana with farming activities. Her husband is a furniture maker, but the income he gathers is hardly enough to cover the family's basic needs. So, agriculture helps the family to have a stable income during the month and to cover their basic costs. 

Now, by applying for this loan, Osana would like to purchase seeds of greens and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. She has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Osana was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The loan is very important for this family and Osana hopes for lenders' goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for seeds of greens and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse.

loans.name: 13.02.04 - Quảng Thành Group

texts.en:
Toàn is 57 years old and she is married with a child.  She supports no dependents (her child is grown) with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Toàn is the group leader of the 13.02.04 - Quảng Thành solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

Toàn is operating a business raising livestock. Toàn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Toàn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

This is Toàn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Toàn hopes to remodel her house, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Dolgormaa

texts.en: Dolgormaa is a bachelor degree student who studies traditional medicine at the public university. Her goal is to graduate from the university and work in the National Hospital in Bayankhongor province of Mongolia. She has wanted to work in a hospital since she was young.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines.  Divina has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing business.  She has been in this business for 20 years now.  In the future, Divina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing business

loans.name: Glorygen

texts.en: As a married parent of six children, Glorygen works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  Glorygen is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en: Nerissa is married with seven children.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  Nerissa is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.  She has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines.  Nerissa has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets.  She has been in this business for 17 years.  In the future, Nerissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old and married with six children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling business in the Philippines and requests a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell.

Gina has borrowed and repaid 2 previous loans from NWTF. She has operated this direct selling business for 2 years and also earns an income from a  ready-to-wear clothing business.

Gina aspires to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Geraldine has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is applying for a loan of $ 1500 to improve her business. She is running a restaurant business in her house.  She is making a good income from the restaurant and she wants to buy more needed items with the loan.  She is living in town near by the main road, so many people come to her restaurant and she is open every day.  She opened her business two years ago with her own working capital $ 150.

loans.use: to buy rice, water, eggs, plates, spoons, buffalo meat, pork, chicken, chairs, tables, and vegetables

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a single mother of three, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister). 

Sarah has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works in the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. She  aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages for charcoal. 

Sarah resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: 09.01.12 Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

Lan is the group leader of the 09.01.12 Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

Mrs. Lan operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. Lan has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make processed food to sell.

In 2012, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: 09.03.05 Phú Sơn 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân is 51 years old; she is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents (her children are grown up).

Mrs. Xuân operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients to make processed food to sell. Xuân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Xuân is the group leader of the 09.03.05 Phú Sơn 3 solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. In 2012, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Xuân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Tsogmandraa

texts.en:
Ms.Tsogmandraa is a bachelor degree student who studies at a private university for financial management. 

She has mentioned that after graduating from her university, she will carry on for a master's degree. 

If she did not get this loan, she would borrow money from her relatives, with a high interest rate. This loan gave her the opportunity to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Soyol-Erdene

texts.en:
Ms.Soyol-Erdene is a bachelor degree student who studies land organization at a public university. 

She has mentioned that the loan gave her an opportunity to finish 4 semester of university, as well as an inspiration to work even harder and graduate successfully. 

She chose this profession due to her father's advise; demand for this profession, and the salary, are quite high.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is from Yerevan. She lives with her son and husband. They own arable land near Yerevan. Part of the land is used as a greenhouse, and in the other part they cultivate roses and strawberries. The family lives in Yerevan, but every day they go to the nearby region to cultivate the land to get a good harvest. 

Now, because of financial hardships, Anush has applied for this loan. She plans to purchase fertilizer and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. This will greatly assist her and her family to continue cultivation and gather more harvest. Anush has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Anush is able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Anush will be very thankful to lenders for the loan and hopes for their goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as humble. He operates a business, transporting passengers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a rural area, and his primary customers are local residents. He says his biggest business challenges are the poor roads and the high cost of fuel.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a taxi, within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially independent. This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 99,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 12 years. Ruth describes herself as strong and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells curtains. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high costs of transporting goods. 

Ruth will use this KES 50,000 loan to add stock of curtains for resale. Her goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She repaid her previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of curtains for resale

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is married and has five children, all of whom go to school. She does not take care of any additional family members. Olivia has a business of selling shoes and has been in this business for seven years. She generates additional income from selling charcoal. Olivia works in a shop six days a week and sells wholesale only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of used shoes.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

Olivia has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Sarafina

texts.en:
Sarafina is a 28-year-old woman. She has two children, ages 2 and 6 years old. Sarafina describes herself as innovative. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, which produce milk for selling. Sarafina has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. 

Sarafina will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.  She will reinvest the anticipated profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 42-year-old married woman. She has six children ranging in age from six to 24 years. When asked, she describes herself as honest.

For the past twelve years Veronica has sold a variety of cereals. She sells in a good area to local residents. A lack of money to expand her business is her biggest challenge.

Previously, Veronica borrowed 20,000 KES from SMEP DTM and repaid the loan successfully. She is now applying for a 40,000 KES loan to add to her stock of cereals. Her ambition is to have a big store and become a supplier within five years.

Veronica works so she will have a happy family and the means to educate her children.

loans.use: to add to her stock of cereals

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina, a sus 68 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y activa; con ganas de seguir adelante con su vida, luego de pasar por un difícil momento luego de la muerte de su esposo. Vive sola y requiere generar ingresos para su sustento diario, por lo que desea iniciar su propio negocio de venta de mercancía, razón que la impulsa a solicitar el crédito que será invertido en la compra de surtido al por mayor (blusas, jeans, zapatos, entre otros), y aprovechará los contactos que posee en otra ciudad para comercializar los artículos en distintas veredas de esa población; además de ofrecerlas en el sector donde reside a sus vecinos y familiares; de esta forma podrá generar los recursos económicos suficientes para su sustento. Cristina manifiesta que su avanzada edad no es impedimento para trabajar, pues le gusta sentirse útil y además le generará recursos que le permitirán disfrutar de una vejez más cómoda y tranquila, con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristina is 68 years old and is a very hardworking and active woman with a desire to get ahead in her life, after a difficult time following the death of her husband.  She lives alone and needs to generate income so she decided to set up her own business selling clothing.  She decided to ask for a loan to buy items in quantity (blouses, jeans, shoes, etc.) and take advantage of her contacts in another town and sell to that population as well as to her family and neighbors in her own area.  In this way she can generate enough income to support herself.

Cristina says that her age does not impede her from working because she likes feeling useful and it also generates income that allows her to enjoy a comfortable and relaxing old age with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha, con 49 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Durante los últimos 11 años de su vida productiva se ha dedicado a elaborar y comercializar artesanías en lana como bufandas, guantes, pasamontañas, entre otros; actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que le ha permitido estar pendiente de su hogar, al mismo tiempo que genera ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar; además alterna su labor, dictando clases de tejido en lana, lo que le genera un ingreso adicional para solventar sus gastos personales. 
Con la motivación de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar materia prima al por mayor (lana y agujas de tejido), para abastecerse lo suficiente y así estar en la capacidad de satisfacer la demanda de sus productos en la temporada de fin de año; logrando que sus clientes queden puedan escoger entre las diversas alternativas de productos y queden satisfechos con sus compras; lo que para ella significa un incremento notable en su rentabilidad.
Martha manifiesta que su principal anhelo es poder seguir transmitiendo sus conocimientos en la elaboración de este tipo de productos a todas las personas que lo deseen, pues para ella es importante que la cultura de artesanos no se pierda en la ciudad y se siente satisfecha sabiendo que con su aporte este arte puede perdurar en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old, the mother of two children, and lives with her boyfriend. She learned to weave wool by observing others and has for 11 years woven and sold wool handicrafts. Martha makes scarves, gloves, face masks, and other wool items. Her business has allowed her to work at home while earning an income to support her family. Martha earns additional income for personal expenses by teaching classes in weaving and making wool handicrafts. 

Hoping to strengthen her business, Martha is applying for a loan to purchase wholesale raw materials (wood and knitting needles). This purchase will ensure sufficient supplies to meet the end-of-year demand for Martha's handicrafts and allow her customers to choose from a great variety of products. Satisfied customers will make Martha's business more profitable.  

Martha observes that her greatest wish is to be able to keep teaching anyone who wants to learn how to weave and make wool handicrafts. It is important to her that artisanal culture not disappear from her city and she's pleased that she helping ensure the survival of this art form into the future.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale raw materials (wool and knitting needles).

loans.name: Bich

texts.en:
Bich is a 58-year-old, married woman. She lives with four children and her husband, in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is now retired. For three years, Bich has run a beauty shop for people in her community.

Bich would like a loan, which she will use to purchase hairdressing materials and a hair straightening machine. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers.

She also hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any difficulties that her family may face in the future.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing materials and a hair straightening machine

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang, 33, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living as a postman. Trang started running a general store six years ago, to cover her expenses.

She is requesting a loan to expand her business. She will do this, by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks and rice, to stock her store. She hopes that this new stock will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest into her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more household items, many kinds of soft drinks, and rice, to stock her store.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is a 51-year-old, married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For 14 years, she and her husband have run a business, selling coal to people in her community.

Hien would like a loan to purchase a large quantity of coal and she also would like to buy a large quantity of coconuts to sell as a side business. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and to save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase coal and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband run a business of selling coconuts, which she started ten years ago. 

Nga would like a loan to purchase a quantity of coconuts to better satisfy her customers on Tet holiday. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a quantity of coconuts to better satisfy her customers on Tet holiday

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly has been running a general store for more than seven years earning well for her family. 

She used her previous loans from GDMPC to improve her business and had successfully repaid it. Recently, she requested a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. 

Merly hopes to earn more profit with her additional investments and endeavors to augment the living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Enkhjargal is a bachelor's degree student who studies at a private university as a nurse. 

If she had not gotten this loan, she would not be able to study this year. She is so grateful for the Kiva loan since it gives her the opportunity to carry on studying.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee

loans.name: Dora Modesta

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación y ejemplar en su comunidad donde vive, ella es maestra de educación primaria con 25 años de experiencia, es soltera no tiene hijos a su cargo, además de ser educadora tiene su propio negocio como es la venta de ropa y prendas de plata, lo que viene a mejorar su nivel económico y de su hogar.
Actualmente esta señora se presento a la oficina  de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento, el que utilizaría en la Compra de camisas, pantalones, short, anillos, cadenas,  pulseras y de esta manera cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dora is a woman with a great desire to get ahead and to be exemplary in the community where she lives. She is a primary school teacher with 25 years' experience. She is single and doesn't have children under her care. In addition to being an educator, she has her own business selling clothes and silver jewelry, which helps improve her personal and household finances.

This woman recently came to the Ceprodel office to apply for a loan, which she will use to buy shirts, pants, shorts, rings, chains and bracelets, and in this way meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, shorts, rings, chains and bracelets.

loans.name: Rudy Ines

texts.es: Rudy es un hombre dedicado a la enseñanza de los niños, como profesión es maestro de educación primaria con 12 años de ejercer dicha labor, actualmente se desempeña como Director de un núcleo educativo rural donde recorre 16 kilometro  diario para llegar a su  centro de trabajo ,  es casado con un hijo a quien le brinda todo el apoyo para su desarrollo académico, actualmente tiene una  necesidad  de mejorar su vivienda atravez de la construcción de cuarto, por lo que se presento a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el cual lo utilizaría en la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, bloques, zinc, perlines y pago de mano de obra, lo que le vendrá a mejorar las condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Rudy is a man who is committed to the education of children.  He is a primary school teacher who has been teaching for 12 years.  Currently, he is the director of a rural education center that is about 16 kilometers from his house.  He is married and has one son who hr supports completely in his academic development. 

Rudy is in need of making improvements to his home by building a room, which is why he approached Ceprodel for this loan that he will use to purchase construction materials such as: cement, sand, bricks, zinc, purlins and pay for labor.  This will improve his living conditions.

loans.use: purchase construction materials such as: cement, sand, bricks, zinc, purlins and pay for labor.

loans.name: Pricillah

texts.en:
Pricillah is a 41-year old-married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as committed. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a viable location, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to buy more stock. 

Pricillah will use the 10,000 KES loan to add to her stock of maize, beans and other cereals for resale. Her business goal is to open another shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open a wholesale business. She will reinvest the anticipated profits in the business.

loans.use: to add to her stock of maize, beans and other cereals for resale

loans.name: Rhitah

texts.en:
Rhitah is married and has four children. Three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business, selling airtime and telephone booth service. She has been in this business for six years.

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more airtime and phone chargers. She works at the market, six days out of every week. She sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She aspires to have a fully-stocked phone accessories shop and to own at least five pay telephones.

Rhitah resides in the family house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her biggest monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more airtime and phone chargers.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Tavshut village of the Shirak region. He lives with his wife, father, and 1-year-old daughter.

He is involved in agriculture. Specifically, he keeps cows, sheep, and chickens. Armen sells his gathered harvest locally and earns an income which is vital for his family's living. 

He is asking for this loan to enlarge his agribusiness. He plans to purchase a calf and forage for feeding the livestock. 

Armen has already taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, he was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way to ensure that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Armen and his family so they can enlarge the farm and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for a calf and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Ibakwe Cb Group

texts.en:
Laurence is a group leader for Ibakwe, which means "courageous." All the group members have the vision of transforming their lives through the loans they wish to get. Laurence is 31 years old. She is married and has three children, between the ages of six months and five years. None of her children attend school due to the fact that they are still young. 

Laurence owns a boutique and has been running that boutique for the past six years. She has requested a loan to buy more items to add to the boutique such as fish, rice, and cooking oil for resale. With the profits from her business, she will renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more fish, rice, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a spice and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell for her spice and vegetable vending business.

Alita has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from fish/crab vending.

Alita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha, a 43-year-old married mother of five, works hard to provide for her family. For the past eight years she has been running a general store in the Philippines and also earns income from buying and selling vegetables.

Having borrowed and repaid 15 previous loans from NWTF, Alpha has requested a new one for PHP 13000 to buy additional stocks to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Demetria works hard to support her family. She has an ambulant dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from raising pigs. 

Demetria, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF, has requested  a new one for PHP 30000 to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Kiem

texts.en:
Kiem, 62, is married and has six children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Kiem and her husband run a food stall, selling duck soup to people in their community. Kiem started this business 30 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying new furniture and better-quality food ingredients to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and better-quality food ingredients to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is 27 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a mechanic. Hien runs a general store to earn a living. She started her business seven years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different products, such as soft drinks, to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a variety of products, such as soft drinks, to stock her store

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 42-year-old, divorced woman. She lives with two sons, in Ho Chi Minh City. For 13 years, she has run a general store for people in her community.

Dung would like a loan. She will use it to purchase better-quality food products to sell to her customers, such as soy sauce, fish sauce, and household items. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers.

She also hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties her family may face.

loans.use: to purchase better quality food products, such as soy sauce and fish sauce, and household items to sell at her store

loans.name: Diep

texts.en: Diep is requesting a new loan to buy a steaming machine, hairdressing tools, and shampoos to better satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity, and sales. Diep hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increasing her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a steaming machine, hairdressing tools, and shampoos

loans.name: Chuc

texts.en: Chuc is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. Chuc hopes that her new loan will help her increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy rice in bulk to stock her store for Tet holiday selling. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. Phuong hopes that her new loan will help her increase the size of her food stall and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more rice to stock her store for Tet holiday selling

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en: Dieu is requesting a new loan to buy a refrigerator, new furniture, and a stand umbrella. This purchase will help him to better attract and satisfy his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. Dieu hopes that his new loan will help him increase the size of his food stall and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, new furniture, and a stand umbrella

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue is requesting another loan, which she will use to buy soft drinks, coffee, and sugar and a computer for her children. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers and to better educate her children. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and sales and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, coffee, and sugar and purchase a computer for her children' education

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Mabinty from rural Waterloo in western Freetown. She is married with six children.

In 2006 Mabinty began selling cola nuts and other general stock with the aim of improving her family’s welfare. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. seven days a week. A lack of money to expand her business is her main challenge.

Mabinty is applying for a 900,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more cola nuts and other stock to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business.

Mabinty hopes to continue expanding her business in the years ahead. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cola nuts and other stock to sell.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Meet 32-year-old Isata from Waterloo2 western rural area in Freetown. She is single and has three children between the ages of 2 and 18 years.  In 2007, Isata established a wood business. She began her business because she wanted to develop her family. She works at the business from 8:00 am to 5:30 pm, seven days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Isata requires a loan in order to purchase more wood for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Isata plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for resale.

loans.name: Jamolidin

texts.ru:
Чамолидин житель городка Вахдат. Ему 40 лет. Он счастливый муж и отец пятерых детей. Его дети маленькие и еще ходят в школу, поэтому его жена не работает и сидит дома присматривает за детьми. Семью кормит Чамолидин. Он зарабатывает путем предоставления услуги такси. Этой деятельностью он занимается около трех лет. Чамолидину нравится его работа. Он помогает людям добираться с одной точки города до другой. У него появились постоянные клиенты. Чамолидин очень вежливый и дружелюбный таксист. Он очень счастлив, что ему начинают звонить по телефону, чтобы сделать заказ. 
 Чамолидин хочет, чтобы его пассажирам было удобно, комфортно и чтоб они быстрее добирались до места назначения. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом. Он хочет поменять свою машину. Он продаст свою старую машину и сумму от продажи добавит на сумму от кредита и купит новую машину.
texts.en:
Jamolidin is a resident of the town of Vahdat. He is 40 years old. He is a happy husband and the father of five children. His children are small and still don't go to school, and therefore his wife does not work. She stays at home and looks after the children. 

Jamolidin provides for his family. He earns money through providing a taxi service. He has worked with this business for around three years. Jamolidin likes his work. He helps people to get from one place in the city to another. He was able to attract regular customers. Jamolidin is a very polite and friendly taxi driver. He is very happy that people have started to phone him to place orders. 

Jamolidin would like his passengers to be comfortable and get to their destination even faster. With this aim he applied for a loan. He would like to change his car. He will sell his old car and add this to the loan amount to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to purchase a new car in order to provide a taxi service

loans.name: Yunus

texts.ru:
Юнус является животноводом и мясником, живет в городе Исфара, ему 35 лет. Юнус во дворе своего дома разводит лошадь и крупнорогатый скот. Сейчас в его хозяйстве имеется только одна лошадь американской породы. Юнус занимается куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота в течение 10 лет. Ему помогает жена. Это их семейный бизнес и их бизнес выглядит таким образом. Юнус обычно закупает скот с местного скотного рынка, затем он вместе с женой откармливает их в течение месяца и после этого Юнус продает мясо коров в местные столовые и рестораны. 
У Юнуса трое детей. Сыновьям по 9 и 3 года, а дочери 8 лет. Юнус их очень любит и гордится ими. Он всегда работает усердно, чтобы его дети ни в чем не нуждались. Так как дети растут, расходы семьи тоже увеличиваются. Юнус планирует расширить бизнес и поэтому просит кредит для купли пару голов крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Yunus is a livestock breeder and a butcher. He lives in the city of Isfara. He is 35 years old. Yunus breeds horses and cattle in the yard of his house. Currently he only has one horse, of American breed, in his yard. 

Yunus has been engaged in cattle sales for a period of 10 years. His wife helps him. This is their family business and it works like this: Yunus usually purchases cattle at the local cattle market. Then he and his wife fatten them for a period of a month. After this, Yunus sells the cow meat to local cafeterias and restaurants. 

Yunus has three children. His sons are 9 and 3 years, and his daughter is 8. Yunus loves them very much and are proud of them. He always works diligently in order for his children to have everything they need. As the children grow, the family's expenses also increase. Yunus plans to expand his business and therefore requests a loan to purchase two heads of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase two heads of cattle

loans.name: Dilangez

texts.ru:
Дилангез любимая жена и молодая мама. Ей 21 год. Дилангез замужем и в браке у нее есть ребенок. Ее мальчику 1 год. Дилангез работает продавщицей в ювелирном магазине. Магазин находится в центральном рынке района. Дилангез любит свою работу. Ее всегда поддерживает ее муж. В ювелирном магазине Дилангез занимается продажей золота, серебра и других ювелирных изделий из драгоценных металлов. 
    Дилангез заинтересована на счет расширения своей деятельности, и она решила взять кредит и купить несколько ювелирных изделия для перепродажи в ее магазине. Дилангез нравится работать в этой сфере деятельности, и она верит, что вы ей поможете расширить ассортимент ее товаров.
texts.en:
Dilangez is a loving wife and a young mother. She is 21 years old. Dilangez is married and she has one child, her son who is one year old. Dilangez works with sales at a jewelry store. The store is at the central market of the region. Dilangez loves her work. Her husband always supports her. At the jewelry store, Dilangez sells gold, silver and other jewelry made from precious metals. 

Dilangez is interested in expanding her business, and she decided to take a loan and purchase some jewelry to sell at her store. Dilangez likes to work with this type of business and she believes that you will help her expand her assortment of goods.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry for reselling

loans.name: Nelis  Batania

texts.es: Nelis  es maestra de educación primaria de un núcleo educativo del sector donde habita, con 10 años de ejercer  dicha actividad, es casada, con un hijo a su cargo. Actualmente tiene la necesidad de seguir mejorando su vivienda a través de la construcción de un cuarto, la que con mucho sacrificio ha venido realizando , por eso visito la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento el que lo utilizaría en Compra de materiales de construcción, hierro, arena, cemento, ladrillas, piedrín, zinc y mano de obra y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Nelis is a primary school teacher in an educational center in the area she lives in; she has taught for 10 years.  She is married and has one son.  

She is currently in need of making improvements to her home by building a room, which through much sacrifice she has begin to make it happen.  For this reason, she visited the Ceprodel office to request a loan to purchase construction materials such as: iron, sand, cement, bricks, stone, zinc and pay for labor, which will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: purchase construction materials such as: iron, sand, cement, bricks, stones, zinc and pay for labor.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 38-years-old and widowed with five children.

Lita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business of buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of recycled materials to sell.

Lita has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling business of recycled materials for two years and also earns an income from a general store.

Lita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like wood, bamboo, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Gene has been in this business for ten years. Gene earns more income from food vending.

Gene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like wood, bamboo, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 58 years old and married with 3 children.

Encarnacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, shampoo, etc.

Encarnacion has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from farming rice.

Encarnacion aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Banco Mujer La Amistad Group

texts.es: Priscilla es integrante de Banco Mujer La Amistad, una mujer muy joven con apenas 21, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos, uno niño de 3 años, y otros que tiene poco menos de un mes de nacido. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y valiente, desde siempre ha trabajado para ayudar a su compañero con los gastos del hogar. Sabe lo que es levantarse muy temprano para hacer todas sus labores domesticas, cuidar de sus niños, dedicarle tiempo a su actividad productiva que es el desarrollo y engorde de cerdos, y como si fuera poco por las noches terminar sus estudios de secundaria que concluyo recientemente. Este es su día a día, con un pequeño negocio que se ha consolidado gracias a los 3 financiamientos que ha recibido por parte de Fundación Mujer. Está nueva inversión será para la compra de cerdos, y una cerda de cría, alimentos y algunos materiales para mejorar en encierro de los cerdos.  Sus metas a futuro es aumentar su patrimonio y producción de su actividad, mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia ya que su esposo no tiene un trabajo fijo, y luego seguir estudiando. Junto a Priscilla están 3 socias mas que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Priscilla is a member of Banco Mujer La Amistad [Woman Friendship Bank]. She is a young woman, just over 21 years old. She is in a common-law relationship and has two children – a three-year-old boy and a newborn who is just under a month old. Priscilla is very enterprising and courageous, and she has always worked to help her partner with household expenses. She knows what it’s like to get up very early to do household work, look after her children and make time for her business, which is raising and fattening pigs. And if that weren’t enough, in the evenings she has been studying for her high school degree, which she recently completed. This is her day-to-day life, with a small business that has grown stronger thanks to three loans she has received from Fundación Mujer.

Priscilla is requesting this new loan to buy hogs, a sow, feed and some materials for improving her pigpen. Her goals for the future are to increase the production of her business and her assets, as well as to improve her family’s economic situation, since her husband does not have steady work. She would also like to continue studying.

Along with Priscilla, there are three other members of the group, who plan to start agricultural and livestock businesses.

loans.use: to buy hogs, a sow, feed and some materials for improving her pigpen.

loans.name: Mauricio  José

texts.es: Mauricio se desempeña como maestro de educación primaria, en el área de multigrado en un colegio del departamento de león, con ocho años de laborar, es soltero , no tiene hijos, actualmente tiene la necesidad de realizar mejoras en su vivienda la que está  en mal estado, por tal razón se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y realizar la obra deseada, ya que el mismo lo  utilizaría en la compra de puertas, cemento, arena y ladrillos, el que le vendría a dar mejores condiciones a su hogar.
texts.en:
Mauricio works as a primary school teacher in a multi-grade school in the county of León.  He has been a teacher for 8 years, is single and does not have any children.  

He is currently in need of making some repairs to his home as it is in bad shape.  For this reason, he went to the Ceprodel office to request a loan to allow him to perform the necessary work.  He will use the loan to purchase doors, cement, sand and bricks, which will allow him to improve his housing conditions.

loans.use: purchase doors, cement, sand and bricks.

loans.name: Maryuri Yissell

texts.es: Maryuri, es una señora emprendedora de profesión maestra de educación secundaria, también ejerce la actividad comercial como es la venta de ropa y calzado, es casada con tres personas a su cargo. También su esposa ejerce la actividad de venta el servicio de transporte, esta señora tiene la necesidad de incrementar su inventario y de aprovechar la oportunidad de negocio por eso visito la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el cual lo utilizara en la Compra de  faldas, blusas, zapatas y sandalias para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes,  lo que le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Maryuri is an enterprising, secondary school teacher who also works selling clothing and shoes.  She is married and has three dependents.  Her spouse also works in transportation services.  

Maryuri is in need of increasing her inventory and taking advantage of business, which is why she visited the Ceprodel office to request a loan.  She will use this loan to purchase  skirts, blouses, shoes and sandals to meet her customers' demand, which in turn will allow her to improve her conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: purchase skirts, blouses, shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is a 36-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from four years to 12 years. 

She describes herself as a committed person. She operates a poultry farm where she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a populated area, and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to buy more stock. She will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more chickens. Her business goal is to open a hotel business within five years.

This is her second loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will reinvest the anticipated profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Karei

texts.en:
Karei is 65 years old, married to Esther, and a father of seven children aged between 10 and 27 years old. He has been a livestock farmer in the outskirts of Narok for the last ten years. Karei earns an approximate income of about 15,000 KES in a month.

Karei is currently obtaining his second loan of 40,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya that will facilitate his plans to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale. He learned about VisionFund Kenya from one of the long-serving clients of the organization. 

He intends to use the anticipated profits to add to his herd and to pay school fees for his kids. Karei's dream is to prosper and improve the family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale

loans.name: Mukoitha

texts.en:
Mukoitha is a 58-year-old married woman. She has 8 children with ages ranging from 14 years to 38 years. She describes herself as a social person. 

She operates a retail business where she sells household goods such as rice, sugar, drinks, tea leaves, maize flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her business is located in an area with availability of customers and her primary customers are local residents. 

Mukoitha describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital to expand business. She will use the 60,000 KES loan to add stock of rice, sugar, tea leaves, maize flour, and other items to her shop. 

Mukoitha's business goal is to open a wholesale store and two other branches within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, all her children will attain good education. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 70,000 KES was repaid successfully. Mukoitha will use the anticipated profits to buy food for her family, pay the loan, and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to add stock of rice, sugar, tea leaves, maize flour, and other items to her shop.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards, enabled her to expand her business,  and earned her a higher income.

Besides the charcoal selling business, Emma operates a shop kiosk.

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase eggs, sugar, sweets, and cooking oil for resale. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, sugar, sweets, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is 38 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a electrician. She has been running a business selling electrical items from in front of her house for the past seven years.

Linh obtained a previous loan through CEP that enabled her to expand her business and earn more money to support her family. She is now requesting a 20,000,000 VND loan to continue improving her business by buying a variety of electrical goods from different suppliers to meet customer demand.

Linh hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and raise her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of electrical goods from different suppliers

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Dao is requesting a new loan to purchase tires for her family's vehicle to replace the old ones. This purchase will help her family transport goods. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase tires for her family's vehicle.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en: Chau is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying a variety of different sanitary papers and plastic boxes to stock her store. Chau's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. Chau also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different sanitary papers and plastic boxes to stock her store.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Lang is requesting a new loan to buy a quantity of clothes for selling and a motorcycle for transportation. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing her income, expanding her business and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling and a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 29 years old and lives in West Point. She is married, and her husband is a driver. They have ten children including a one-, 10-, and 12-year-old.  They live at home, and only two attend school. 

For the past four years, Marie has been traveling to the countryside to buy palm oil, dried meat, and dried fish to sell in the capital city of Liberia. Her transportation costs are her main challenge. She started this business by selling for her friends. She enjoys her business because she has lots of customers. 

Marie is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil, dried fish, and dried meat for her business. She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, dried fish, and dried meat for her business

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Salamatu from Waterloo2 Western rural in Freetown. She is married and has 3 children, one of whom is currently attending school. In 2010, Salamatu established her food stand business. She began her business because she wants to empower herself. She works at the business 7 days per week. Salamatu says that her main business challenge is transportation problems within her area.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice and seasonings for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her life and increase her business. In the future, Salamatu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang is a 56-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her two children. For ten years she has operated a cafe and soft-drink stall in front of her house.

Hoang would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and to attract additional customers. 

Hoang also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee

loans.name: Estevao

texts.pt:
O Estevão é Casado maritalmente e pai de 5 (cinco) filhos e vive também com mais duas pessoas na sua responsabilidade. Ele trabalha num Restaurante Beach Bar como Servente de Mesa e tem um pequeno negócio na sua casa para reforçar a sua fonte de receita.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade (: 24kg de açúcar, uma caixa de sabão, 12cx de vinagre, 50kg de arroz, 50kg de amendoim 5 caixas de refresco).
Seu maior sonho e ter uma casa na sua terra natal Inhambane
O seu maior desafio é fortificar o seu negócio para que possa garantir o seu sustento e futuramente adquirir  UMA VIATURA 4X4 porque vive numa zona arenosa.
texts.en:
Estevão is married, the father of 5 (five) children and also lives with two more people who he is responsible for. He works at a Restaurant Beach Bar as a waiter and has a small business which he runs from home to reinforce his income.

With this loan he plans to buy basic products (24kg of sugar, a box of soap, 12 boxes of vinagre, 50kg of rice, 50kg of peanuts and 5 boxes of sodas).

His biggest dream is to have a house in his hometown of Inhambane.
His biggest challenge is to strengthen his business to be able to guarantee his livelihood and in the future to buy a 4x4 vehicle, because he lives in a sandy area.

loans.use: buy basic products (24kg of sugar, a box of soap, 12 boxes of vinagre, 50kg of rice, 50kg of peanuts and 5 boxes of sodas) for resale

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.pt:
O Leonardo vive na casa própria, Casado maritalmente e Pai de três filhos. Ele trabalha como transportador há mais de três anos.
Com o valor a ser financiado pretende comprar: 2 pneus e uma bateria para sua viatura de marca Isuzu
O seu maior sonho é terminar a sua obra tipo 3 que encontra se na cidade para poder arrendar e aumentar a fonte de rendimento.
O seu maior desafio é abrir um furo de água na sua casa da ponta de ouro e concluir a mesma.
texts.en:
Leonardo lives in a house he owns, is married and is the father of three children. He has worked in transport for more than 3 years.

With this loan he plans to buy: 2 tires and one battery for his Isuzu brand vehicle.

His biggest dream is to finish building his 3 bedroom house in the city so that he can rent it out and increase his income.
His biggest challenge is to open a water borehole at his house in Ponta de Ouro and to finish building it.

loans.use: pretende comprar: 2 pneus e uma bateria para sua viatura de marca Isuzu

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadora de Leche de La Paz.
Ella vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar forraje para  la alimentacion del ganado, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

El sueño de Maribel es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Maribel raises cattle for their milk which she sells to one of the industrialized milk plants in La Paz.

She lives in her parents' house an hour distant from the city of La Paz, in the community of Pallina Chico, the Viacha Sector of Ingavi Province, La Paz Department.

The loan she desires is for purchasing forage to feed her cattle, in order to improve their production and conserve their good health.

Maribel's dream is to increase the number of her cattle, taking precautions for their health.

This is Maribel's 1st loan request through IMPRO and, also, her 1st loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy forage for her milk cows.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales; ella se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche del departamento de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

Ella vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector. El crédito será utilizado en la compra de un par de vacas lecheras de raza mejorada para obtener una mejor leche.

El sueño de Julia y su familia  es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.
