Since 2010, Kadie has run a business within her community, selling flasks and plastic bowls. She says that the main challenge to her business is inflation.

Kadie requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more flasks, plastic bowls and a variety of food containers. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her family’s standard of living. In the future, Kadie would like to see her business grow. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more flasks, plastic bowls and a variety of food containers.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Marie from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children. After her wedding, Marie established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to be successful and take care of her family welfare. She works at the business from 8 AM until 5:30 PM,  six days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and proper business location.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap, along with wax cotton fabric,  to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Marie plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap, along with wax cotton fabric,  to expand her business

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Abibatu from Tombo, Western Rural Area in Freetown. She is married with one child aged 3 years. After the war, Abibatu established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to get her daily bread. She works at the business 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the transportation problem within her operation area.

Abibatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Abibatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Binta from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children. After her wedding, Binta established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to create a permanent source of income for her family. She works at the business from 8 AM until 6:30 PM, six days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and proper business location.

Binta requires a loan in order to purchase bags of char coal to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Binta plans to open a big provision store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 37-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been manufacturing copper rods through melting. He buys scrap copper material from a factory and puts it into a high enough temperature for melting and then reshaping.

Nasreen has four children and they barely manage to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health and education. She needs to earn sufficient income to support her family well. She is in her fifth loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. 

Currently she has requested a loan to buy more raw materials for manufacturing so that her husband can increase his sales. She expects a boost in their earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of the business. Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap copper for reshaping.

loans.name: Samra

texts.en:
Samra is 45-year-old lady. She is married and living with her daughter and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is taking a loan for her husband because he owns an embroidery shop. He has been selling embroidery material for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive but its turnover is very high. 

Due to the high costs, he is facing a shortage of materials and is unable to purchase the expensive raw material to sell. Therefore, Samra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can resolve the shortage problem. Through this amount her husband will buy a stock of threads, fancy fabrics, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors.

Samra is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for resale.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is 33 years old, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children.  She is a very hard-working and honest lady. 

She has to do a lot of hard work to meet her household expenses. Her children go to school in the morning and to tuition in the evening. It is challenging for them to afford the school and tuition fees, so that both are doing a lot of hard work to run their house. 

Nasira owns a small beauty parlor at home, and her husband has a small job in a firm. Both are contributing their full income for household expenses. 

With the passage of time her beauty products are going to run out, and this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. 
Nasira requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

She will buy cosmetics products, such as facial cream, hair colors, scissors, and combs for her salon. She hopes that through this amount she will be able to enhance her business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Guldzhahon

texts.ru:
Гулджахону 31 год. Она живет в районе Гиссар, недалеко от столицы. Гулджахон замужем, имеет двух детей школьного возраста. 
Гулджахон предприниматель. Еще в 2003 году она открыла свой торговый бизнес и уже 10 лет как продвигает его. Гулджахон на рынке района имеет торговую точку, где занимается продажей сезонной обуви. Сейчас она продает зонты, резиновые галоши и мягкие сапожки. Ее товар хорошо расходится, так как это сезонный товар. Сейчас Гулджахон обратилась за кредитом. Она просит в кредит 1300 долларов США для приобретения новой партии товара. Ей очень нужен этот кредит для развития торговли.
texts.en:
Guldzhahon is 31 years old. She lives in the Gissar region, not far from the capital. Guldzhahon is married and has two children of school age. She is a teacher. In 2003, she opened her own retail business and has already worked with it for 10 years. 

Guldzhahon has a sales point at the regional market, where she sells seasonal shoes. Currently she sells umbrellas, rubber overshoes and soft boots. Her goods sell well, because they are seasonal. Currently, Guldzhahon has applied for a loan. She requests a loan of 1,300 US dollar to purchase a new shipment of goods. She needs this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase umbrellas, rubber overshoes and soft boots to sell

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 25 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Шахноза раньше работала в салоне красоты. Она предоставляла услуги парикмахера. Шахноза 2 года назад начала новый бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она работает в ателье, где находится в центре ее района. Шахнозе очень нравится ее работа. Она очень способная девушка. Благодаря упорному труду и высокому качеству, она имеет своих регулярных клиентов. Шахноза хочет построить новый дом, так как их дом очень маленький и старый. Шахноза и ее родители не имеют денег для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, кирпич и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a young and cheerful woman. She is 25 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Shahnoza used to have a beauty salon. She was a hairdresser. 

Two years ago, Shahnoza started a new business of sewing women's clothing. She works in a studio, which is in the center of her region. Shahnoza likes her work very much. She is a very capable woman. Thanks to persistent work and high quality, she has returning customers. 

Shahnoza would like to build a new house, as their house is very small and old. Shahnoza and her parents do not have enough money to purchase building materials such as cement, brick and so on. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials, such as brick and cement, for building a new house

loans.name: Kilisimasi

texts.en:
Kilisimasi is a 39-year-old married  woman with four children . She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this  for years. 

Kilisimasi has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Kilisimasi hopes to support her family and extend her business.

loans.use: to buy for chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Айсулуу 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают двух дочерей. У Айсулуу - среднее образование. По характеру Айсулуу очень ответственная, общительная, жизнерадостная. Вместе с мужем Айсулуу занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айсулуу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока, также обрабатывает 2,88 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айсулуу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айсулуу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на обучение детей.
texts.en: Aisuluu is 38 years old, married, and raising two daughters with her husband. Aisuluu has a secondary education. By nature, Aisuluu is very responsible, sociable, and cheerful. She and her husband work in livestock and farming. They started fifteen years ago when they bought 4,000 KGS worth of cattle. Because of Aisuluu's hard work, her farm now has a dairy cow. She earns a monthly income is 10,000 KGS from selling milk. She also farms 2.88 hectares of land, where she mainly grows beans. She sells her crop to wholesalers. In order to further develop her farm, Aisuluu approached the  microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Aisuluu plans to invest profits she makes from the loan in further expanding here livestock, and she plans to save money to educate her children.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Mabinty from Tombo Western rural  area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 3  and 18 years. One of her children is currently going to school. In 2010, Mabinty established her cookery business. She began her business because she wants to get her daily living. She works at the business 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business transportation problem within her operation area.

Mabinty requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning to expand her cookery business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Mabinty plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Memunatu from Jui Eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married with four children. For the past 15 years, Memunatu has run her retail business. She began her business because she wants to generate a source of income to support the home. She works at the business from 8 AM until 6:30 PM, six days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the high cost of transportation.

Memunatu requires a loan in order to purchase bags of charcoal and palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Memunatu plans to open a big provision store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal and palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Navbahor

texts.ru: Навбахор трудолюбивая женщина. Она 20 лет назад начала свой бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур. Навбахор еще в доме у родителей помогала своим родителя по выращиванию сельхоз культур и скотоводством. Она в основном выращивает овощи и зерновые культуры. Навбахор является основной кормилицей ее 2 детей, так как ее муж не работает нигде. Навбахор хочет, чтобы ее муж начал свой бизнес предоставлением услуги такси и таким образом помочь ей по обеспечению семьи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони, так как ей не хватает денег для покупки автомашины. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Navbahor is a hardworking woman. 20 years ago she started her business of field crop cultivation. Navbahor helps her parents with growing crops and breeding livestock at their home. She especially grows vegetables and seasonal crops. 

Navbahor is the only breadwinner of her two children, as her husband does not work. Navbahor would like her husband to start a business of providing a taxi service, and this way help her with supporting the family. She requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni, as she does not have enough money to purchase a car. She hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a car to set up a taxi business for her husband

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Meriam works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Meriam is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Meriam has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and married with five children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from buy and sell fish.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Janeth works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load phone cards and a buy and sell charcoal business. Janeth is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, canned goods, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Janeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 53 years old and married with three children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, chips, bread, etc.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Erlinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Ismoiljon

texts.ru:
Исмоилчон женатый мужчина из города Турсунзаде. У него есть четырехлетний ребенок. Для Исмоилчона его семья самое важное и главное в его жизни, и ради своей жены и детей он работает и живет. Исмоилчон занимается растениеводством Ему 28 лет. И уже 12 лет своей жизни он выращивает овощи в парнике. За такое время растениеводство, выращивание овощей под вниманием стала для него любимым занятием. Свой опыт и умения в этой сфере деятельности он получил отца. Отец научил его всем капризам этой деятельности. 
   На данный момент Исмоилчон нуждается в финансовой поддержке. Он просит кредит, чтобы купить семена овощей помидоров, огурцов болгарских перцев других овощей. На вторую часть кредита он построит парник для овощей на зиму. У Исмоичона большие планы на зиму. И он просит Вас помочь осуществить его план. Помогите ему.
texts.en:
Ismoiljon is a 28-year-old married man from the city of Tursun-zoda.  Together with his wife, he is raising a 4-year-old child, and considers his family the most important thing in his life.  He lives and works for the sake of his wife and children.  Ismoiljon grows vegetables for a living; for the past 12 years, he's been growing them in a greenhouse.  During this time, he's grown quite fond of this line of work.  His experience and skill at growing vegetables is due to his father, who taught him all the nuances and tricks of the trade needed to succeed as a vegetable farmer.

Currently, Ismoiljon is in need of a loan to buy seeds and build a new greenhouse for the winter (to grow tomatoes, cucumbers, and Bulgarian peppers, along with some other vegetables).  He has big plans for this winter, and hopes you'll help him bring his plans to fruition.

loans.use: buy some vegetable seeds and build a greenhouse

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Former National Guard Laura had pressure washed her grandparents’ home dozens of times before she realized that what she had been doing for years as a helpful granddaughter could also be a promising business venture.

Laura started a pressure washing business that offers services to North Carolina residents who need their decks, sidewalks, patios, and driveways cleaned. Despite having initial issues funding the business, Laura has been doing a stellar job. Within its first year, Laura's business has received rave reviews online from satisfied customers on platforms like Angie’s List.

“That is what it is all about: Doing something you love and keeping your customers happy,” Laura explains.

Laura will use this loan to expand her business, which means purchasing the equipment needed to begin offering interior home cleaning services and buying a hot water pressure washer that is necessary for her to continue operation during the winter months. 

With your help and this loan, Laura envisions a big future for her pressure washing business. Help her bring her vision to fruition. 

Check out her business here: http://landerspressurewashing.com/

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed for interior home cleaning.

loans.name: Mt. Livingstone Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her early 40s, is married with two children who are still at school.  She has been running several businesses -- food vendor, mixing and selling flour for making porridge and selling honey. She has been in business for 13 years now. She works from 6 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  

This will be Rose's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start making and selling porridge flour and selling honey as well.  She also increased stock in the food store.  She can now meet her customers' demand.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates all who have supported her group because everybody can now support family demands, especially school fees and hospital expenses. Rose has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to buy a plot of land, to start building her house and to cover household expenses.

Rose will share this loan with her loan group "Mt. Livingstone" which has a total of twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy maize and millet.

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Helena, who is married with four school children, is aged in her late 30s. Currently, Helena has been running a business of genge-duka (small general store) selling fruits, vegetables, dry foods like maize and baking flour, cooking oil, sweets, and other products on the same premise. 

She has been in this business for fourteen years now. Helena opens her business from 6 AM to 10 PM each working day and is able to make a good monthly return. 

This will be her 14th loan from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. Helena's previous loans all were paid back successfully. She used them to buy her business out-of-stock products to meet her customers' demands. Her business profit she used to cover school fees and household expenses for her family. Helena managed to buy a plot and build three house rooms where now she is putting electricity. 

Helena will use this loan to buy new products like fruits, vegetables, flour, cooking oil, and other items for her genge-duka business. She dreams to build another two rooms. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Riziki" which totals eleven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new products like fruits, vegetables, flour, cooking oil, and other items for her genge-duka business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to get more stocks of used clothes for her business, which has been running for five years now. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of quality used clothes to sell. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth dreams to expand her business and hopes to own a house and lot. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from her study of the word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of quality used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Mirna de 52 años de edad,  es madre de 3 hijos dos de ellos estudian y trabajan para poder ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar al igual que su esposo quien labora como guarda de seguridad devengando un salario muy bajo, Mirna empezó vendiendo maíz para sacar adelante a sus hijos, hoy en día con mucho esmero y esfuerzos también vende frijoles, sorgo, purina y queso. Con el  crédito que solicita invertirá en estos granos mencionados para ofrecer más a la clientela de esta manera ir creciendo poco a poco para el bien común de la familia.
texts.en:
Mirna is a 52-year-old mother of three children. Two of her children are in school and are working to help her with the household expenses, along with her husband, who works as a security guard, albeit for a very low salary.

She started selling corn in order to provide a better life to her children.  Currently, she works very hard and also sells beans, sorghum, cheese and Purina products.

She intends to use the loan proceeds to invest in these items so that she can offer more to her customers and grow her business little by little, which will benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase things such as corn, beans, sorghum, cheese and Purina products.

loans.name: Shakilah Peninah

texts.en: Shakila is a 23-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is selling second hand clothes. She started this business with a vision of earning a living and looking after her family. Shakila is facing challenges of weather changes and price fluctuations. However, she has a vision of building rentals and transforming her business into a renowned boutique of second hand clothes around town. Shakila has asked for a loan to buy stock of second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy stock of second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Susan works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. 

Susan, who has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 26-year old woman. She lives with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Saima’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw. He pays a daily rental for this rickshaw because it does not belong to him. They are an ultra poor family and he has been feeding his 6 children through this work. Now his children are growing older and their needs have increased.  He was worried for many days about how to pay the rickshaw rental and so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. 

Saima has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband. She still needs some more money for this.  Therefore, Saima requested a loan for her husband so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of her savings. She hopes that now her husband will not have to pay the daily rental.   

Saima hopes that her husband will be able to increase his income. She is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is taking a loan to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors for embroidery work at home. She has been knitting embroidery for many years and feeding her children. She is a responsible mother. She knows about her duties and responsibilities toward her children. She always keeps busy and is ready to provide better for her dear children.

Shazia is 34 and the mother of four children. Her husband works in a small firm for very low daily wages. He comes home very late at night. She has to pick up and drop off her children herself, manage routine work and complete her tasks for embroidery as well.
 
Shazia's dream is to construct her house according to the population of her children. For this purpose, she is saving.
Shazia is very happy and relaxed after taking this loan because this loan will increase the monthly income and savings.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Yugu Evans

texts.en:
Yugo Evans is a 28-year-old married father of 3 children. Two of the children go to school. He heard about Finance Sudan through a marketing workshop by the loan officers. He is a businessman who operates in Munuki Town South Sudan. His business involves selling clothes, shoes and other mixed items on the market. He has been doing this business for about 6 years and has one employee.

Yugo Evans is borrowing a loan worth 1,500 South Sudanese Pounds to enable him to buy more stock like children's clothes, toys, shoes and sandals for his business. He says the loan will also enable him to pay school fees for his children and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy items like clothes, shoes and other mixed goods.

loans.name: Sren

texts.en:
Sren, 56, is the widowed mother of four dependent children who are still in school. To provide for the entire household, she has been making snacks for selling and she also has cars for rent too. Having in this business for 37 years, she is able to earn about $27 per day but she can manage to save about $10 each day after daily expenses. 

Sren is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is asking for a loan. With this loan, she is going to repair her cars for rent. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income from her current business so as to maintain her standard of living.

loans.use: to repair her cars for rent

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been doing embroidery work with a machine at home to support her family. She has become an expert in machine embroidery, but a few days ago her machine broke due to her continuous work. Now she wants to buy a new embroidery machine to continue her business. Therefore, she requested a loan to buy an embroidery machine so that she can embroider more dresses to sell and grow her income. 

Rubina is a mother of seven children. She is motivated to provide good clothes and education for her family. She hopes to boost her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of her revenue to provide a quality education for her children. Rubina thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new machine for embroidery.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 37 years old and married with one son. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a guard. Phuong earns income through running a food stall and general store that sells rice and different household items to people in her community. 

She started her business seven years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying more furniture, dishes, and better quality food to better satisfy  her customers. 

She hopes the loan will help her business to run smoothly and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture, dishes, and better quality food to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Don Carlos es originario de la ciudad de Granada. Se dedica a la pesca artesanal, lo cual le ha generado ingresos para su familia. Esta agradecido con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que ha sobresalido en su negocio, con los equipos adecuados manteniéndolos en buen estado. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar redes y darle mantenimiento a su lancha. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá realizar la pesca en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Don Carlos is from the city of Granada in Nicaragua.  He is a commercial fisherman, which has enabled him to earn income for his family.  He is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito for helping him make progress in his business, since through their help he has been able to keep his equipment in good condition.

He is seeking a new loan in order to purchase nets and perform maintenance on his boat.  He believes that the loan will be very helpful, since he will be better equipped to run his fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase nets and perform maintenance on his boat.

loans.name: Madhuban Mahila Krushak Club Group

texts.en:
The women of the Madhuban Mahila Krushak Club are from a small village in Odisha in the northern part of the India. The group is composed of 13 women who earn their living by raising animals like cattle and chickens, selling milk, and cultivating and selling vegetables. They need additional capital to maintain, enhance or expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan with People's Forum. They are excited and full of hope to begin this new year with solid goals and dreams.

Tunalata is a 40-year-old married mother of three children who range in age from 8 to 15 years old. In the picture, the lady seated with her hand raised is Tunalata. She completed three years of formal education but due to the poor economic condition of her family, had to leave her education behind. Along with all the clients of People's forum, Tunalata realizes that education is a vital key to a successful future for her children. She shares that her business is running quite well and, because of its success, she will be able to register her children in a good school this year! Her husband shares the same goals for the children. Tunalata is engaged in vegetable cultivation and she produce potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and seasonal vegetables. She is applying for her first loan with People's Forum. The requested funds will be used to purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation. With an optimistic spirit and positive attitude, Tunalata looks forward to this new year with its challenges, blessings and successes.

On behalf of her colleagues, Tunalata expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva investors throughout the world who lend such necessary and vital support. In addition, the ladies send greetings to all for a happy, healthy and successful new year!

loans.use: To purchase standard quality seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Silvia Gladis

texts.es:
Silvia ha sido una mujer pujante y trabajadora, durante más de 35 años se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo de la confección, oficio que aprendió de la mano de su madre y sus tías que siempre realizaron esta labor. Su experiencia laboral la obtuvo mientras trabajaba en diferentes empresas desempeñándose como operaria, pero hace 12 años, con algunos ahorros y el apoyo de los créditos, pudo comprar sus propias máquinas e independizarse, montó su propio taller en la casa donde reside con su esposo y sus dos hijos, trabaja en compañía de una prima en una jornada diaria de 2 a 5 am y retoman de 10 am a 4 pm, cuenta con la ventaja de ser reconocida por la calidad de su trabajo y esto le ha permitido generar los ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar.
El crédito que solicita será destinado a la compra de telas, hilos y nylon al por mayor, esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad suficiente para cumplir con la producción encargada por terceros y, aprovechará la temporada escolar en la que se mejoran las ventas y por ende los ingresos que percibe.
Silvia tiene como meta la ampliación de su taller, en el que pueda generar oportunidades de empleo y, en un futuro cercano desea abrir un almacén para vender la producción de sus propios diseños, esto le dará la capacidad de tener mayor rentabilidad y así seguirá luchando por el bienestar y la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Silvia has been a vigorous and hard-working woman. For more than 35 years she has worked in the field of dressmaking, a trade that she learned from her mother and her aunts, who always did this work. She obtained her work experience while working as a machine operator for different businesses, but twelve years ago, with some savings and the support of loans, she was able to buy her own machines and become independent. She set up her own workshop in the house where she lives with her husband and their two children. She works along with a cousin and a day worker from 2 to 5 am, and they resume from 10 am to 4 pm. She has the advantage of being known for the quality of her work, and this has allowed her to generate sufficient income to support the household economy.

The loan that she is applying for will be destined for the wholesale purchase of fabrics, threads, and nylon. This will allow her to have sufficient supplies on hand to complete the production commissioned by third parties, and she will take advantage of the school season, in which her sales improve and as a result the income that she earns.

Silvia's goal is the expansion of her workshop, in which she would be able to generate opportunities for employment, and in the near future she wants to open a store to sell products of her own designs. This will give her the potential to have greater profitability, and in this way she will continue working for the well being and the quality of life of her family group.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and nylon wholesale

loans.name: Sita

texts.en: Sita is 18 years old and a single woman  with no children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, beans, eggplant and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Sita needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, seeds, weed killer and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. Sita will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes etc

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando is married and has three children. He runs a service-based business providing motor transportation in his community, earning to provide for the family needs. He has been in this business for six years. Armando joined GDMPC and borrowed funds to buy new tires. He hopes to save a portion of his income for his family’s future.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Faridakhan

texts.ru: Фаридахан 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают двух приемных дочерей, своих детей к сожалению нет. Фаридахан очень заботливая мама. У Фаридахан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Фаридахан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 6,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Фаридахан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 2 бычка, а также обрабатывает 1,28 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Фаридахан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Фаридахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение своих девочек.
texts.en: Faridakhan is 38 years old, married, and raising two adopted daughters with her husband. They do not have biological children. Faridakhan is a very caring mother. Faridakhan has a secondary education. The primary source of income for the family is Faridakhan's work in livestock and farming. She started this business twenty years ago when she bought 6,000 KGS worth of cattle. Because of Faridakhan's hard work, her farm now has a dairy cow, a horse, two calves, and 1.28 hectares of land where she grows beans and potatoes. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Faridakhan approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Faridakhan plans to invest profits she earns from the loan into increasing her livestock and she plans to save enough money for her girls' education.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Somoern's Group

texts.en:
Somoern is a 31-year-old mother of two dependent children. To make a living, she has been selling grocery items and farming rice for 13 years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Somoern joined VisionFund this cycle. She is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house where her family can live.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Elizabeth Kiden

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a mother of 4 children. Three of them go to school. She heard about Finance South Sudan through marketing by loan officers. She is a business woman who runs a retail shop that sells mixed goods. She has been doing this business for 3 years now and has employed 2 staff to help. She also has houses that she rents out that earns her some extra income.

Elizabeth is borrowing a loan worth 2,500 South Sudanese Pounds to help her buy more stock like soap, sugar, salt, beans, rice and many other mixed goods. The loan will also help her educate her children by paying school fees.

loans.use: to buy items like soaps, sugar, salt, and beans.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Ya, 41, makes a living by farming rice while her husband is a construction worker.  She and her husband have been engaged in these businesses for 23 years and she earns approximately 9 USD per day to satisfy her family’s needs. She lives with her husband and their five children in Kampong Speu province’s Ou Dong district, Cambodia.

Ya has received loans with VisionFund for five cycles. Ya has successfully managed her past loans to better support her family’s livelihood. Now she is requesting a loan to pay for her son's school fees to study finance and banking. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in tertiary education until graduation. She also hopes that it will help relieve her family's financial burden so she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for her son's school fees

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es: Doña Dalila es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de librería, el cual le ha permitido salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Se siente agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito ya que logro aumentar sus productos, crecer más su negocio y sobre todo, cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: libros, cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, etc. con el fin de ofrecer los productos más buscados por sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá mejores ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Dalila is native to the city of Managua. She is a salesperson that runs a bookstore, which has allowed her to get ahead and have a better quality of life. 

She feels grateful to Kiva and MiCredito as she was able to increase her products, grow her business and above all, meet the demands of her customers. 

She asks for a new loan to buy books, notebooks, pens, erasers, etc. in order to provide the products most wanted by customers. She believes that the loan will be very helpful as she will earn a better income and improve the conditions of her business.

loans.use: to buy books, notebooks, pens, erasers, etc.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco es un campesino de 44 años de edad, casado y padre de dos hijos de 13 y 2 años.
Actualmente trabaja como contratista de obra en una empresa y, de manera alterna se dedica a manejar el negocio de su suegro que consiste en la producción lechera, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres que le enseñaron desde pequeño las labores del campo, pues era su única alternativa de vida en esa época; de esta forma complementa los ingresos suficientes para sacar adelante a su familia.
Su propósito es tener su propio negocio de producción lechera, pues de esta forma podrá complementar los ingresos y hacerle frente al principal desafío que es la inestabilidad de su trabajo actual, para lograrlo solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará ganado productor de leche, así avanzará un poco más para cumplir sus objetivos y mejorar los ingresos.
Francisco, con la humildad y la nobleza que lo caracterizan, manifiesta que sueña con adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda disfrutar mejores condiciones de vida en compañía de su familia y además quiere luchar para seguir dando a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Francisco is a farmer, age 44.  He is married and is the father of two children, ages 2 and 13.

Francisco currently works as a contract worker in a company, and he also manages his father-in-law’s business, which consists of dairy production.  He learned this work from his parents, who taught him farming skills from a young age; it was the only way of life at that point in time.  In this way, he subsidizes his income in order to have enough to get his family ahead.

His goal is to have his own dairy business, so he can supplement his income in this way and face his main challenge, which is the instability of his current job.  In order to do this, he is asking for the support of a loan, with which he will buy dairy cattle.  Then he can move a little closer to his goals and improve his income. 

Francisco, with the humility and honor that are typical of him, shares that he dreams of owning his own home, where he can enjoy a better quality of life in the company of his family.  He also wants to fight to keep giving his children a high-quality education.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Luis Octavio

texts.en:
Luis Octavio is an enthusiastic hog farmer from Morelos. His neighbors aren't nearly as excited; Luis Octavio lives in an urban zone and the flies and smells from the abundant manure generated daily are a local nuisance. Luis is investing in a 40 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to treat his hog waste, resulting in multiple benefits. First off, the digester will process the waste, removing odors and resulting in a potent biofertilizer that does not attract flies. Luis Octavio will use the biofertilizer resulting from this process to help improve his crops without having to resort to expensive, fossil-fuel derived agrochemical fertilizers. The other byproduct generated by the biodigester will be a renewable methane-rich biogas - a clean and essentially free energy source. He will use the biogas produced from his pig waste to cook, heat bathwater, and heat water used to clean his animals' pens, allowing him to replace the non-renewable propane he currently uses. 

His digester will help him improve his relationship with his neighbors in addition to turning waste into multiple resources, resulting in social and economic improvements. This loan represents 80% of the total loan of his Biobolsa system.

loans.use: to buy a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Jinfeng

texts.en:
Jinfeng is an asylee from China. He used to have an import and export business in China. He is also an advocate of democracy in China. However, for this reason, he was persecuted by the Chinese government and had to close his business and escape from China with all his personal assets left behind.

He arrived in the U.S. in 2008. With his experience in the import and export business, he worked for a cosmetic products importer for three years. However, he is always an entrepreneur and doing business is always his goal. After he accumulated enough experience in doing business in the U.S., in 2011, he decided to start his new venture on this new continent as a wholesaler of cosmetic products. However, the business isn't always smooth. Because of limited capital, he has to rely on the bigger wholesalers who will eat up his profits. Now, with this Kiva loan, he can import in bulk from the manufacturers directly to increase his margin. His hope for his new life here in the U.S. all depends on this business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his cosmetic products wholesale business

loans.name: Zaira Daniela

texts.es:
Ella es Zaira Daniela y para empezar  va hablar sobre el proyecto, el cual es contarles que la carrera que desea estudiar profesionalmente es Odontología pero opto por la opción de estudiar primero Auxiliar de salud oral ya que esto le ayudara a tener más conocimientos y así poder  llegar un poco más prepara a la universidad, aparte le encuentra gusto y le llama mucho la atención.  
Se ve en un futuro, graduándose de Campo Alto como Auxiliar de salud oral, los planes para futuro son trabajar desempeñando  un cargo acorde con lo que estudio y así poderse ayudar a pagar la carrera profesional ya que tiene un costo alto pero sabe que esto no es un impedimento para poder alcanzar las metas de ella, en unos siete (7) años se ve graduada de odontología pero sabe que no dejara de estudiar ya que la ciencia cada día es más moderna, cuenta que este estudio le ayudaran a encontrar la felicidad plena,  ya que ese sería uno de los mayores triunfos en la vida.
texts.en:
This is Zaira Daniela who will begin by talking about her project. She tells us that she would like to study dentistry but decided to first study to be a Dental Assistant. This will allow her to have a greater amount of knowledge and in that way get to college a little bit more prepared. She also likes this area and was impressed by the service. 

She sees a future in which she graduates from Campo Alto as a Dental Assistant. Her future plans will be to work within the career path that she studied so that she will be able to pay for a more professional degree. This will have a higher cost to it but she knows that this will not keep her from reaching her goals. Within seven years, she will have graduated from dentist school but knows that she will not stop studying because science evolves every day. She says that these studies will help her to achieve complete happiness because this would be one of her greatest life achievements.

loans.use: to pay registration fees for one semester.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This is Emily. She previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Emily would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emily dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Waefeso Group

texts.en:
Maryce, who is in her late 30's, is married with four children who are still in school.  She has been running a pharmacy for four years now.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 08:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
 
This will be Maryce's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy medicines and has successfully paid back all her loans.  She is doing great.  She used her profit to make bricks to start building her house, pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy medicine for her pharmacy.  She dreams of opening another medical store.

Maryce will share this loan with her loan group "Waefeso," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Bakhtygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Бактыгул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бактыгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 32 года назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 4 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en: Bakhtygul is 51 years old, married, and raising two children with her husband. Bakhtygul has a secondary education. The primary source of income for the family is Bakhtygul's work in livestock and farming. She started this business 32 years ago when she bought 1,000 KGS worth of cattle. Because of Bakhtygul's hard work, her farm now has four dairy cows and four sheep. Her monthly income is 12,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm,  Bakhtygul approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Bakhtygul plans to invest profits she earns from the loan into increasing her livestock and she plans to save enough money to raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: buy cows

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru: Валентине 42 года, вдова, одна воспитала 5 детей. Старшая дочь замужем, вторая дочь-студентка, остальные три сына школьники помогают Валентине по хозяйству. У Валентины - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Валентина занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Валентины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Валентина обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Валентина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Valentina is 42 years old, a widow, and is raising five children by herself. Her eldest daughter is married and the second daughter is a college student. Her three school-aged sons help Valentina around the farm. Valentina has a secondary education. The family's primary source of income is animal husbandry. She started this twelve 12 years ago when she bought 10,000 KGS worth of livestock. Because of Valentina's hard work, her farm now has two dairy cows, and a horse. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Valentine approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy sheep for breeding. Valentina plans to invest profits she earns from the loan into increasing her livestock.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
"Stability and security are just illusions. But they are necessary illusions because without them, there would be no way of going on,” says Nengboi whose husband was murdered by miscreants in the neighboring state and his dead body never found. She is the profile member of Ruth Group and the featured borrower for the group. When her husband was alive, she used to sell charcoal and firewood in the town market on the northern side of Manipur state, which is about 35 km from the state capital. But she discontinued her charcoal selling business, as she could not leave the house for business purposes. She had to take care of the family and the kids at home. 

Nengboi started running a grocery shop in front of her house. She sells all essential commodities like detergent soap, detergent powder, salt, toothpaste, edible oils, kerosene, onions, ginger etc. She usually gets the supplies from the nearest town market or in the capital market in Imphal. Most of the villagers buy commodities from the shop because the shop is located in the village itself and they don't have to spend extra money to go to the town market just to get a pack of salt. Because she doesn't have enough money to purchase supplies for sale, customers usually get irritated when their demands cannot be met.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase supplies from the army canteen at a low price and sell them. She is planning to open a savings account and start saving for the future. She says she will also repay the loan on time and try to expand her grocery shop. She thanks WSDS and Kiva for the generosity and love for the group members. She says, “Thank-You Kiva”.

The rest of the group members are engaged in raising cattle, pigs, poultry and other businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more items like edible oils and cereals to sell

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 63 años de edad, que se caracteriza por su tenacidad y su empuje, a pesar de las adversidades siempre se levanta con la frente en alto y sigue adelante, motivada por el amor a su hijo. Ha sido cabeza de hogar desde hace varios años, tras la separación de su esposo.
Se ha dedicado a trabajar en su propio negocio, una ebanistería que inició como alternativa para generar ingresos que le permitieran sacar adelante a su hijo y solventar las necesidades básicas del hogar, allí fabrica todo tipo de mobiliarios en madera, especialmente cocinas integrales, cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo y de un empleado que contrata por temporadas, su horario de trabajo es de 7 am a 5 pm de lunes a sábado.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de materia prima al por mayor (madera, pinturas, entre otros), esto le permitirá cumplir con los pedidos ya contratados y tendrá disponibilidad suficiente para adquirir contratos más grandes, que le generen mejores utilidades.
María, con su perseverancia y actitud positiva frente a la vida, quiere seguir luchando para lograr sus objetivos y sueña con darle continuidad y permanencia en el tiempo a su negocio, atraer nuevos clientes y así estará en la capacidad para mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
María is a 63-year-old woman.  She is known for her persistence and her spirit.  In spite of her challenges, she always keeps her head high and keeps going, motivated by her love for her child.  She has been the head of her household for a number of years, ever since her husband left.

She works in her own business, a woodworking shop that she began as an endeavor to make money.  It allowed her to get her son ahead and take care of the basic needs of their household.  In the workshop she makes all types of wooden furniture, especially kitchen cabinetry.  She has the help of her son and an employee who works seasonally.  Her work schedule is from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. from Monday through Saturday.  

She will invest the loan she is requesting in the wholesale purchase of materials (wood and paints, among others).  This will allow her to finish the orders that have already been made, as well as to have enough available to get bigger orders, which will generate a bigger profit.

With her perseverance and positive attitude when facing life, María wants to keep fighting to reach her goals.  She dreams of her business having continuity and permanence, and of attracting new customers.  Then she will be able to improve the quality of life and well-being of her immediate family.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk (wood and paint, among others)

loans.name: Vioinda

texts.en:
This is Violinda. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan of 20,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Violinda dreams of having her own stall and hopes to make a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 23 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Mylene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, chips and more.

Mylene has been in this business for one year.

In the future Mylene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs and chips

loans.name: Kimyan

texts.en:
Kimyan, aged 21 years old, is a villager from the Stoeng Sen district of Kampong Thom Province. For 1 year, Kimyan has been working for one company and also growing paddy rice as her main source of income.
 
Kimyan is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Kimyan now is asking for an education loan to pay for her tuition fee at university. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee at university.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Sophearith's Group

texts.en:
Sophearith is a villager from the Kam Rieng District, where crop farming is common. She is 31 years old and has three children. She is a rice farmer who also plants cassava as her primary business. She has been in this business for ten years. Furthermore, she works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 80,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Sophearith is a client who has already received two loans from VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sophearith is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Ruben Boudi

texts.en:
Ruben is a 26-year-old married father of two children, one who goes to school. He heard about Finance South Sudan through marketing by loan officers. He is a businessman who owns a shop and a bar. He has employed three staff members to help him run the business. He has been in this business for four years.

Ruben is borrowing a loan worth 1,500 South Sudanese pounds (SSP) to help him buy more goods like beer, soda, water and various other goods for his shop.

He says the loan will also help him pay school fees for his child and improve the lives of his family members.

loans.use: To buy items like beer, soda, beans and many other items

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
This is Remy. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan of 27,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Remy dreams that her business will flourish and hopes to make a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Shedrack, who is in his mid-30s, is married and has two children. One child is in school, while the other is still a baby. For eight years now, Shedrack has been managing his family by running a business selling bed sheets. He works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM per working day and is able to receive a good monthly profit. 

This will be his tenth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which he has paid back in full, he bought stocks of bed sheets. Shedrack’s profit was used to cover school fees and household expenses, including home bed sheets, sofas, a fridge, and a TV. He is so happy with your financial support, which helps him to improve his life. Shedrack will use this loan to buy bed sheets to resell to more people. He dreams of owning a big plot of land. 

Shedrack will share this loan with his loan group "TRUST," which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets to resell.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales; ella se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche del departamento de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

Ella vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector. El crédito será utilizado en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada para obtener leche de mejor calidad.

El sueño de Anastacia es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.Asi mejoar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Anastacia and a group of people from her community decided to take care of the land and the animals.  She makes a living raising cows to produce milk, which she sells to one of the industrial milk plants in the department of La Paz.  Her first step was to let the cows go free and not keep them enclosed far from the pastures where they like to graze.  Nor does she cut their horns, so they'll have their calves naturally, the nutrition they provide will be fresh and high quality, and they'll be healthy.

Anastacia lives in her parents' house in the community of Pallina Chico in the Viacha area of the province of Ingavi in the department of La Paz, an hour from the city of La Paz.  She has several heads of Creole cattle that require better care, given the weather conditions in the area.  She'll use the loan to buy a good breed of dairy cow to get a better quality of milk. 

Anastacia's dream is to have more cattle and ensure their good health.  This way she can improve her income and quality of life.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ann Jayaguru Shg Group

texts.en:
This group is called "Ann Jayaguru SHG" and consists of nine members who are all females from a small village in Odisha in the eastern part of India. They primarily work together but in different businesses like fish selling, animal raising, grocery shops etc.

Nilima is 37 years old and married with two children who are five and nine years old. She has been practicing her profession of dressmaking for a long time. Her main business is sewing and she has a good reputation. She learned in a sewing lab and when she gained more experience, she continued her own business.

She is requesting a loan of 225,000 INR from People's Forum for her group. She will use her portion to buy sewing materials such as fabrics, needles and threads to use for her business since competition has affected her sales a great deal and she needs more merchandise to offer her clients. She hopes to increase both her client base and her income.

All the group members are very excited to take this opportunity and all are very thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, needles and thread for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Women Shg Huikap Awang Leikai Group

texts.en:
Pakpi is a resident of the Imphal-East district in Manipur, which is one of the Northeastern states in India. Pakpi is the featured profile member of the Women SHG Group and she is pictured with her hand raised. The group was formed to support one another morally and financially. They always stand for one another and believe in each other. Most of the group members are weavers.

Pakpi and her husband work side by side to support the family. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw to make an income. It is a tough job for the couple to make a living, as their income is unreliable, irregular and based mainly on the market value. 

Weaving is her main occupation and this is how she generates income for the family. She usually gets the weaving materials from shopkeepers on a credit basis and pays them back with interest after the woven products are sold. The woven products are sold in the neighboring village and nearby villagers. She also supplies them to retail suppliers in the main market. From the generated income, she pays the shopkeepers for the yarns and threads.

With the loan, she will purchase a variety of yarn and threads for weaving and weave different designs of woven products. She strongly believes that the income generated will be beneficial as she won't have to pay the shopkeepers interest money this time. She says “Thank you “ and she will always remain grateful.

The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving and rice-selling businesses

loans.use: To purchase a variety of yarn and threads

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Una niña llamada juliana estaba cursando noveno ya casi lo iba a finalizar, estaba a mediado de agosto, cuando campo alto visito su colegio para darle la oportunidad a los estudiantes de hacer un tenido por un precio muy bajo, a ella le pareció una muy buena  oportunidad ya que a ella le llamaba la atención el área de la salud, a de mas los padres no tenían el suficiente dinero como para costearle una universidad, entonces ella podría ejercer su técnico y ganar algo de dinero para pagar la carrera cuando saliera de once.
Fue un poco complicado convencer a los papas ya que ellos tiene otros dos hijos a los cuales también debían sacar adelante para terminar  el bachillerato, el papa con el trabajo que tenia no ganaba lo suficiente como para poder costear todo lo que necesitaban los hijos, en el colegio debían pagar la pensión y otras cosas que requerían. El valor del semestre de enfermería era un poco económico y juliana quería salir adelante con esta carrera. Al convencer a los padres los de campo alto le dijeron que a la madre de juliana que el convenio iba a ser hasta que terminara la carrera, a si que fue pagando mensualmente, a  juliana le fue muy bien los 3 semestres que estudio, en el  tercer semestre realizo las practicas y le pareció muy bueno aprender a cuidar a un enfermo o a un adulto mayor, cuando fue a realizar los trámites para realizar el cuarto semestre de practicas le dijeron que el convenio que estaba manejando se le acabo.  
A ellos les pareció muy malo que el convenio se acabara, a si que una persona de campo alto les hablo sobre el convenio con kiva y es un poco mas barato para los papas poder pagar, ahora juliana tiene 16 años y espera obtener el convenio con kiva para que el papa y la mama tengan la disponibilidad de pagarle completamente el semestre, para que a si ella se gradué y al salir de once tenga el titulo de auxiliar de enfermería ayudándo trabajando para pagar la carrera y contribuir para que los dos hermanos también salgan adelante y puedan cumplir el sueño que tienen.
texts.en:
A girl named Juliana was completing her ninth year of school, and was almost about to finish up in the middle of August, when Campo Alto visited her school to give the students an opportunity to study at a very low cost.  It seemed like a very good opportunity to her because health studies really grabbed her attention.  Her parents didn’t have the kind of money that a university costs, so she would be able to put her skills into practice and earn some money to pay for her degree when she finished eleventh grade.

It was a little complicated to convince her parents because they have two other children who should also be given the chance to finish high school.  With the job that her father had, he didn’t earn enough to be able to pay for all that his children needed.  In the school he would have to pay room and board, as well as other expenses.  The cost of a semester of nursing was a little bit affordable, and Juliana wanted to move ahead with this degree.  

The people from Campo Alto told Juliana’s mother that the agreement would be in effect until she finished her degree, so they were going to pay monthly.  It went really well for Juliana for the three semesters that she studied.  In her third semester she did her practical training and it seemed really good to her to learn to care for someone who is sick, or for an elderly person.  When she went to sign up for her fourth semester, they told her that the payment agreement she had had was ending.

It seemed really bad to them that the agreement was ending, so a person from Campo Alto talked with them about an agreement with Kiva.  It is a little cheaper for her parents to be able to pay.  Now Juliana is 16 and she wants to make an agreement with Kiva so that her father and her mother have the ability to pay for the entire semester.  Then when she graduates and finishes eleventh grade she will have her nurse’s aide qualifications.  She can help by working to pay for her degree and also contribute so that her two siblings can get ahead and make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to pay for registration for a semester

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is a farmer from the village of Mastara in the Aragatsotn region. He lives with his wife, two-year-old daughter, his wife's mother and two brothers. To take care of his family, Aram is engaged in cattle breeding, breeding sheep and hens and cultivation of grass and alfalfa. With the help of his brothers Aram sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family's income. 

To sustain his agribusiness, Aram needs a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase forage for the livestock and to pay for harvesting services. As this is Aram’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. The family will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support in collecting the needed loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase forage for the livestock and to pay for harvesting services

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Zaituni, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who are still at school.  She has been a food vendor for 13 years now.  She works from 4 pm to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Zaituni's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy Irish potatoes and cooking oils for making chips and meet her customers' demand.  She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with her loan. She used the profit to buy a plot of land and covered household expenses. She dreams of building her own house.

Zaituni will share this loan with her loan group "Mapatano" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a sack of Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Carla Consuelo

texts.es: La señorita Carla tiene 26 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  licenciatura en enfermería, trabaja para pagar sus estudios se dedica a ejercer su profesión ya que trabaja como auxiliar de enfermería con la cual paga sus gastos de estudios estudia en la universidad Central de los Andes este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución y La señorita Carla va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar como compra de una computadora para terminar sus estudios. Que durara el tiempo cinco años,  La señorita Carla enfrenta retos en sus estudios que son la competencia de profesionales que salen de esa carrera los cuales son varios y tiene que ser muy competente en su campo,  viven en la zona  Villa el armen. su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es de lograr realizar una maestría y seguir mejorando en el ámbito profesional.
texts.en:
Carla is 26, single, and studying for a nursing degree. She practices her profession by working as nursing assistant, with which she pays for her study expenses. She studies at Central de los Andes University. 

This is the first loan Carla has taken out with the institution and she is going to use the loan for the different expenses involved in studying, such as the purchase of a computer in order to finish her studies, which will last for five years. Carla is faced with challenges in her studies such as competition from the many professionals who obtain this degree, and she must be very competent in her field. 

They live in the area Villa el Armen. Upon finishing her studies, she wishes to be able to do a master´s degree and continue improving professionally.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Lemmy

texts.en:
Lemmy is 33 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

Lemmy is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lemmy requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
