loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 42 years old, married, and has six children, five of whom are in school, Mercidita works very hard to provide for them.

Mercidita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, soap, shampoo, etc.

Mercidita has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Mercidita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Grace requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, food items, etc,. to sell.

Grace has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, food items, etc., to sell

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en: Zurab is a 49-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, son, and pensioner mother. His wife is a teacher at local school and gets 360 Gel per month. Zurab is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has 2 cows and a plot of agricultural land, where nuts and mandarin trees are grown. They produce cheese products and sell them with the harvested products. As the income is only seasonal, Zurab decided to start a more stable business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of $5000 to purchase a minibus. As the minibus is purchased, he will transport people and increase the income of his family. With the increased income he will be able to improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus to transport people

loans.name: Edy Yobany

texts.es: Edy, tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene 2 hijos y reside  en Taulabe, Comayagua.  Edy se dedica a la venta de refrescos, comidas y golosinas como churros, dulces, galletas, agua etc., este negocio lo tiene desde hace 3 años en su casa donde también le ayuda su esposa.  Anteriormente  trabajo como  operario en una maquila. Con el préstamo que solicita es el sexto ciclo con la institución y los a invertido en su negocio. Actualmente solicita 10,000 Lempiras para comprar insumos para elaborar comidas, refrescos, churros, dulces, galletas y otros. Su objetivo es incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos económicos. El tiene como meta, darles una buena educación a sus hijos y apoyarlos en todo lo que pueda.
texts.en:
Edy is 38 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He and his wife have two children and live in Taulabé, Comayagua. Edy works selling soft drinks, meals, and snacks such as chips, candy, cookies, water etc. He has had this business for three years. It is located in his house, where his wife also helps him. Previously, Edy worked as a machine operator in a factory.

This is Edy’s sixth loan with the field partner, and he has invested his previous loans in his business. He is requesting this loan of 10,000 HNL to buy ingredients to make meals and stock such as soft drinks, chips, candy, cookies and others. He hopes to increase his sales and his income. His goal is to give his children a good education and support them in everything he can.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make meals and stock such as soft drinks, chips, candy, cookies and others.

loans.name: Enhtuvshin

texts.en: Mr. Enhtuvshin is single man who lives with his sister's family in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He has been herding livestock in the countryside for years and moved to the soum center. He started producing traditional leather boots and shoes by order with his sisters in 2009. He is a well-experienced and hardworking man who also herds his livestock while he is running his traditional boots and shoes production business with his sisters at home. He is now requesting loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of inventory to produce shoes and boots to sell to local residents.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of inventory to produce shoes and boots to sell to local residents

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
This is Carolyn. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase recyclable materials from collectors needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan on her current revolving fund used to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carolyn hopes to have other sources of income and dreams to have their own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials from collectors needed in her business.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie runs a general store in their community while her husband earns income from driving. She has been doing this for four years, earning well for the benefit of her family. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to resell. She works in her store for more than eight hours a day because she wants to save money to provide a better future of her only child.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: William Mauricio

texts.es:
El es William un joven con ganas de salir adelante, con ganas de cumplir todos los sueños y todas las metas.
Escogió esta carrera porque le agrada todo lo que tiene que ver con la cocina y desea ser uno de los mejores chef más reconocidos en el país, los anhelos son conocer más acerca de la cocina tanto de su país como de nivel internacional, le gusta experimentar nuevas cosas, le gustan los restos y siente que se desempeña muy bien en esta carrera.
Tiene como propósito viajar por muchos países para a si conocer las diferentes culturas  gastronomía que existen, es por eso que trata de dar lo mejor de el en cada en cada clase y en cada taller para a si sobresalir tanto en lo personal y en lo académico, saber que con sacrificio y ganas se puede salir adelante.
Gracias a estas pocas bases  que tiene se ha podido desempeñar laboralmente, una d las tantas metas de William son poderle devolver en parte a la mama todo el esfuerzo y apoyo que ha tenido para sacarlo adelante, ya que el joven no cuenta con el apoyo del padre, solo tiene el apoyo de la mama que es cabeza de hogar.
Es por eso que el joven William se dirige a kiva con el fin de recibir el subsidio, ya que la mama corre con los gastos de arriendo, alimentación y educación, el joven desea seguir  su carrera gastronómica la cual es en este momento su prioridad para salir adelante.
texts.en:
William is a young man who is highly motivated to get ahead and to achieve all of his goals and dreams.

He chose a culinary career because he enjoys everything having to do with cooking, and he wishes to become one of the most recognized chefs in the country.  He desires to learn more about the cuisine of his own country, as well as cuisine from around the world.  He likes to experience new things, and he feels that things are going very well in his career.

He plans to visit many different countries so he can learn about a variety of gastronomic cultures.  It is for this reason that he tries to give the best of himself in every class and in every professional setting.  In doing this he will grow both personally and academically.  He knows that with sacrifice and willpower he will be able make progress.

Starting with very little, he has been able to establish himself in the workforce.  One of his many goals is to be able to give back and help to support his mother, in return for all the efforts she has had to make in order to provide him with a better life.  He never had the support of a father; he has only had his mother to help him, since she is the head of the household.

It is for this reason that William is applying for a loan through Kiva.  His mother already has many expenses, such as rent, food and education.  He wishes to pursue his gastronomic career, which is his priority and his means of getting ahead.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of schooling.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products needed in her grocery store. Her business has been running for five years now and it keeps on growing. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her children. Her income from the business is supporting their everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more inventory of mineral water for her business. Her loan is helpful not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 32,000 PHP loan to buy additional inventory of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Norma hopes that her children will finish their studies and dreams to have a better living. She attends weekly fellowship* meetings that allow her to give of her own share of God’s love and care in her life. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase mineral water to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
This is Belinda. She previously accessed an 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, as well as intheir personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Belinda dreams to be more successful in business and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nenita is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Nenita has a general store business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Nenita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Frisca

texts.en:
Frisca works hard to support her family. Frisca is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Frisca requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Frisca would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys  tiene la edad de 58 años, es casada y vive con el esposo y cuatro hijos actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de pollos de engorde  y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio de pollos  le ayudará a ella y la familia  a salir adelante. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gladys is 58 years old, married, and lives with her husband and four children. She is requesting a loan to buy broiler chickens to raise so that she can sell them when they are grown and make a profit. Her chicken business helps Gladys and her family to get ahead. She hopes that her business will grow and reach her objectives, so that in the future she can give her family a better quality of life and more economic stability.

This is the first loan that Gladys has received from FUDECOSUR. She had not had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR gave her the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens to raise.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Deus

texts.en: Deus used the previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. He is a 37-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is operating a retail shop alongside running a salon to boost his income. He has a vision of buying a plot to build a home for his family despite the challenges of price fluctuation and customers who delay payment. Deus intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en: Irakli is 37-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, daughter and pensioner mother in a small village of Lanchkhuti district. His wife is a teacher at the local school and gets a small monthly salary. Irakli has a newly opened food market and needs to purchase stock. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $950. As the stock is purchased, he will offer a wide assortment of products to his clients, and the number of clients, as well as the family income, will increase. With increased income, Irakli will expand his market and will be able to improve his family life in the future. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his newly opened market

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is a 41-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Her main business is running a retail shop but she also practices agriculture in order to earn additional income. She has a hardship of competition. Her vision is to have a wholesale shop.

Janepher intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt, soap and match boxes to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt, soap and match boxes to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 39-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income, though he has other side businesses like crop production, where he earns an extra income. He faces the challenge of stiff competition but has dreams of educating his children to the university level and also set up a ranch.

Geoffrey is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholus is 39 years old and married.  He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

He deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income, though he also practices agriculture production as a side income business. 

Nicholus faces challenges of weather changes and diseases that sometimes attack his cattle, but he has dreams of having more cattle in his farm.

Nicholus is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Anjum Ara

texts.en:
Anjum Ara is 42 years old and married. She is an active lady who is living with her husband and children in the city of Rawalpindi. She faced a real difficult time because her husband’s earning were not enough to provide for his family. It compelled her to initiate the work of stitching at home four years ago. She is well aware of the stitching techniques. She stitches clothes for the people who live around her house. She serves her community well and became famous by providing good quality service. 

However, due to the lack of money, she is unable to fulfill the demand of her customers. She is currently in her second loan cycle, and now, she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy packs of buttons and reels of threads in various colors. It will help her to earn more and, hence, better support her family.

loans.use: To buy stitching material.

loans.name: Asip

texts.en: Asip is 34 years old, married, and has two toddler children. He is from the village of Sadakhlo. His family runs an agricultural business and cultivates a plot of land where maize is grown. The income from this activity is seasonal and in order to generate stable monthly funds, Asip is going to start an additional business. With this loan, he plans to purchase a van and use it for making fruit and vegetable deliveries. He will sell fresh produce in the neighboring villages and have a good income, which will enable him to cover everyday costs, as well as expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a van to make fruit and vegetable deliveries

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en:
Sor is 27 years old and married. She lives in a rural village in the Kam Reing district of Battambang. She has three children. She has been involved in rice farming, planting corn, and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for several years, she is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s need. 

Sor is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sor is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland. Sor hopes that the prices of her crops will increase soon, so she can earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 52-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, daughter, and son-in-law in a small village in the Lanchkhuti district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow, two calves, and a plot of agricultural land where maize and nut trees are grown. Davit's wife milks the cow every day and produces dairy products, which are sold to local retailers with the harvested nuts and maize. 

Davit decided to start an additional business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,000 GEL to purchase a horse. Once the horse is purchased, Davit will transport wood from the forest and will sell it. As the wood is mainly used for heating in the winter, Davit hopes the additional business will increase his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase a horse to transport wood from the forest to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of having a better standard of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their business and life every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of mineral water to expand her business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 28-year-old married father of two children who has been working in the construction business for three years. He started working as a builder when he was forced to quit school during his intermediate classes to help his parents in increasing their income and developing their living.

Mohamad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary materials and tools he needs to use in a project he is working on. He is so optimistic about this loan and sure that it will come with a very impressive income which will help him develop both his social and financial situations.

Mohamad is working hard on developing and expanding his working zone. He hopes that in the future he'll be capable of recruiting someone who can help him respond to the increasing customer requests and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials and tools he needs to use in a project he is working on

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack is a 24-year-old single man who is the sole breadwinner for three members of his family. He has been running his door selling business since 2011, with four years of experience in his domain.

Jack is a hard worker who specializes in selling internal and external doors with special qualities and encouraging prices. He used to work as a sales person in the same domain, but his ambitions are beyond being just an employee. As a result, he established his own business and he is working hard to develop it as much as he can.

Today, Jack is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy newly released items with special, encouraging prices that he couldn't have without the acquired loan.

He hopes to expand his business and partner with many existing construction companies that will help him develop his business widely.

loans.use: to buy new released items with special encouraging prices that he can't to have without the acquired loan.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 26-year-old single man who has been working in a construction business for the past six years. He specializes in cement work, which he has a special talent in doing.

His business is his only source of income, which is why he puts so much effort in developing and improving it.

Haytham is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary tools requested to update his business. He will also pay for necessary materials to finish a certain project he is working on.

He is an ambitious man who works hard to develop both his social and financial situations and to make sure that his customers are served well.

He hopes that in the future he can establish his own construction projects that cover all sectors as well as improve his net profit.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools to update his business and to pay for necessary materials to finish a certain project he is working on

loans.name: Alpher

texts.en: Alpher is a tricycle operator. He is 29 years old with 2 children from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. His motorcycle is very important to him because he generates income from it that supports the educational and financial matters of his family. It has been 4 years in servicing people and he never thinks to give up because he believes that in every step he makes, every step he gets, corresponding success will come to it. To answer the needs, he asks assistance from Paglaum MPC  to buy another unit of motorcycle to have an extra income for his family. PMPC granted his wish and he is very thankful to it.

loans.use: to buy another unit of motor unit.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy additional computers and supplies for her computer shop. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her child who is in college. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Edna dreams that her business will grow bigger, and hopes to have a vacation with her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and its where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hardware business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 60,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of hardware to resell.

She has been in this business for six years.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of hardware to resell.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 42 years old, married with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cecil has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Cecil has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa Adoracion

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa Adoracion works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Theresa Adoracion requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase rice, soft drinks, canned goods, soap, biscuits and other grocery items.

Ma. Theresa Adoracion has been in this business for 11 years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soft drinks, canned goods, soap, biscuits and other grocery items.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Yolanda successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Yolanda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 36-year-old hardworking woman. She is a decent lady with many hopes and dreams. She belongs to a poor family and her biggest dream is to provide a quality education for her children. Her husband is the only earning person in the family and his monthly net income is inadequate to meet the family needs. 

Her husband owns a small electronic goods repairing shop. He has excellent skills repairing electronic goods such as televisions, radios, fridges, etc. This shop is the only source of income for his family. Presently he needs to purchase spare parts and tools for repairing electronic goods like television, tape recorders, etc.

Therefore, Nazia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. This loan would be very helpful for her husband to continue his work and to continue generating income. Nazia is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for repairing electronic goods

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en:
Rafig is a 40-year-old married man who lives in the village of Azizkendi with his wife, child, and retired parents. Rafig runs an agricultural business and grows various vegetables on his own piece of land as well as in a greenhouse.  He works hard all day long to earn his living, but his existing income is not enough to cover food and everyday expenses. 

That is why Rafig decided to start another business. He applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved under the startup loan program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva. This program enables the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. This loan will help Rafig to purchase a minibus. Rafig will work on the minibus line as a driver and transport passengers from his district to the capital city. The new business initiative will significantly increase the family's funds. With the increased income, the family will be able to increase their daily spending and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a minibus and start working on the bus line as a driver.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia, age 27, is from the village of Idleti. She is living with her husband, two school-age children, and retired mother-in-law. The modest income that the family makes is from a small poultry farm. Specifically, Natalia has several chickens, and sells eggs periodically. These funds are hardly enough to cover feeding expenses.

In order to generate an additional source, Natalia decided to open a grocery store near her house, and sell various of food products. The family needs money to buy construction materials to renovate a small store. They will buy a stock of merchandise as well as fix their own coffee grinder machine to offer coffee grinding service to their clients. 

Natalia will work as a salesperson and serve her clients in a friendly way. The family will get more income, and they will be able to cover household expenses, as well as improve the living conditions in future.

loans.use: to renovate a small store, purchase merchandise, and fix the coffee grinder.

loans.name: Khatia

texts.en: Khatia, 23 years old, lives with her parents in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Her mother is a saleslady at a local market and gets 300 Gel per month. Khatia has a mini market. She needs money to purchase additional stock for her market and she requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $5,000 to purchase stock. After expansion her market will offer a wide assortment of household goods to her clients. Khatia will be able to increase her income and improve the living conditions for her family. The Start Up program will be a great support for her family.

loans.use: to purchase home products and expand her market

loans.name: Phanny's Group

texts.en:
Phanny, 31, is a married mother of two children. She grows rice on 1.5 hectares of farmland while her husband is a barber in the village. She and her husband have been in this business for 10 years. Phanny is able to earn about 26,000 KHR per day from farming. 

Phanny has been with VisionFund for one cycle and her group member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. As group leader, Phanny is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
After raising birds for over 20 years, Charles became concerned with how many breeders disregard their birds’ well-being. So Charles started Winging It Aviary, a home-based nursery that breeds baby birds. By raising the birds in a stress-free environment with large cages, Charles ensures that the birds are humanely treated. 

Charles’ insistence on the birds' safety is hugely popular with his clients. Clients pick out birds from his website (http://www.wingingitaviary.com/) and Charles weans them himself, hand-feeding and hand-taming the birds. He also provides ongoing technical assistance to his clients to ensure that they are able to properly care for the birds. 

Charles is ready to expand his business further. He would like to offer cages, perches, feed and other accoutrements so that his business can become a one-stop shop for his clients. 

Help Charles build his business and encourage humane treatment of exotic birds!

loans.use: to purchase cages, perches, feed and other accoutrements for his business.

loans.name: Hamra Group

texts.en:
Rutchelle is part of the Hamra Group. She is a Filipino citizen living and working as a housekeeper in Lebanon. She came to work hard and provide her children with the necessary standard of living. She is a 30-year-old single mother of three precious children, who she left to be raised by her parents. 

Rutchelle is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. This will help her to pay for her children's school fees, which is an important thing. She is working hard to provide for her children, since education is their only hope for a brighter future. She hopes that in the coming years, she will be capable of establishing her own business back in her home country, the Philippines, and to be next to her beloved children while taking good care of them. 

Rutchelle is the first from the right with the black top. As for the other borrowers, Gladice is the first from the left with light blue uniform, and Ma Elsie is the lady at the center of the picture with a grey uniform.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees, since education is their only hope for a brighter future.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 29-year-old married mother of one child. She works in selling woman accessories, cosmetics, and makeup since six years ago, to help her husband in making their living and covering their precious child's increasing needs.

Salam is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special released Christmas and winter new collection, which will attract customers' attention and increase her sales. She will also use part of the loan to pay for driving courses and license, which will help her a lot in searching for many other wholesale sources where she can find the best prices. That will help her in increasing her income and replying to customers' needs.

She is working hard to keep on developing her business in a well managed way.

Salam will make sure that in the future, she will work on expanding her shop and keep on diversifying her products to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise and pay for driving courses and license.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 30-year-old single Palestinian refugee, who has been working since 2009 in selling prepaid mobile phone cards in the Palestinian camp where he lives. Youssef is suffering from limited work opportunities Palestinian refugees face. That is why he found himself stuck in his current business that he is working hard to develop so that he can start a new life, make a beautiful family, and cover their needs.

Youssef is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business capital through buying prepaid mobile phone cards that will increase his business capital and will automatically increase his income. He is working hard so that in the future he can open a mobile sales shop where he will sell newly released mobiles, used phones, accessories and prepaid cards. He also plans to provide maintenance services.

loans.use: to increase his business capital through buying prepaid mobile phone cards that will automatically increase his income

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
For over 20 years, Angel worked as a maritime engineer while dreaming of owning his own business.  Finally, 8 years ago, he realized his dream and started United Maritime Services. He was able to repair boats and make income while continuing his job as a maritime engineer. 

Unfortunately, Angel lost his job. He decided to move to Miami and devote himself to growing his business.  He found that he loves the freedom of being a business owner and has been recognized in the United States for his experience, skills and efficiency in the industry. 

Angel is ready to grow his business further, but he needs help with the administrative side. With this loan, Angel will be able to purchase the necessary technology (a computer, printer, etc.) to help him run the administrative side of his business. 

Help Angel realize his dream and build a livelihood!

loans.use: to pay for office equipment such as a computer and printer

loans.name: Benialita

texts.en:
For the past 3 years, Benialita has operated a business buying and selling jewelry in the Philippines. She is married and works hard to support her family.

Benialita has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase necklaces, bracelets, watches and rings to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase necklaces, bracelets, watches and rings to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 32-year-old married mother of 4 children who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. She earns a living through agriculture in addition to extra income from her monthly salary. She has inadequate capital to buy manure and seedlings.  Grace also faces the challenges of prolonged drought and hail storms. She has hopes of becoming a role model to farmers around her area.  Grace intends to use the loan to buy manure and seedlings for the farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for the farm.

loans.name: Yoeng

texts.en:
Yoeng, 32, is married with one daughter who is still in school. She resides in a rural village located in the Choeng Prey district, Kampong Cham Province. For the last nine years, she has been farming rice and raising pigs. The current business earns her about 14,800 per day to support her family.

Yoeng is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is asking for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy more pigs for raising. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for raising.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 27-year-old married father of two children. He has been working in glass manufacturing since 2007. Since his business is his only source of income, he has to make sure to keep on developing it in a well-managed way to stay capable of supporting his beloved family.

Ayman is a Palestinian  refugee who lives and works in a Palestinian camp with limited access to several working sectors. This forced him to choose this type of business since it was one of the available ones he was allowed to do.

Ayman is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to increase his business merchandise by buying raw glass to change into glass shields ready to to be sold upon request. He hopes that, in the future, he'll be capable of opening an aluminum sales business to run parallel to his existing business, which will reply automatically to his customers' needs.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise by buying raw glass to change into glass shields

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is 39 years old and married with three children. His wife is a housewife. Zaur's elder son is 15 years old and is in ninth grade. His younger son is 11 years old and is in fifth grade. Zaur’s daughter is 13 years old and she is in seventh grade. They are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli City and now live in the Abseron region of Azerbaijan. 

Zaur is a taxi driver. He transports passengers between various areas of the Abseron region. Today Zaur needs a loan of 1,000 AZN. Therefore, he has applied for a loan from Komak company. With this loan he wants to repair his car. Zaur is thankful to the Kiva organization and Kiva lenders for their help. In the future, Zaur wants to replace his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Jeanett

texts.es:
Jeanett  junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales ella se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche del departamento de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

Ella vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector y alimenticia. El crédito será usado en la compra de forraje y alquiler de tierra.

El sueño de Jeanett es comprar tierras para sembrar alfa y otros asi no alquilar el costo de 1 héctarea a Bs. 2000.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA
texts.en:
Jeanett and a group of people from her community decided to take care of the land and the animals.  She makes a living raising cows to produce milk, which she sells to one of the industrial milk plants in the department of La Paz.  The first think she did was to let the cows go free and not keep them enclosed far from the pastures where they like to graze. Nor does she cut their horns, so they'll have their calves naturally, the nutrition they provide will be fresh and high quality, and they'll be healthy.

Jeanett lives in her parents' house in the community of Pallina Chico in the Viacha area of the province of Ingavi in the department of La Paz, an hour from the city of La Paz.  She has several head of Creole cattle that require better care, given the weather conditions and the nutrition in the area.  She'll use the loan to buy fodder and to pay the rent on land.

Jeanett's dream is to buy land to grow alfalfa and other things so she doesn't have to rent for 2,000 bolivianos [BOB] per hectare.

This is the first time Jeanett has requested a loan from IMPRO and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fodder and to pay rent on land

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 24-year-old married father of two children. He is a Syrian citizen living and working in Lebanon since February, 2013. This is when he established his current bakery to earn a living and improve his family's socioeconomic situation.

Houssam is a well known, hard worker with a good reputation and special talents in his domain. He has a long experience in his domain. He is specialized in preparing the Lebanese traditional breakfast, manakish, which is folded dough with several different toppings served on customer request.

He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a display refrigerator. He needs this to diversify his products/selling and to increase his production. He hopes that he can develop his small bakery into a small restaurant in the future. He hopes to one day turn this into a well known restaurant which would be everyone's destination.

loans.use: to buy a display refrigerator for his bakery.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 24-year-old young man. He lives with his parents in a small village in the Kobuleti district. The only source of family income is from agricultural activities. They have a cow and small piece of land where they grow fruit. Irakli is unemployed at the moment.

As the existing income is not enough for the family, and Irakli can’t find a job, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Irakli applied for credit from MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and permits the rural poor to start or restart businesses.  

A loan of 1,200 GEL will help him to purchase a secondhand car. He will serve the local people as a taxi driver and transport them between cities. Irakli is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to help his parents to improve their living conditions. This credit will be a great support for the family. Irakli is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marissa is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marissa has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle. She has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Natia

texts.en: Natia, aged 33, is from the city Batumi. She is married with two children. Her father-in-law lives with the family as well. Natia's economic activity is her newly started store where she sells curtains, towels, and various clothes. Natia works as a salesperson from the rented commercial space. In order to increase sales and generate more income, Natia is requesting this loan. With the loan, she will go to Turkey (neighboring country) where prices are lower and buy stocks of merchandise in bulk. She will enlarge her store and offer a wide assortment of products to her customers.  Natia hopes the Kiva loan will be helpful for her business and her family's well being.

loans.use: to add stock of merchandise to her newly started store

loans.name: Mea Jiezel

texts.en: Mea Jiezel works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years.  Mea Jiezel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom is aged 25 years old and married. She is a mother of one child. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for five years and supplement their family’s income by working as garment workers and sometimes by working for others for a fee. The current business earns Sreymom about 18,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sreymom joined VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy ducks to raise in order to earn additional income for her family. She hopes this loan will enable her family to improve its standard of living.

loans.use: to raise ducks in order to earn additional income for her family

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun is a villager from a rural area located in the Takeo Province’s Trang district. She is 48 years old and married with five children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice and selling grocery items. Having been in this business for 30 years, she is able to earn about US $29 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Aun has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She repaid the previous loans which helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her son's tuition. She hopes this will help her to keep her son in school until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a 48-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children and has taken a loan for her daughter. She knits embroidery by hand at her home.

Zahida belongs to a poor family and each member is doing their part to earn money. Her daughter proved herself to be a brave woman and did not become a burden for her parents. She proved herself independent and is earning a sufficient income.

Zahida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Her daughter does not want to loose heart and wants to afford all household expenses with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her family.

Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is married and has three children. For the past 8 years, he has been running a retail business in his community, earning well enough to provide for his family's needs. 

Joey joined GDMPC recently and has borrowed a loan to buy additional motor spare parts and accessories for sale. Joey wants to improve and expand his business to have a stable source of income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional motor spare parts and accessories for sale

loans.name: Isam

texts.en: Isam is a married client from Iraq. He is 38 years old and a father of four children.  Isam is the only provider of the family and he works hard to provide for his children's tuition fees. Isam owns a garage and specializes in repairing vehicles. He established his business in 2002. He developed good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.  Isam is requesting a sum of $2,500 to pay the annual rent for his garage and to buy some assets. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so that he may be able to open a bigger garage one day and provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his garage and to buy some assets.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 32-year-old widowed lady who lives with her two children in the Bolnisi district. Her children are 12 and 13 years old and go to the local public school. Nana is a teacher at the school and she has a small monthly income. In addition, her children receive a pension from the government for being orphans.

Nana decided to start her business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $500 for trading clothes. She will go to Turkey and purchase a stock of clothes and then resell them in the Bolnisi district. Her income will increase and she will be able to provide better living conditions for her children. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Emzar lives in the village of Tchanieti. He is 47 years old, married, and lives with his wife and retired parents. Emzar’s wife earns a monthly income trading household items at an open market stall. Emzar is jobless at the moment and he’s decided to start a business to generate funds.

His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to country vulnerable poor. These individuals do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of their low income. With the received credit, Emzar will purchase a car and serve the local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase and Emzar will be able to improve the living conditions of the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Rosefilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosefilda works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Rosefilda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Rosefilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Diana  Alejandra

texts.es:
Diana tiene 19 años, vive con su esposo Oswaldo de 30, radican en Santo Domingo nueva provincia de la República del Ecuador; en casa de sus suegros. Oswaldo trabaja como chofer en una empresa  y Diana  hace un año emprendió en el negocio de la venta de arroz para ser ayuda en su hogar. Ambos se apoyan, en especial los fines de semana que es cuando salen a recorrer en carro de sus suegros a recintos aledaños a dejar su producto.  
Fundación Alternativa tuvo la oportunidad de ayudar a esta pareja de esposos, les ayudó con un crédito ya que solicitaban para comprar aceite y azúcar porque sus clientes también les piden este tipo de productos, están muy agradecidos por la ayuda brindada ya que están seguros que mejoraran sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, con estas ganancias ellos quieren luego comprar su propio vehículo para recorrer a mas sectores.
texts.en:
Diana is 19 years old and lives with her husband, 30 year old Oswaldo.  They live with her in laws in Santo Domingo Nueva province in Ecuador.  Oswaldo works as a driver for a company and Diana started a business selling rice to help out in the household.  Both support each other, especially on the weekends which is when they both go out in her in-laws’ car to nearby areas to deliver their product.

Fundación Alternativa had the opportunity to help this couple with a loan to buy cooking oil and sugar because their customers are requesting those types of products.  They are very grateful for the help and are certain that their income will increase and allow them to improve their quality of life.  These earnings will allow them to buy a car of their own so they can visit more areas.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Bojan

texts.en:
Bojan, 34, lives in a minority community with his family. He is a married father of two children, ages 3 and 7 years old. He is a hardworking person who works a lot to improve the family's life, while his wife is a stay-at-home mom caring for their children and home.

Bojan runs a cable TV business in his area and has been in this business for more than three years. He started with very simple equipment but has been fortunate enough to improve his business and profit so that he now provides TV channel broadcasting. He is requesting a loan for the first time to purchase tools to improve the quality of his equipment . This will help to increase the number of clients and help him to improve the business. His goal is to save money to ensure a better education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase tools to improve the quality of his cable equipment.

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en:
Mirjana lives in a minority community. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of two children, ages 7 and 11, who attend school. Mirjana's husband works in an electrical company. Mirjana has owned her own business, a cafe bar, for more than ten years. Since cafe bars are rare in her area, Mirjana is able to earn more profit. Her usual customers are the younger generation who have a good time drinking coffee. 

Mirjana is requesting a loan in order to buy new inventory and beverages to satisfy customer demand. She will also use the loan to buy a generator because the power is sometimes off, especially during the winter time, and she needs electricity in order to operate. These purchases will help her to better meet the needs of customers from all communities in her area. Mirjana hopes to save money for her children and their future. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy new inventory, beverages and a generator

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Doña Teodora, tiene 68 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 6 hijos y vive en el municipio de san Pedro Sula. Hace 10 años que doña Teodora se dedica al negocio de pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, cereales, pan, refrescos, productos de aseo, pastas, huevos y otros abarrotes. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 30,000 Lempiras y es el tercer ciclo con la institución, el cual lo  invertirá en la compra de granos básicos, refrescos,  azúcar, harina,  huevos, condimentos, manteca, jabón, pan,  y otros  abarrotes con el propósito de mantener surtido su negocio. Tiene como meta mantener  el negocio  surtido para generar más ganancias.
texts.en: Teodora is 68 years old. She is married, she has 6 children and she lives in the town of San Pedro Sula. For 10 years Teodora has worked for her grocery business where she sells food products like basic grains, sugar, butter, cereals, bread, drinks, pastas, eggs as well as cleaning products and other groceries. The loan she is seeking is for $1,475 and it is her third cycle with the institution. She will invest it in the purchase of basic grains, drinks, sugar, flour, eggs, condiments, butter, soap, bread and other groceries with the goal of stocking a variety of products within her store. Her goal is to keep the business stocked with a variety of items to generate more earnings.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, drinks, sugar, flour, eggs, condiments, butter, soap, bread and other groceries.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old single man who is responsible for supporting five members of his family. He has been running his own business since August 2011, and he is developing it in a well-managed way since it is his only source of income. Ali has a call center in his village. He is the only one who provides this service in his region, which supports him and pushes him forward to develop it as much as he can.

To move his business forward, Ali started providing money transfer services, which is highly requested in his region since most of the villagers have relatives outside Lebanon who work hard to support them through transferred cash on certain occasions and for many other reasons.

Today, Ali is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to start selling mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards, which will diversify his products and services to fulfill customers' needs and requests. Ali is planning in the future to continue expanding and developing his business through selling mobile phones and developing this business sector widely.

loans.use: to start selling mobile phone accessories and prepaid cards, which will diversify his products and services to fulfill customers' needs and requests.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 45-year-old married Syrian citizen, who is living and working in Lebanon. Randa established her home products selling business in March 2011 to make a living and meet her family's needs.

Randa is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise and diversify her products to provide her customers with a wide variety of products that will attract their attention and increase her income. She will also increase the items related to the Christmas season that are highly requested during this period. 

Randa hopes to expand her shop in order to meet almost all of her customers' needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise and diversify her products to provide her customers with a wide variety of products that will attract their attention and increase her income. She will also increase the items related to the Christmas season that are highly requested during this period.

loans.name: Gulputa

texts.en: Gulputa is 56 years old. She has three children. She is a very hardworking woman and she loves her job. In her region, her breads are very popular and because of that she has many customers. Gulputa has been working for 20 years in this business. Her main job is to bake bread which is called “Tendircoreyi” in Azerbaijani. She works without rest and her daughters help her in this work. Gulputa's monthly income is 120 AZN. Now she needs a loan of 1,500 AZN to open a new baker house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a new baker house

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 45 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the region of Jinja in Uganda. She is married and has four children, none of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Aidah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sodas, beers, and snacks. 

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to purchase more sodas, beers, and snacks, and will help Aidah to generate greater profits and improve the well-being of her family. Aidah hopes that in the future she will be able to own more branches. 

Aidah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Aidah, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas, beers, and snacks

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es:
Eustaquio realiza sanidad animal en la comunidad y junto al grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales; él se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

El vive en casa de sus propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras para incrementar su producción de leche y por ende sus ingresos.

El sueño de Eustaquio es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos, a la vez tener establos atemperados y ordeñadoras.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Eustaquio works in animal health in his and he and his group of people from the same community decided to care for the land and the animals. He works raising cattle for milk production which he sells in one of the Leche de la Paz industrial plants. The first step that he took was not tying up the cows nor keeping them penned up far from the pastures where they like to graze, nor cut off their horns. This way, they have calves naturally and the feed they  are given is fresh and of high quality, keeping the cows in good health. 

He lives in his own home located in the community of Pallina Chico, of the Viacha sector in the Ingavi province in the department of La Paz. It is one hour from the city of La Paz. He has several heads of local cattle which require better care because of the area's weather conditions. 

He needs the loan to buy a couple of dairy cows to increase milk production and therefore his income.

Eustaquio's dream is to increase his heads of cattle, caring for their good health and having milkers and warm barns. 

This is the first loan he has asked for a loan from IMPRO and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows to increase milk production and his income.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia es madre soltera ella se dedica a la agricultura y junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales; ella se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche del departamento de La Paz. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

Ella vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la comunidad de Pallina Chico, del Sector Viacha de La provincia Ingavi del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado criollas las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector y alimentacion. el crédito lo utilizará en la compra de una vaca lechera para incrementar su producción de leche y sus ingresos.

El sueño de Ofelia y su familia  es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellosy contar con grangas atemperadas.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Ofelia is a single mother. She works as a farmer and, together with a group of people from the same community, she decided to tend to the land and the animals. She works raising cattle who produce milk which she sells to the Industrial Milk Plants of the department of La Paz. The first step she takes is to not tie up the cows or keep them enclosed far from the fields where they like to graze, nor does she cut their horns. She lets the calves naturally den and the feed she provides them is fresh and high quality which keeps her cows in good health.

She lives in her parent's home, located in community of Pallina Chico in the Viacha Sector in the Province of Ingavi in the Department of La Paz which is an hour away from the city of La Paz. She has several heads of native cattle that require superior care because of the climate conditions in the region and their nutritional needs. She will use the loan to purchase a milk cow to increase her milk production and her earnings.

Ofelia and her family's dream is to increase their head of cattle, and to take care to keep them healthy and even tempered. 

This is the first time that she has sought a loan through IMPRO and the first time through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cowl to increase her milk production and her earnings.

loans.name: Elvia Cecilia Eloisa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Divas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Elvia, tiene 54 años de edad, está separada pero  de esa relación tiene un hijo el cual ya es  mayor de edad y vive en su casa.
Doña Elvia para salir adelante y para que a su hijo nunca le faltara nada hace muchos años adecuo un local en su casa y surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres, además de víveres  también vende productos de Avon y Yanbal  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Como a ella le gusta ir mejorando su vida es así que con las ganancias compro una moto taxi la cual la conduce su hijo y le sirve para que él se gane la vida y para ella le quede una ganancia extra, lo cual le ayuda a salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar víveres y productos Avon y Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante mejorando su local.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the borrowing group "Las Divas de Tosagua" meets in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic, and the majority of its citizens make a living in agriculture and in raising livestock; it is an area of lush vegetation. 

Elvia lives here.  She is fifty-four years old and is separated.  She has one son from this previous relationship; he is older and lives with her. 

In order to get herself ahead and to ensure that her son is never in want of anything, Elvia opened a small store in her home many years ago.  She stocked this small grocery store with food items and also with Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories).  Because she wanted to continue improving her life, she bought a moto-taxi with her profits.  Her son drives the taxi.  In doing this, he makes a living for himself and Elvia is able to have a bit of extra income, which helps them both move forward.  

Elvia is going to use this loan to stock her store.  She will buy food items and Avon and Yanbal products.  She has been involved with the communal bank for four years, and she likes the help and support that group members offer to one another.  Her goals are to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy food items and Avon products.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the ingredients and supplies for her business. Her previous loan also helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from her business helps meet her family's everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Ana would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy different ingredients such as flour, different spices, and supplies needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ana hopes to have a big stall for her business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients including flour, different spices, and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is married with five children. All of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Berna resides in the family home, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.  

Berna has a retail shop and has been in this business for 20 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and soda.  She works in the shop for seven days every week and sells on a retail basis. She generates additional income from rental houses. 

Berna's major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also aspires to own a wholesale shop. She decided to join MCDT SACCO since they don't charge transfer costs to send and receive money.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, and soda to sell.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда очень хорошая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она пережила очень тяжелую жизнь. После смерти мужа она осталась без кормильца с 6 детьми. Мавчуда имеет среднее медицинское образование. Мавчуда работает в местной больнице медсестрой. Она имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Мавчуда уже давно болеет. Она не имеет денег, чтобы лечиться. Последнее время она серьёзно больна. Ей срочно необходимо лечиться. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mavjuda is a very good and hardworking woman. She survived a very hard life. After her husband's death, she was left with six children and without a breadwinner.  Mavjuda has a secondary education in medicine.  Mavjuda works at a local hospital as a nurse. She earns additional income from raising cattle. 

Mavjuda has been ill for a long time but doesn't have the money to get treatment.  Recently, she has been seriously ill. She urgently needs to be treated. She has requested a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy drugs for treatment. She awaits for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy medicine to treat her illness

loans.name: Katya Yaoska

texts.es: Katya es una joven de 26 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 4 añitos por quien vela para darle sus estudios y bienestar, ella se dedica a vender ropa y cosméticos por encargos y en su casa, Katya está intentando salir adelante comercializando estos productos, con sus ingresos apoya a su hijo y cubre sus gastos del hogar. Solicita este primer crédito con el fin de invertir en pantalones y perfumes para damas y caballeros, cosméticos y ropa interior, espera que con esta inversión pueda crecer en inventario para ir captando mayor clientela y mejorar su economia.
texts.en: Katya is a 26 year old young woman.  She has a four year old son and she works so she can provide for his education and wellbeing.  She sells clothing and cosmetics to order from her home.  Katya is trying to get ahead by selling these products and she supports her son and covers the household expenses with her earnings.  She is asking for her first loan to buy men’s and women’s pants, perfumes, cosmetics, and undergarments.  She expects to be able to grow her inventory so she can capture more customers and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Narcisa has been in this business for five years.

Narcisa requested a 10000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough to provide secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 27-year-old hardworking man living in Hoima, Uganda. He operates a general merchandise shop. With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. He is a good father and desires to send his children to university. 

Robert would like to set up other sustainable income generating activities such as rental houses. Price fluctuations and high license fees limit his net profits. Robert's dream is to trade in wholesale. He intends to use the loan to buy salt, sugar, and match boxes to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, and match boxes to sell.

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel, who is from Iraq, is 64 years old, married, and the father of five children. He is the only provider for his family. 

Fadel is a carpenter, and he has been in this field for more than 20 years. He gained his experience by working at several carpentry shops as an employee. Fadel specializes in making furniture for bedrooms and living rooms. He established his own business in 1990. Fadel has gained a good reputation in his surrounding area thanks to his clean work and his affordable prices. 

Fadel is applying for a loan of $3000. He will use this loan to buy an electric saw that is specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to keep providing for his family and increase their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a specialized electric saw for work.

loans.name: Miodrag

texts.en:
Miodrag, 34 years old, lives in Kosovo in a minority community. He is married and is raising two school-aged children. Miodrag is a hardworking man, motivated by his children to keep going. He has owned a boutique, selling clothes and shoes for adults and children, for more than 5 years. Although Miodrag started by renting a small store selling clothing, he now has his own shop and his business has expanded. He is hoping to continue to expand it in the future so that it can become his main source of income.
 
Miodrag also works as a medical helper in a clinic and his wife works as a kindergarten teacher, so they are both quite busy.
